terms.name: Avro Schema File Extension
terms.description: The file extension for Avro JSON schema files. These files define the structure of Avro-serialized data. The avrolution gem recursively discovers .avsc files under a configured root directory for compatibility checking and registration.

terms.name: Computed Properties Decorator
terms.description: A legacy Ember.js decorator for creating derived properties that automatically update when their dependencies change. The fe-refactor-analyser flags components using @computed as candidates for refactoring to the modern @tracked pattern.

terms.name: Conductor Ember Package
terms.description: Helper Ember addon package for Conductor integration. Provides ConductorOutlet component for hosts, LinkOut component for external route navigation, conductor-shell-host blueprint for generating shell hosts, and development proxy server configuration. Supports both host and micro-app development workflows in Ember applications.

terms.name: Conductor Host Package
terms.description: NPM package containing the library for microfrontend hosts in the Conductor framework. Provides the Conductor class for instantiating a host with micro-app definitions, shared API configuration, mount point, and transition handling. Manages micro-app loading, lifecycle, stylesheet synchronization, and cleanup.

terms.name: Conductor Micro-app Package
terms.description: NPM package containing the library for micro-apps in the Conductor framework. Provides connectToHost() function to retrieve the active conductor host and access the host API. Enables micro-apps to get mount points, access domain-specific APIs, generate external URLs, and trigger transitions to host routes.

terms.name: Salsify Workflow Addon
terms.description: An Ember addon providing support for workflow-related development. Includes the WorkflowBulkOperations service for bulk task operations such as reassigning tasks, closing tasks, completing tasks, and adding entities to workflows. Triggers events like WORKFLOW_TASKS_REASSIGNED_EVENT, WORKFLOW_TASKS_CLOSED_EVENT, WORKFLOW_TASKS_COMPLETED_EVENT, and WORKFLOW_CREATED_EVENT.

terms.name: Salsify Workflow Exclaim Components
terms.description: A collection of Exclaim components for workflow. Exclaim is Salsify's declarative UI component system built on Ember (see ember-exclaim).

terms.name: Salsify Workflow Task Runtime
terms.description: An Ember addon providing the WorkflowTaskRuntime service with methods and eventing related to runtime tasks. Manages active task state, task sidebar visibility, and task URL generation. Provides utilities for integrating with host applications including query parameter synchronization and task sidebar rendering.

terms.name: Salsify Workflow UI Microfrontend
terms.description: A frontend microfrontend application for Workflow. Deployed independently and stays at version 0.0.0. Supports the unified GraphQL API powered by GraphQL Gateway. Runs locally at http://localhost:6500/shell-host/workflow-ui or integrated with Salsify UI via dandelion.

terms.name: Tracked Properties Decorator
terms.description: A modern Ember.js decorator that marks properties as reactive, replacing the older @computed decorator pattern. The fe-refactor-analyser uses the presence of @tracked vs @computed as a metric for determining component modernization status.

terms.name: CSS Modules Values
terms.description: A CSS Modules feature for exposing and importing data other than class names across module boundaries. Allows defining reusable values like colors (e.g., '@value primary-color: #8af') that can be imported in other CSS files and accessed from JavaScript via the styles object.

terms.name: $bind - Exclaim Environment Binding
terms.description: A special key in ember-exclaim UI configuration used to read from and write to the environment. Supports path notation (e.g., { "$bind": "foo.bar" }) for nested access. Automatically resolves when read or written, enabling two-way data binding between UI components and the environment.

terms.name: $component - Exclaim Component Directive
terms.description: A special key in ember-exclaim UI configuration used to invoke components that render content. The value specifies which component to look up in the implementationMap, and all other keys become the component's config. Example: { "$component": "text", "content": "Hello" }

terms.name: $helper - Exclaim Helper Directive
terms.description: A special key in ember-exclaim UI configuration used to invoke helpers that transform data without directly rendering content. The value specifies which helper function to look up in the implementationMap. Example: { "$helper": "join", "items": ["a", "b"], "separator": ", " }

terms.name: First Party
terms.description: A first-party relationship means the marketplace acts as the retailer and the brand is the wholesale supplier. Brand sells to Amazon, Amazon controls pricing.

terms.name: 1WorldSync
terms.description: A product data management company that delivers industry proven product information management systems, education and data synchronization implementation. Also abbreviated as 1WS.

terms.name: 1WorldSync (Abbreviation)
terms.description: Common abbreviation for 1WorldSync used throughout Salsify codebases and documentation. 1WorldSync is a product data management company that provides data synchronization services via the GDSN network.

terms.name: Two-Factor Authentication
terms.description: A security feature in Salsify that requires users to provide a second form of authentication beyond their password. Organization administrators can require two-factor authentication for all users in their organization via the security settings. Managed via the Settings UI security-settings section.

terms.name: 360 Images
terms.description: 360-degree, controllable images that simulate the experience of being able to look at all sides of a product while in a store.

terms.name: 360 Spin Images / Product Rotation Images
terms.description: A sequence of images captured from multiple angles around a product that, when displayed in sequence, creates an interactive 360-degree rotating view. Typically generated by rendering a 3D model of the product and capturing frames at regular rotation intervals (e.g., 90 frames for a full rotation).

terms.name: 360 Spinner Hackathon
terms.description: A hackathon project that generates product rotation images (360-degree spin images) from product label images. Uses Three.js to render 3D product models (boxes or cylinders) from front, back, left, right, and top images, then exports multiple frames as a downloadable ZIP file for creating 360-degree product views.

terms.name: Third Party
terms.description: A third-party relationship is when the brand is the retailer and sells directly to buyers via the marketplace. They handle fulfillment themselves or use programs like FBA.

terms.name: A/B Testing
terms.description: A randomized experiment with two variants (A and B) used to identify changes that increase or maximize an outcome of interest. Version A is typically the control, while version B is modified in some respect.

terms.name: A+ Content
terms.description: Enhanced, multimedia brand content on Amazon including high quality images, videos, and comparison charts. Available for 1P vendors. Also called 'Rich Media' or 'Enhanced Content'.

terms.name: Amazon A+ Content (Enhanced Content)
terms.description: Amazon's Enhanced Brand Content feature available through Amazon Vendor Central that allows brand owners to add rich product descriptions with enhanced images, text placements, and comparison charts to their Amazon product listings. Salsify provides tools and services to help customers create and manage A+ Content at scale.

links.description: A+ Content Browser Extension Confluence Page

terms.name: A+ Content Grade
terms.description: A quality score for A+ Content (enhanced brand content) on crawled product listings. Part of the content grading system in the timeseries-service used by the Analytics Team to evaluate product page quality.

terms.name: Amazon A10
terms.description: Amazon's search algorithm. Operates as a flywheel - the more robust a product page's content, the better sales rank, which drives more conversion in a positive feedback loop.

terms.name: Amazon Automated Content Submission
terms.description: A group of Amazon channels for automated content submission. Includes AFS (Amazon Feed Specification Channel for Amazon Vendor Central/1P), ATS (Automated Template Submission for Amazon Vendor Central scrapper), and ASC (Amazon Seller Central Channel for 3P selling).

terms.name: App Center Accelerator Application
terms.description: A type of application in the Salsify App Center that provides pre-configured solutions to speed up implementation for specific use cases or industries. Accelerators bundle together workflows, schemas, and configurations for rapid deployment. The Grocery Accelerator is an example of this application type.

terms.name: ACCESS EXCLUSIVE Lock
terms.description: The most restrictive lock mode in PostgreSQL, acquired during most DDL operations (ALTER TABLE, DROP TABLE, etc.). This lock conflicts with all other table-level locks, blocking all concurrent access to the table including SELECT queries. This can cause downtime if held for long periods or while waiting in the lock queue.

terms.name: Account Center UI
terms.description: An Ember.js frontend application for managing account-level information at Salsify. Can run standalone with mock data or be served through dandelion for production use. Uses GraphQL to communicate with the dandelion backend and follows Salsify's continuous deployment practices for microfrontends.

terms.name: AccountIQ - Account Intelligence Dashboard
terms.description: An internal Salsify dashboard system for account intelligence. Tracks metrics including catalog usage, digital assets, product views, user activity, publishes, login patterns by country, and human workflow tasks. Data tables are refreshed via the lake-supportiq repository's SQL scripts and Athena queries.

terms.name: Access Control List
terms.description: A permissions mechanism in Salsify that controls user access to specific data. ACL policies can restrict access to products, digital assets, and locales. ACL policy configurations can be exported and imported via CSV or XLSX files. Part of the broader security policy system managed via the Settings UI.

terms.name: GraphQL Schema Compatibility Check Action
terms.description: A GitHub Action that detects public or unsafe GraphQL schema changes in pull requests. Compares GraphQL schemas between base and head commits, flagging breaking changes (field removals, type changes, etc.) and dangerous changes (new enum values, interface additions). Integrates with Salsify's Data Lake to provide links to impacted clients via Redash queries. Supports federated schemas, public/private API scopes, and admin schemas. PRs with unsafe changes require the 'Approved Unsafe GraphQL Change' label, and public API changes require the 'Approved Public GraphQL Change' label. Integrates with the Data Lake for GraphQL usage metrics to provide accurate breaking/dangerous change annotations.

terms.name: GraphQL Schema Compatibility Action Test Repository
terms.description: A sample project used for manually testing the action-check-graphql-schema-compatibility GitHub Action. Contains a test workflow and sample GraphQL schema files to verify that the action correctly detects public or unsafe GraphQL schema changes in pull requests. Used during development to validate changes before releasing the main action.

terms.name: Detect and Tag New Version GitHub Action
terms.description: A GitHub Action that detects new versions of a repository based on changes in its contents between commits and creates git tags accordingly. Supports automatic version detection from package.json or .gemspec files, or custom version commands. Commonly used in CI/CD pipelines to automate semantic version tagging when version files change.

terms.name: Action Download from S3
terms.description: A GitHub Action that downloads files from an AWS S3 bucket to a repository. Uses AWS CLI to perform recursive S3 copy operations. Adapted from the s3-sync-action pattern for downloading content during CI/CD workflows.

terms.name: Action Release Gem
terms.description: A GitHub Action for automatically releasing Ruby gems when their version changes. Creates GitHub releases with changelogs and supports publishing to both RubyGems.org (for public gems) and gems.salsify.com via Artifactory (for private gems). Note: This action is public only because GitHub doesn't support shared private actions, but it is intended for internal Salsify use.

terms.name: Actionable Insights
terms.description: In data analytics, refers to information that can be acted upon or information that gives clarity to decision makers about which actions should be taken.

terms.name: Activate Channel Onboarding Workflow
terms.description: Script to automate the steps involved for activating a channel with an onboarding workflow and smart lists in an organization. Creates Amazon Vendor Central channel, sets up Smart Lists for accepted/rejected products, imports and triggers the onboarding workflow, and sends confirmation emails to assignees.

terms.name: Activation
terms.description: The mechanism used at Salsify to syndicate customized content to a retail endpoint.

terms.name: Activation Validator
terms.description: Service for validation of Dandelion Channel publication payloads. Provides rules-based validation at product batch, product, and attribute levels. Features an admin UI for managing validation rules and domains, plus an API for triggering validation runs. Supports AI-powered validations including style guide checks and nutrient label extraction.

terms.name: Active Record Lax Includes
terms.description: A Ruby gem that provides a hotfix for nested eager loading with polymorphic and STI (Single Table Inheritance) relations in ActiveRecord. By default, ActiveRecord raises an error when trying to eager load an association that doesn't exist. This gem provides a block-based API (ActiveRecord::lax_includes) that filters out records with missing associations instead of raising errors, which is useful when working with polymorphic associations or STI hierarchies where not all subclasses have the same associations.

terms.name: ActiveRecord
terms.description: The Object-Relational Mapping (ORM) layer in Ruby on Rails that connects business objects and database tables. It provides a rich API for querying, creating, updating, and deleting records, as well as defining relationships between models. Salsify uses ActiveRecord extensively as part of its Rails-based backend.

terms.name: ActiveRecord Extensions
terms.description: A Ruby gem providing a collection of ActiveRecord extensions used across Salsify applications. Includes utilities for database notifications (PostgreSQL), transaction management, health checks, bulk model imports, Salsify UUID integration, multi-tenant organization scoping, sequence readers, query analysis, and soft-delete functionality. Ruby gem providing Salsify-specific ActiveRecord extensions including health check connectivity tests for PostgreSQL.

terms.name: ActiveRecord-ForbidImplicitCheckout
terms.description: A Ruby gem that allows a Thread to prevent itself from checking out an ActiveRecord connection. Useful for preventing applications from accidentally checking out more database connections than the database can handle. Provides safeguards for multi-threaded code that should not access the database, raising ActiveRecord::ImplicitConnectionForbiddenError if an implicit connection checkout is attempted.

terms.name: ActiveRecord Import
terms.description: A Ruby library for bulk inserting data using ActiveRecord. Fork of zdennis/activerecord-import maintained by Salsify. Extracts the ActiveRecord::Base#import functionality from ar-extensions for Rails 3 and beyond. Key feature is following ActiveRecord associations and generating minimal SQL insert statements, avoiding the N+1 insert problem. Can convert millions of individual SQL statements into just a few bulk inserts, dramatically improving performance for batch processes.

terms.name: ActiveRecord Safer Migrations
terms.description: A Ruby gem that provides safer ActiveRecord migrations for PostgreSQL by automatically setting lock_timeout and statement_timeout on migration connections. This prevents long-held ACCESS EXCLUSIVE locks from causing downtime during DDL operations. Default timeouts are 750ms for lock_timeout and 1500ms for statement_timeout, both configurable.

terms.name: JsonModels ActiveRecord Mixin
terms.description: A module that extends ActiveRecord models with JSON model attribute support via the nested_json_model method. Handles proper parentage of nested JSON models through reload, dup, and save operations. Provides automatic coercion from hashes to model objects and validation of nested models.

terms.name: ActiveRecord Store
terms.description: The cache store class provided by activesupport-db-cache (ActiveSupport::Cache::ActiveRecordStore) that stores cache data in a database table called cache_items. Configured via config.cache_store in Rails environment files.

terms.name: ActiveSupport DB Cache
terms.description: A Ruby gem that provides an ActiveRecord database store engine for ActiveSupport::Cache. Useful for lower-traffic applications where a separate cache server like Memcache or Redis is not needed. Features include cache persistence across Rails restarts, per-item expiration with :expire_in option, automatic cleanup when reaching row limits (5000 max), support for external databases, and a debug mode for profiling cache usage.

terms.name: ActiveSupport Cache
terms.description: A caching framework provided by Rails' ActiveSupport library that offers a unified API for caching operations. It supports multiple cache store backends including memory stores, file stores, Memcache, Redis, and database-backed stores like activesupport-db-cache.

terms.name: Activity Report
terms.description: A Salsify feature for generating reports on user activity and product record changes. Activity reports can be configured to track specific action types, event types, properties, channels, and users. Reports support scheduling, historical tracking, and filtering by various criteria. Data is stored and queried via the Audits service. Managed via the Settings UI activity-reports section.

terms.name: Salsify Kafka Actor Framework
terms.description: A component of salsify_kafka that allows clients to asynchronously process Kafka messages while ensuring that messages for a given actor are processed serially and in order. Handles organization-level worker fairness, retrying failed jobs with exponential back-off, long-running jobs that exceed Kafka session timeout, and metrics/monitoring. Uses Redis for message queuing and coordination. Framework within salsify_kafka for processing Kafka events. Provides ordered execution (FIFO for same-key events), batching, best-effort deduplication, and integrated telemetry. Requires Redis and PostgreSQL. Recommended for inter-service asynchronous work triggered by Kafka events. A framework provided by the salsify_kafka library for processing Kafka events using the actor model. Used by the Alerts Service to handle subscription events and send notifications. Enables concurrent message processing with proper isolation.

terms.name: Actor Worker
terms.description: A component of the salsify_kafka Actor Framework that processes pending events for a given actor. Delegates to client-provided handlers for performing the real work of processing messages. Can be run via the rake task 'actors:work'.

terms.name: Annual Contract Value
terms.description: The total annualized revenue from a customer contract. Used to measure the value of customer agreements.

terms.name: Addon Layout Migrator
terms.description: A codemod tool for migrating Ember addons to the new project layout proposed in ADR 350. Provides two subcommands: 'migrate-layout' to rearrange pod-based components into component-template colocation format with namespaced app reexports, and 'migrate-usage' to update imports and template invocations in consuming apps/addons from legacy namespace format (addon@component) to Ember-standard subdirectory format (addon/component).

terms.name: Admin - GitHub Repository Configuration
terms.description: A repository containing configurations to manage GitHub repositories in the Salsify organization. Uses the safe-settings app (deployed via github-settings-bot) to apply organization-wide defaults and individual repository settings. Configuration files are stored under .github/settings.yml for global defaults and .github/repos/$repo.yml for individual repository settings. A Salsify GitHub repository that stores all GitHub repository configuration settings used by safe-settings. Contains the declarative configuration files that define repository settings, branch protection rules, and other GitHub configurations for Salsify repositories.

terms.name: Admin Audits Helpers
terms.description: Muffin helper methods providing lazy pagination of the admin audits API for accessing the Audits Service. Supports querying audit events and modifications for products and digital assets, with filtering by item type, event types, date ranges, action types (imports, bulk_edits, changesets), and more. Returns granular property value changes with timestamps and user information.

terms.name: Admin Console UI
terms.description: Frontend client for the Salsify admin section found at app.salsify.com/admin. Split out from the dandelion monolith repo. Provides administrative interfaces for managing organizations, users, OAuth applications, tokens, audits, config manifests, target schemas, and superuser management. Uses GraphQL to communicate with multiple backend services including dandelion, audits, config-manifests, and the unified-admin graph.

terms.name: Account Development Representative
terms.description: Partners with Enterprise and Strategic Upsell Sales Teams. One of the two types of XDRs at Salsify.

terms.name: Architecture Decision Records
terms.description: A document that captures an important architectural decision made along with its context and consequences. At Salsify, ADRs are stored in the adrs repository and organized by domain (Activation, Administration, Analytics, etc.). Each ADR follows a standard template and is named with a date prefix for chronological ordering. Short markdown documents that detail architectural decisions at Salsify. ADRs capture context, decisions, consequences, and alternatives considered. Stored in GitHub using the pull request process. Filenames are prefixed with date in YYYY-MM-DD format. ADRs are immutable once merged; changes require amendments. At Salsify, ADRs are stored in the salsify/adrs repository and go through pull request review. ADR 350 specifically proposes a new addon project layout for Ember addons. Documentation that captures important architectural decisions made during software development, including context, decision, and consequences. Write up of changes on the platform. Used to propose, discuss and get feedback on designs.

terms.name: Architecture Decision Records Repository
terms.description: A centralized repository containing Architecture Decision Records (ADRs) for Salsify engineering teams. Organized by domain areas including Activation, Administration, Analytics, Audits, Commerce, Connections, D2C, Digital Experiences Platform, Frontend Ecosystem, GDSN, GraphQL, Infrastructure, Item Repository, Orchestration, SXM, and more. Provides historical context for architectural decisions, design rationale, and technical choices across the platform. GitHub repository where Salsify tracks Architecture Decision Records. Contains ADRs organized by area/domain with a README linking to all ADRs. Includes templates for creating new ADRs.

terms.name: Advance Platform Editions
terms.description: Salsify platform edition feature flags: salsify_legacy, advance_core, advance_enterprise, and advance_enterprise_plus. Used purely for UI display of platform edition, not for enabling/disabling features.

terms.name: Advance ARR - Advanced Channel Mapping Experience
terms.description: An enhanced user interface and set of GraphQL APIs for target schema channel mapping. Part of the 'Expressivity' initiative to improve the user mapping experience by making the UI more expressive. Includes support for complex nested structures like ArrayMappingEntry and StructMappingEntry for mapping product data to retailer-specific formats.

terms.name: Account Executive
terms.description: Sales professional responsible for managing customer relationships and closing deals

terms.name: Amazon Feed Specification Channel
terms.description: Amazon Vendor Central / 1P channel where brands sell stock directly to Amazon. Covers Amazon Hardlines (items that don't change with time like mugs, tables) and Amazon Softlines (items that rotate throughout the year like clothes, apparel). A data interchange standard established by Amazon to enable suppliers to automate item lifecycle management and procurement. Enables API functionality for Amazon Vendor Central.

terms.name: Agencies
terms.description: Partners that create content (like Onespace)

terms.name: AI Scout Squad
terms.description: A Salsify team focused on exploring and prototyping AI capabilities. Develops proof-of-concept projects using OpenAI, LangChain, and other AI/ML tools to evaluate potential applications for Salsify products.

terms.name: AI Pathfinding Projects
terms.description: A repository for AI pathfinding experimental projects at Salsify, tagged with [APES]. Contains experimental MCP (Model Context Protocol) servers and tools for AI-driven product exploration, including an Open Catalog MCP server that enables agentic product search via Salsify's GraphQL API.

terms.name: AI Pathfinding Salsify MCP Server
terms.description: An experimental MCP (Model Context Protocol) server developed by the APES (AI Pathfinding Squad) team. Provides a standardized interface for connecting AI assistants to Salsify systems and data sources.

terms.name: AI Scout Squad POCs
terms.description: A collection of proof-of-concept scripts using OpenAI libraries, developed by the AI Scout Squad. Includes experiments with langchain, openai, chromadb, guidance, and transformers. Uses Poetry for dependency management and integrates with Salsify's Azure OpenAI instance (OpenAI-Scout).

terms.name: Alert Subscription
terms.description: A subscription created in the Item Repository (Dandelion) that corresponds to an alert in the Alerts Service. Uses the same triggering configuration as the alert and publishes product/digital asset change events to the alert_subscription_events Kafka topic. Leverages Elasticsearch percolate queries to match product changes against subscription filters.

terms.name: AlertManager - Prometheus Alerting System
terms.description: A component of the Prometheus monitoring stack that handles alerts sent by Prometheus server. At Salsify, AlertManager configuration is customized per environment in templates/alertmanager-config/<environment>.yaml files. Uptime is monitored via StatusCake push alerts forwarded to PagerDuty.

terms.name: Alerts Service
terms.description: A Grape/Ruby on Rails microservice that powers the alerts functionality in Salsify, allowing users to subscribe to adds, updates, or deletes of a filtered set of products or digital assets. Alert notifications are sent via webhooks or emails. Uses Kafka for event-driven communication with other services and maintains synchronized subscriptions with the Item Repository (Dandelion). Uses continuous deployment (CD) where commits on master are automatically deployed to production.

terms.name: Alexa App
terms.description: An Amazon Alexa skill integration that allows users to query Salsify product data using voice commands. Built on the Alexa Skills Kit, it connects to the Salsify Product API to retrieve product information such as descriptions, inventory, and custom properties. Users can ask questions like 'Ask Salsify about product 123' or 'What is the color of product 123' to get product details via voice interface.

terms.name: Alfred Salsify OrgLookup
terms.description: An Alfred workflow for macOS that allows Salsify engineers to quickly find and copy Salsify organization IDs. Supports searching orgs by name, external ID, or system ID, and provides keyboard shortcuts to copy different ID formats. Requires a Salsify superuser API token for authentication.

terms.name: Alkemics Environment
terms.description: Environment variable (alk_env) used in SXM terraform modules to configure Alkemics-related infrastructure in Azure environments. Alkemics was acquired by Salsify and its infrastructure is managed through terraform SXM modules including alk-services application security groups.

terms.name: Alkemics Connector
terms.description: Salsify connector service for Alkemics, a European product data syndication platform. This repository contains two main components: (1) a Target Schema Generator that parses Alkemics field templates (Excel spreadsheets) to create Salsify target schemas, and (2) a Connector Service that transforms Salsify product data into XML feeds and uploads them via SFTP to Alkemics. The service listens on a message queue for publication batches and handles the end-to-end workflow of generating feeds and notifying users via email.

terms.name: Alkemics
terms.description: A European product data syndication platform that enables brands and retailers to exchange product information. Alkemics serves as a data pool similar to GDSN, allowing suppliers to share rich product content with retail partners. Salsify integrates with Alkemics via a connector that generates XML feeds conforming to the Alkemics schema specification. A French company providing a data exchange platform (SaaS) that connects brands with retailers for sharing product information in the consumer goods industry. Salsify has integrations with Alkemics for product data syndication.

terms.name: Alkemics SFDC Prod
terms.description: Salesforce DX project containing production Salesforce customizations for the Alkemics integration. Alkemics is a data exchange platform for brands and retailers in the consumer goods industry. This repository manages Apex classes, Lightning Web Components (LWC), Aura components, flows, triggers, and other Salesforce metadata for the Alkemics-Salsify integration.

terms.name: Allochory - Paired Down Job Runner Framework
terms.description: A paired down job runner framework using ActiveRecord and Sinatra, with Postgres as the assumed database. The name allochory describes seed dispersal aided by outside forces (wind/water/etc.), representing how integrations with Salsify assist in spreading information as a form of techno allochory. Supports background job processing via Delayed Job.

terms.name: Always Verify SSL Certificates
terms.description: A Ruby gem that monkey-patches net/http to force SSL certificate verification and make turning it off impossible. By default, Ruby's net/http never verifies SSL certificates, exposing applications to man-in-the-middle attacks. This gem ensures certificate verification is always enabled when making HTTPS connections.

terms.name: Account Manager
terms.description: Post-onboarding point of contact at Salsify who manages customer relationships

terms.name: Amadeus - Target Schema Composition Tool
terms.description: A Ruby gem that provides tools for composing and decomposing Salsify JSON Target Schemas and import/export formats. Supports serialization of Target Schemas to JSON for uploading to Dandelion, deserialization from JSON or Excel formats back to Amadeus objects, and includes helpers for fields, field values, picklists, and applicable scopes. Can handle parent/child variant concepts and field conditions.

terms.name: Amadeus - Legacy Target Schema Tool
terms.description: A Salsify tool developed primarily by SolEng (Solutions Engineering) for composing Target Schemas and generating their JSON representation. Predecessor to YACHTS. Limited by direct manipulation of TSDL data structures, making it harder to update the schema definition language or add global optimizations.

terms.name: Amazon Consumables Category
terms.description: Amazon product category for food and drinks. Covered by ATS (Automated Template Submission) channel.

terms.name: Amazon Hardlines Category
terms.description: Amazon product category for items that don't change with time (e.g., mugs, tables). Covered by the AFS (Amazon Feed Specification) channel.

terms.name: Amazon Softlines Category
terms.description: Amazon product category for items that rotate throughout the year (e.g., clothes, apparel). Covered by the AFS (Amazon Feed Specification) channel.

terms.name: Amazon SPDS Unified AVC US English
terms.description: The state-of-the-art Amazon Target Schema used in the Enumerated Embeddings experiment. Contains the product_type Classifier field which was selected for testing because it had high Customer Value Mapping entry counts.

terms.name: Amazon ASIN Change POC
terms.description: A proof-of-concept Elixir application to subscribe to and log messages from an Amazon SQS queue. Amazon publishes SQS alert messages whenever a product page changes, and this service subscribes to these messages and acknowledges receipt.

terms.name: Amazon SPDS APIs Client (Deprecated)
terms.description: A deprecated Ruby client library for Amazon's Selling Partner Developer Services (SPDS) APIs. This repository is no longer maintained and has been superseded by salsify_amazon. Originally provided integration with Amazon's seller partner services for product data syndication.

terms.name: Amazon SPDS API Example
terms.description: Example repository demonstrating how to connect to Amazon's Selling Partner API (SP-API) using Ruby. Shows OAuth self-authorization workflow and AWS V4 signature request signing using the oauth2 gem with Faraday and faraday-middleware-aws-sigv4.

terms.name: Amazon Authorization
terms.description: An Authorization type in the commerce-config-service specifically for Amazon Seller Central accounts. Allows Salsify to programmatically access customer's Amazon Seller Central account for O+I syncing.

terms.name: Amazon Machine Image
terms.description: Pre-configured virtual machine images used for launching EC2 instances. In Salsify, AMIs follow the naming convention 'salsify-<purpose>-<env>-{{timestamp}}' and are built using Packer. Examples include k8s-stag for Kubernetes staging and awslinuxgolden for general AWS Linux golden images.

terms.name: Amazon Marketing Services
terms.description: Provides tools to vendors to help them stand out against their competitors and drive traffic to their product pages

terms.name: AMZ Utils
terms.description: A Ruby utility script for extracting Amazon product data from S3. Specifically designed to pull Amazon Vendor Central (AVC) published product data and ASIN information from Salsify's S3 buckets (salsify-ce and salsify-amazon-feeds-endpoint), transform the data, and export it as CSV reports.

terms.name: Analytics Exports
terms.description: Production analytics data that has been whitelisted for services use at Salsify. These exports are moved into the datalake for consumption by Athena and services-built reporting systems.

terms.name: Analytics Reports Client
terms.description: A Muffin client for uploading reports to the Salsify Insights tab. Posts CSV files to the salsify-analytics-reports-api service with metadata about report type and name. Requires creating a new report type in the target organization before uploading. Used for custom analytics and reporting workflows.

terms.name: Analytics Exports Production Athenafy
terms.description: Moves Production analytics exports that have been whitelisted for services use into the datalake such that it can be consumed by Athena and services built reporting. Enables analytics data to be queried via AWS Athena for reporting purposes.

terms.name: Analytics Keyword Service
terms.description: A Python-based microservice for extracting SEO keywords from text content. Uses NLTK (Natural Language Toolkit) and TextBlob for natural language processing to identify relevant keywords and phrases from product descriptions and other text. Provides a REST API endpoint that accepts text and returns extracted keywords for SEO optimization purposes.

terms.name: Analytics Reporting UI
terms.description: An Ember engine for in-app analytics reporting at Salsify. Provides dashboards and reporting interfaces including Buy Box analytics. Integrates with Dandelion for data and uses ember-cli-mirage for mock APIs during development. Runs on port 6404 locally and features continuous deployment for production.

terms.name: Analytics Reports API
terms.description: A Rails application that provides analytics and reporting capabilities for Salsify. It serves as a GraphQL API (part of Salsify's unified supergraph) for managing reports, dashboards, widgets, and report grids. The service handles retailer-specific analytics data, report configurations, and integrates with Content Flow for action flow templates. Runs on port 30000 in development.

terms.name: Analytics Scripts
terms.description: A collection of miscellaneous helper scripts used by the Analytics Team. Includes tools for managing Insights Target Schemas, clearing CPDS cache, scaling report engine workers, reading channel publish schedules, and updating Reviews Target Schema configurations.

terms.name: Angie - Salsify AI Assistant
terms.description: Salsify's AI-powered assistant that helps users with tasks such as formula generation, troubleshooting, and other Salsify-related questions. Conversations with Angie can be analyzed for success rates and user interaction patterns.

terms.name: Angie Analysis Scripts
terms.description: Scripts to analyze Angie conversations for success rates and user interaction patterns. Uses both deterministic analysis (keyword detection, pattern matching, structural analysis, intent classification) and LLM-based evaluation with Claude to assess conversation success scores, sentiment, and resolution outcomes.

terms.name: Anvil - Heroku Build Server
terms.description: A generic build server for Heroku that allows testing buildpacks. Used with the anvil-cli gem and heroku-anvil CLI plugin to test buildpack functionality before deployment.

terms.name: AI Pathfinding Experimental Squad
terms.description: A Salsify team or initiative focused on experimental AI pathfinding projects. Projects tagged with [APES] explore innovative AI-driven approaches to product data management, including MCP servers for agentic workflows and product exploration tools. A Salsify engineering squad focused on AI exploration and pathfinding. The squad maintains experimental repositories for sharing, experimenting, and versioning exploratory code related to AI initiatives.

terms.name: APES Explorations - AI Pathfinding Squad Sandbox
terms.description: A sandbox repo for APES (AI Pathfinding Squad) to share, experiment, and version exploratory code. Nothing here is production-ready - just experiments that may be picked up or left behind.

terms.name: Application Programming Interface
terms.description: A software intermediary that allows two applications to talk to each other. The messenger that delivers your request to the provider and returns the response.

terms.name: API Gateway - Kubernetes Ingress Controller
terms.description: A Kubernetes-based component in the Salsify infrastructure that handles authentication, rate limiting, and routing for incoming API requests. Deployed in a dedicated namespace within the production Kubernetes cluster, serving as the entry point for all microservices.

terms.name: API Gateway
terms.description: Routes all incoming external traffic to Salsify services. Provides path-based routing on app.salsify.com, superuser authentication for admin UIs, and abstracts internal service details from callers.

terms.name: Apollo Engine
terms.description: A cloud service (now part of Apollo Studio) for monitoring and managing GraphQL APIs. Provides schema management, performance tracking, and analytics. The graphql-schema-hash tool generates hashes in a manner compatible with Apollo Engine's hashing algorithm.

terms.name: Apollo Router (Salsify Fork)
terms.description: Experimental fork of the Apollo GraphQL Router, a high-performance graph router written in Rust for running federated supergraphs using Apollo Federation 2. At Salsify, the Apollo Router is used as the core routing component in the GraphQL Gateway, handling query planning and request routing across multiple GraphQL subgraphs. This fork allows Salsify to customize and experiment with router behavior for specific needs.

terms.name: Salsify App Center
terms.description: The central marketplace and management hub within Salsify for discovering, installing, and managing applications. Applications in the App Center are categorized as Accelerators, Extensions, Integrations, Modules, or Retailer Destinations. The App Center supports various installation methods including manual installation and workflow type link installation.

terms.name: Salsify App Store
terms.description: A marketplace for Salsify applications and integrations. Allows partners and internal teams to publish installable apps that can be self-service installed by customers. Built on the Configuration Manifests system with state machine execution for installation workflows.

terms.name: App Center Service
terms.description: Backend service that powers Salsify's App Center. Provides the server-side functionality for the App Center marketplace, including application management, installation tracking, and app discovery APIs. Works in conjunction with app-center-ui to deliver the complete App Center experience.

terms.name: App Center UI
terms.description: Ember microfrontend for installing and managing Salsify applications via the Salsify App Center. Provides the user interface for browsing, installing, and managing applications including integrations, extensions, modules, accelerators, and retailer destinations. Uses GraphQL Gateway for data fetching and supports running in isolation with dummy data or in tandem with Dandelion for standard APIs.

terms.name: Applicable Retailers - Clavis TS Field
terms.description: A required classifier field in the Clavis target schema that lists all retailers a product is sold at. Contains an enumerated list of retailer names as field values, used to scope other fields in the schema based on which retailers are selected.

terms.name: Applicable Scope
terms.description: A Target Schema concept in Salsify Tailor that defines conditions under which a field is applicable. Applicable Scopes support product type filtering (child, parent, or nil), field conditions, multi-conditional scenarios (multiple unrelated criteria), and grouping conditionals. Used to specify when certain fields should be shown or required based on product classification or other field values. Can be tied to variant concepts (parent/child product types), external IDs, and specific values. Used to create conditional visibility and requirements in Target Schemas.

terms.name: Approverang
terms.description: A service similar to Boomerang that provides a designated person (like a category owner at the brand) with an opportunity to approve or reject the publish of products before they are sent to the retailer.

terms.name: Amazon Retail Analytics
terms.description: A tool provided by Amazon to help brands understand and improve their operational performance. Two tiers: Basic (automatic) and Premium (additional fee).

terms.name: Analytics Reports API
terms.description: Internal acronym for the analytics-reports-api service. A Rails application providing GraphQL-based analytics and reporting capabilities including dashboards, widgets, report grids, and retailer-specific insights.

terms.name: ArcFurnace - ETL Data Transformation Library
terms.description: A Ruby gem that simplifies ETL (Extract, Transform, Load) tasks for small to medium data sets using a programmatic DSL interface. ArcFurnace melts, melds, and transforms scrap data into crafted data for application ingest or analysis. Provides Pipeline, Source, Hash, Join, Filter, Transform, Unfold, Observer, and Sink node types for building directed acyclic graph data transformations. Supports CSV and Excel sources out of the box.

terms.name: ArcFurnace - CSV Builder
terms.description: A Salsify tool used for building CSV files in integration workflows. Used in the Essendant integration to create manifest files listing products and their associated digital assets for export.

terms.name: Annual Recurring Revenue
terms.description: The value of the recurring revenue of a business's term subscriptions normalized for a single calendar year. Key metric for SaaS businesses. The annualized recurring revenue from subscription-based customers. A key metric for SaaS business health.

terms.name: Artifactory - Artifact Repository
terms.description: A universal artifact repository manager used at Salsify for storing build artifacts. Used for Go binaries (via goreleaser), Ruby gems, and NPM packages. Jenkins pipelines publish to Artifactory for internal distribution. Node services use YARN_NPM__SALSIFY__COM for Artifactory credentials during Docker builds. A private artifact repository used by Salsify for storing and managing library releases. Library Release Tool publishes gems and NPM packages to Artifactory as one of its supported repository targets. Salsify's internal package repository at repo. com for hosting RubyGems and NPM packages. Used for sharing internal libraries between projects.

terms.name: Artifactory Authentication String
terms.description: A secret credential used to authenticate with gems.salsify.com (Salsify's private Artifactory-hosted gem server) when releasing private Ruby gems.

terms.name: Applicability Statement 2
terms.description: An EDI (Electronic Data Interchange) protocol specification for secure and reliable transport of business documents over the internet using HTTP/S. Used by Salsify for B2B data exchange with retail partners. AS2 provides message encryption, digital signatures, and delivery receipts (MDN). Salsify maintains AS2 certification through Drummond Group testing. A secure data transmission protocol used for exchanging GDSN messages. In gdsn_gateway, AS2 is one of the available communication channels, supporting encryption, digital signatures, and Message Disposition Notifications (MDN). Configuration includes certificates for encryption and signing, security algorithms, and async MDN support. A specification for Electronic Data Interchange (EDI) between businesses using HTTP/S protocol. Used by the con-one-world-sync connector to securely exchange messages with 1WorldSync. Requires certificate management for both Salsify and 1WS partner certificates. A specification for secure and reliable electronic data interchange over the internet. Used in GDSN for communication between data pools. Puddle uses AS2 proxy for sending messages to recipient data pools and the Global Registry.

terms.name: AS2 Certification Repository
terms.description: Repository containing all code, infrastructure, and documentation for Salsify's AS2 protocol certification with Drummond Group. Includes three main components: the InSitu client, the Hermes server application, and AWS provisioning scripts. Used for achieving and maintaining EDI AS2 compliance certification.

terms.name: Amazon Seller Central Channel
terms.description: The web interface used by brands and merchants to market and sell their products directly to Amazon's customers through their marketplaces. Third-party (3P) seller system. Amazon Seller Central / 3P channel where brands or people sell products through Amazon's marketplace rather than directly to Amazon.

terms.name: ASE - Application Solutions Engineer
terms.description: Salsify team members who work on Target Schema requests. TASER creates Jira tickets with ASE checklists and structured data to help them build Target Schemas based on customer requirements. The TSR workflow automates much of the data interpretation and copying that ASEs previously had to do manually. An engineer role focused on supporting applications and customers, often working with the Support team to resolve technical issues.

terms.name: asheehan-claude-stuff - Claude Code Configuration Repository
terms.description: A repository containing custom commands, skills, and scripts for Claude Code workflows at Salsify. Includes setup guides, configuration patterns, and best practices for context engineering. Maintained by Adam Sheehan. Provides guidance on working with the Salsify Claude account and Jellyfish Bearer token integration for reporting.

terms.name: Amazon Standard Identification Number
terms.description: Unique blocks of 10 numbers and/or letters that identify an item on Amazon. For books, ASIN equals ISBN; for other products, a separate ASIN is created. Amazon's unique identifier for products in their catalog. Used for product correlation and mapping in Salsify connectors.

terms.name: Aspect Ratio
terms.description: The ratio between the width and height of an image or video. For example, square is 1:1 because the sides are equal. Typically video is 16:9.

terms.name: Abstract Syntax Tree
terms.description: A tree representation of the syntactic structure of source code or parsed text. In Parslet, transformers are used to generate ASTs from parsed input. The tree abstracts away syntactic details (like parentheses) while preserving the hierarchical structure and meaning of the parsed content.

terms.name: Add To Basket
terms.description: An ecommerce action where a customer adds a product to their shopping basket/cart.

terms.name: ATC - Add to Cart
terms.description: An analytics event in the Enhanced Content pipeline indicating when a user adds a product to their shopping cart. Used as a conversion metric to measure the effectiveness of Enhanced Content. Tracked both with and without EC views to compare conversion rates.

terms.name: AWS Athena - Query Service
terms.description: Amazon's serverless query service used by Salsify's Data Lake API to run SQL queries against data stored in S3. The data-lake-api uses athena-express library to execute queries and stores results in S3 buckets like 'salsify-lake-dev-kellyfox-athena'. Athena environments are prefixed (e.g., 'zzzdev_jwb_') for database isolation. Used via the Athena web console, DataGrip, the Athens Ruby gem, or AWS CLI. Tables are defined using external table definitions with partition projection for efficient querying across retailers and dates. AWS's serverless query service used by Salsify's Data Lake as the execution engine for DBT models. Queries are limited to 60 minutes, so models should complete within 20 minutes for safety margin. Data is stored in S3 and accessed via the salsify-data-eng AWS account. Amazon's interactive query service that makes it easy to analyze data in Amazon S3 using standard SQL. At Salsify, Athena is used to query data lake tables and views defined in AWS Glue catalogs, supporting analytics and data engineering workflows. AWS's interactive query service used by Salsify for analyzing data in S3 using standard SQL. Salsify has ADRs covering Athena query results storage policies and lifecycle management.

terms.name: Athena Boto3 Module
terms.description: A module within lake-athena-toolbox that provides Python functions for interacting with AWS Athena. Supports running queries with optional timeouts (run_query), retrieving results as dictionaries (get_query_dict), or as pandas DataFrames (get_query_df). Requires initialization via init() before use.

terms.name: Athenafy - Data Lake Migration Process
terms.description: The process of moving analytics exports into a data lake format that can be queried by AWS Athena. Used at Salsify to make production analytics data available for services-based reporting.

terms.name: Athens Ruby Gem
terms.description: A Ruby gem (from getletterpress/athens) used for programmatic access to Amazon Athena from Ruby code. One of the code interfaces supported for querying the Salsify data lake.

terms.name: Atlantis - Terraform Pull Request Automation
terms.description: A tool used at Salsify for Terraform pull request automation. Atlantis runs terraform plan and apply commands automatically when PRs are opened/updated. Salsify has granted Atlantis permissions to manage Azure identity resources. Used in the data-ops repository to apply Terraform plans through PR integration rather than running terraform apply locally.

terms.name: Automated Template Submission
terms.description: Amazon Vendor Central channel using Automated Template Submission (Scrapper). Covers Amazon Consumables (food and drinks).

terms.name: Audits Service
terms.description: A Salsify backend service for audit logging and tracking, accessible via the admin console. Runs locally on port 21030 and provides a GraphQL endpoint at /admin/graphql for querying audit data.

terms.name: Authentication Gateway - Salsify OAuth Adapter
terms.description: A Ruby application that enables third-party services to authenticate using Salsify OAuth. Originally built for Knowledge Owl authentication, but configurable to work with various external services. Service handlers can be added under lib/auth_handler_strategies to integrate new services. Uses Doorkeeper for OAuth integration with dandelion.

terms.name: Authorization (Commerce Config)
terms.description: A polymorphic model in the commerce-config-service with different attributes depending on the marketplace. Represents an authorization allowing Salsify programmatic access to a customer's marketplace account (e.g., Amazon Seller Central). Enforces uniqueness on remote_id, meaning only one Authorization can exist per marketplace account. Currently only AmazonAuthorization exists.

terms.name: Auto Vacuum
terms.description: PostgreSQL's automatic vacuum daemon that removes dead tuples from tables. Postgres-vacuum-monitor helps verify that auto vacuum settings are effective by tracking dead tuples and tuples over the vacuum threshold. Long running transactions can block auto vacuum from cleaning up rows.

terms.name: Goldiloader Auto-Include
terms.description: A Goldiloader method that controls automatic eager loading behavior. Can be set to false to disable automatic loading for specific queries (e.g., Blog.auto_include(false).first.posts) or at the association level via scope customization.

terms.name: Auto Scaler - Kubernetes Auto Scaler for Ruby Applications
terms.description: A Ruby gem that provides auto-scaling of background workers running in Kubernetes based on worker queue counts. Integrates natively with Delayed Job but provides a pluggable interface for other job systems. Runs as a process within the application's Kubernetes namespace and scales deployments based on configurable rules including min/max workers, work ratio, and metrics windows. Reports scaling metrics to New Relic via metrics_reporter. A ksonnify configuration option that deploys an auto_scaler pod alongside the application. Automatically controls the replica size of background workers relative to the job queue. Configurable polling interval (default 60 seconds), pod size, and environment variables. Uses the auto_scaler gem. Ruby gem for auto-scaling background workers. Recommended for scaling Delayed::Job workers. Non-production environments should scale workers to 0 when idle to save costs.

terms.name: Auto-build - Automated Target Schema Building
terms.description: A TASER workflow that triggers GitHub Actions to automatically build a Target Schema from customer-provided Excel templates. Uses workflow dispatch to run builds in TS generator repositories. On success, creates a candidate Target Schema committed to the repo and can trigger Auto-deploy or manual testing.

terms.name: Auto-deploy - Automated Target Schema Deployment
terms.description: A TASER workflow that automatically deploys a built Target Schema without human intervention. Runs after Auto-build succeeds. Includes test mode and live run phases. Sends notification emails on completion. Part of the goal to fully automate TS creation from customer request to deployment.

terms.name: Auto Scaler Operator - Kubernetes Operator for Async Workloads
terms.description: A Kubernetes Operator written in Go for auto-scaling Salsify's async workloads safely. Manages scaling of Delayed::Job workers and SalsifyKafka consumers in Kubernetes environments. Provides a higher-level abstraction over the auto_scaler Ruby gem by implementing the Kubernetes Operator pattern for declarative configuration and automated lifecycle management.

terms.name: Autogen-dump - Fallback Target Schema Generator
terms.description: A GitHub repository used as a fallback Target Schema generator when Monorail matching fails or when auto-build fails in another repo. Part of the two-repo generator strategy (Monorail and Auto-dump) intended to replace legacy generators.

terms.name: Automated Library Releases
terms.description: A Salsify process for automatically releasing Ruby gems and NPM packages. Preferred over releaseContainers for library publishing. Documented in Confluence.

terms.name: Amazon Vendor Central
terms.description: Amazon's portal for first-party vendors to manage their product catalog, inventory, and enhanced content on Amazon. Salsify integrates with Amazon Vendor Central to help customers manage A+ Content and product data. The PAO team uses browser extensions to automate content creation within AVC. The web interface used by manufacturers and distributors to sell product to Amazon. First-party (1P) sellers. Products show 'ships from and sold by Amazon.

terms.name: Attribute Value Pair (GDSN)
terms.description: In GDSN context, refers to stringAVP (String Attribute Value Pair) - a flexible mechanism for adding custom attributes to GDSN messages. Used for retailer-specific or region-specific extensions to the standard GDSN schema.

terms.name: Apache Avro
terms.description: A data serialization framework used at Salsify for encoding messages in Kafka. Avro schemas define the structure of data and enable schema evolution with backward/forward compatibility checks. Salsify uses custom tooling like avro-schema-registry, avro-builder, and avro-resolution_canonical_form for working with Avro schemas. A row-oriented remote procedure call and data serialization framework developed within Apache's Hadoop project. Uses JSON for defining data types and protocols, and serializes data in a compact binary format. Salsify uses Avro for data serialization, with avro-builder providing a Ruby DSL to create Avro schemas. A data serialization system that provides rich data structures, a compact binary format, and schema evolution support. At Salsify, Avro schemas (. avsc files) are used with schema registries for data serialization. The avrolution gem helps manage Avro schema compatibility and registration. A data serialization framework used for data exchange between systems. At Salsify, Avro is used with Kafka for schema-based message serialization. Schemas are managed through the avro-schema-registry service.

terms.name: Avro Compatibility Breaks File
terms.description: A file used by the avrolution gem to track expected compatibility breaks in Avro schemas. Located at Avrolution.root by default. Entries include schema name, fingerprint, and optional compatibility settings (with_compatibility, after_compatibility). Generated via 'rails generate avrolution:install' in Rails projects.

terms.name: Avro Schema Registry Client
terms.description: A Ruby gem that provides a client for the avro-schema-registry app. Extends AvroTurf::ConfluentSchemaRegistry to support extensions provided by avro-schema-registry. Includes a CachedClient for caching responses when fetching or registering Avro schemas, and a FakeServer for testing purposes.

terms.name: Avro Builder - Ruby DSL for Avro Schemas
terms.description: A Ruby gem providing a Domain-Specific Language (DSL) to create Apache Avro schemas. Developed because Avro IDL lacks Ruby support and is limited to Protocols rather than Schemas. Features include import/auto-loading of definitions, record inheritance via 'extends', a schema store for caching, Rails integration, and support for logical types and type macros. Ruby gem providing a DSL for defining Apache Avro schemas. Addresses JSON schema deficiencies with less verbose syntax, file sharing between projects, and simplified field handling. avsc files from. rb DSL files.

terms.name: Avro Resolution Canonical Form
terms.description: A Ruby gem that defines a Resolution Canonical Form for Avro schemas. Extends the Parsing Canonical Form from the Apache Avro spec to include attributes relevant to schema resolution and compatibility, such as default values, aliases, and logical types for decimals. Provides unique identification of Avro schemas for schema resolution and compatibility checking. A Salsify Ruby gem that generates fingerprints for Avro schemas based on attributes used during schema resolution and compatibility checking (like 'default' values), rather than just the Parsing Canonical Form. Used by avro-schema-registry v0. 0+ for more accurate schema fingerprinting.

terms.name: Avro Schema Registry
terms.description: A Rails application implementing the Confluent Schema Registry API for storing and retrieving versions of Avro schemas. Schema versions are assigned unique IDs that can be embedded in Kafka messages, avoiding the need to send full schemas with each message. Salsify built this as a replacement for the Confluent Schema Registry because they view Kafka messages as ephemeral and want flexibility in how Kafka is hosted. Uses PostgreSQL for storage instead of Kafka. Includes extensions for schema lookup by SHA256 fingerprint and compatibility level overrides. A Salsify open source Rails 7. 2 application that stores and retrieves versions of Avro schemas in Postgres. Provides the same API as Confluent Schema Registry but stores schemas in Postgres instead of Kafka. Schema version IDs can be embedded in Kafka messages to avoid sending full schemas with each message. Reimplemented because Salsify views Kafka messages as ephemeral and wants flexibility in Kafka hosting. Rails application that stores Avro schema versions. Reimplements the Confluent Schema Registry API using PostgreSQL instead of Kafka for storage. Supports fingerprint-based schema lookup with CloudFront caching for high availability. A Salsify-built schema registry application for Apache Avro schemas. Provides extensions beyond the standard Confluent Schema Registry functionality. Used to manage and validate Avro schemas across services.

terms.name: Avro Schema Registry Deploy
terms.description: Deployment manifests repository for deploying avro-schema-registry to Salsify's staging and production Kubernetes clusters. Uses an overlay directory pattern to customize the upstream open source project with Salsify-specific modifications including Jenkins/ksonnify deployment tooling and a custom Dockerfile that integrates with gems.salsify.com and the svalbard gem for backups.

terms.name: Avrolution - Avro Schema Evolution Manager
terms.description: A Ruby gem that provides utilities for managing Avro JSON schemas in a schema registry. Supports compatibility checking of Avro schemas against a registry, registering new schema versions, and tracking expected compatibility breaks. Recursively discovers .avsc (Avro JSON schema) files and integrates with Rails via Railtie for automatic task definition. Ruby gem for checking Avro schema compatibility during test runs and registering new schemas during deployment. Uses avro_compatibility_breaks. txt for exceptions. Integrated with CircleCI and Jenkins deployment pipelines.

terms.name: Avromatic - Ruby Models from Avro Schemas
terms.description: A Ruby gem that generates Ruby models from Apache Avro schemas and provides utilities to encode and decode them. Supports schema registry integration for messaging APIs, custom type configuration, nested models, and both key/value schema pairs for Kafka topics. Includes RSpec support with a fake in-memory schema registry for testing. Salsify's open-source gem for defining event schemas using Avro. Creates Ruby classes representing events that can be instantiated for publishing and are used by salsify_kafka when consuming messages. Ruby gem for defining model classes with attributes from Avro JSON schemas. Generated models serialize/deserialize to Avro, support validation, and work with key/value schema pairs for Kafka messages. A related Salsify gem that salsify_kafka depends on. All messages published to Kafka must be modeled as avromatic models with a system_message_id for idempotent message processing.

terms.name: AvroTurf - Avro Messaging Library
terms.description: A Ruby library that provides higher-level abstractions for working with Apache Avro. At Salsify, Avromatic uses AvroTurf components including SchemaStore for loading schemas from filesystem and ConfluentSchemaRegistry for schema registry integration. AvroTurf::Messaging is used for encoding/decoding messages with schema registry prefixes. A Ruby gem for working with Avro schemas, including a ConfluentSchemaRegistry client that can communicate with Salsify's avro-schema-registry. Provides methods for registering schemas, fetching schema JSON by ID, and working with Avro-encoded data.

terms.name: Awesome Salsify - Community Resource Collection
terms.description: A placeholder repository intended to be a categorized community-driven collection of awesome Salsify libraries, tools, frameworks, and software. Similar to other 'awesome' lists in the open-source community, this repository is designed to serve as a curated index of useful Salsify-related resources. Currently contains only a README with section headers for Local Development (Building, Running, Testing) and Deployment, but no actual content has been added yet.

terms.name: AWS Glue
terms.description: A fully managed ETL service from Amazon Web Services used by Salsify for data processing jobs. Provides a catalog of datasources and partitions discovered through a crawler, a managed Spark environment for executing ETL jobs, a scheduler for running jobs automatically, and a Scala helper library for loading data from and writing data to AWS services (Redshift, S3, etc). Amazon's fully managed ETL (Extract, Transform, Load) service that makes it easy to prepare and load data for analytics. At Salsify, AWS Glue is used to manage metadata catalogs for the data lake, including database and table definitions that are queried via Athena.

terms.name: AWS Usage Report
terms.description: A cost report generated by the cost-reporting application that tracks AWS resource usage and costs using AWS Cost Explorer data.

terms.name: AWS Credentials Management
terms.description: The infra-mgmt package for managing AWS credentials across multiple accounts. Uses awscreds.Scope to describe account and region, combined with IAM Role names to create short-lived sessions. The ClientFactory handles generating and caching credentials for their lifetime.

terms.name: AWTY - Are We There Yet
terms.description: Code name for the live-on-pdp-feedback service. The service consumes go-live events published to RabbitMQ by Insights and generates Attribute, Product, and Publication feedback. This feedback is delivered to syndication-gateway to surface in Dandelion.

terms.name: Azure Evaluations Framework
terms.description: Microsoft Azure's evaluation framework used by Salsify's evaluation-suite for assessing AI-based projects. Provides standardized evaluation capabilities that the evaluation-suite builds upon.

terms.name: Azure Evaluations Testing
terms.description: A Python project for testing Azure Evaluations capabilities. Contains scripts for registering custom evaluators with Azure Machine Learning using Prompt Flow, running cloud-based evaluations with Azure AI projects, running local evaluations on JSONL datasets, and running evaluations using the Azure OpenAI Evals API.

terms.name: Backfill - Historical Data Reprocessing
terms.description: The process of reprocessing historical data through incremental models when schema changes occur or source data is updated. Initiated via the Dagster UI by selecting incremental models and launching a backfill for the desired time range. May require downstream service backfills.

terms.name: Backstage - Developer Portal
terms.description: An open-source developer portal platform used by Salsify's Engineering Portal. Salsify maintains Backstage manifests in a software catalog monorepo for service discovery and documentation.

terms.name: Base Product
terms.description: Includes parent products and solo products. These are the foundational product records that may or may not have variants associated with them.

terms.name: Batch Delivery - Import.io Crawl Workflow
terms.description: The process of sending a batch of URLs to Import.io for crawling and receiving the results. Batches transition through states: Initializing, Generated, Uploaded, Delivering, Pending QA, Result Found, Archived, and Processed. Final states include Zero Entities Scheduled, Processed, Delivery Failed, and Abandoned.

terms.name: Batched Actor
terms.description: A variant of the salsify_kafka Actor class that processes a batch of messages for a single actor at a time instead of one message at a time. Handlers receive an array of events instead of a single event. Useful for bulk operations.

terms.name: Batched Attribute - Value Combination
terms.description: In batched_operation, a batched_attribute defines values that may vary within a single batch. Values are combined using a configurable block (default: array). Uses 'as:' option to specify the combined accessor name. For example, batched_attribute(:message, as: :combined_message) { |msgs| msgs.join('\n') }.

terms.name: Batched Operation
terms.description: A Ruby gem built on Delayed::Job and Redis for enqueueing and processing non-urgent work in batches. Allows individual operations to be combined into batches and executed when configurable sizing/timing conditions are met. Useful for notification digests, batching messages to avoid rate-limiting, and combining similar actions. Supports starvation/cooldown batching and run_at-style batching. Ruby gem for handling batched asynchronous operations with custom solutions for specific use cases beyond Delayed::Job and Kafka actors.

terms.name: Business Continuity Plan
terms.description: Centralized repository for information, tasks, and procedures necessary to facilitate management's decision-making processes and timely responses to any disruptive interruption of normal business operations.

terms.name: Business Development Rep
terms.description: Partners with New Business sales team. One of the two types of XDRs at Salsify.

terms.name: Benchmark Service
terms.description: A Salsify internal service used to benchmark various libraries and browse the results. Primarily used for performance testing the delayed_job_pump gem. Provides tools for enqueuing test jobs, publishing jobs to Redis, and measuring job pump performance across different configurations (single org vs multi org distribution).

terms.name: Best Buy HPI Target Schema Updater
terms.description: A service that automatically updates the target schema for the Best Buy HPI connector. Runs as a daily Kubernetes cron job with three main steps: (1) downloading templates from Best Buy using Playwright browser automation, (2) generating a target schema with ts-generator-core, and (3) importing the schema to Dandelion using TargetSchemaImporter. Migrated from salsify-ts/hpi-scripts and salsify-ts/best_buy_hpi-generator.

terms.name: Business Industrial Scientific Supplies
terms.description: Amazon abbreviation for the Business, Industrial, and Scientific Supplies category

terms.name: Block Slot Component
terms.description: A component provided by ember-block-slots used by consumers to target content for specific yield slots. Placed inside a pattern component to direct content to named yield-slot targets defined in the parent component.

terms.name: Business Message Standard (GS1)
terms.description: GS1's standard for business messages in GDSN. BMS packages contain XML schemas (XSD files) that define the structure of GDSN messages. Updated quarterly by GS1 with new GDSN versions.

terms.name: Boolean Property
terms.description: A binary variable property type with two possible values called 'true' and 'false.' Most readiness reports preview 'true' or 'false' but automatically convert to the format the endpoint requires (Y/N, Yes/No, etc).

terms.name: Boomerang
terms.description: A service that allows humans to validate and update publishes. Primarily used for adding pricing data (which some customers don't store in Salsify) by sending an email with a spreadsheet to a designated recipient who fills in missing data and returns it to the service. A policy type in the Syndication Gateway used for specific retailer integrations (e. Boomerang policies are configured via YAML files and loaded using rake tasks to define how publications should be routed for particular connectors.

terms.name: Kubernetes Cluster Bootstrap
terms.description: The process and resources for setting up base components on a new Kubernetes cluster at Salsify. Includes monitoring, logging, ingress, and other requirements. Bootstrap resources are defined in the bootstrap/ directory and automatically applied to clusters via a Jenkins job. Development clusters can exclude certain bootstrap resources by setting 'development: false' in bootstrap/bootstrap.rb.

terms.name: Botanist - JavaScript Data Transformation DSL
terms.description: A JavaScript DSL for traversing and transforming complex data structures using structural pattern matching rules. Inspired by Parslet's Transforms, it allows defining transformations over arbitrarily complex data by describing the structure of specific constituents. Rules are applied bottom-up (children before parents) and in declaration order. Supports matchers like simple(), choice(), sequence(), match(), subtree(), and rest() for flexible pattern matching. Only traverses POJOs and arrays; custom class instances are treated as terminal leaf nodes.

terms.name: Bower - Package Manager
terms.description: A package manager for front-end web development that manages components containing HTML, CSS, JavaScript, fonts, and images. In heroku-buildpack-webapp-client, bower is installed and 'bower install' is run if a bower.json file exists in the client directory.

terms.name: Box - Cloud Content Management
terms.description: A cloud content management and file sharing service. Box provides APIs for developers to integrate file storage and collaboration features into applications. Salsify uses Box integration for content and asset management workflows.

terms.name: Box Asset AutoLinking v4
terms.description: Webhook-based asset linking automation for L'Oreal organizations that use Box to store and manage their digital assets. Uses webhook subscriptions in Salsify orgs to detect events (asset created, renamed, trashed, product created/updated/deleted), stores them as WebhookEvent records, and processes them in batches to create JSON imports that update product-asset links.

terms.name: Box Sync v3
terms.description: A Salsify integration service that syncs assets between Box cloud storage and Salsify organizations. Replaces the previous Box Sync implementation by using Box's webhooks instead of constant polling. Users can connect their Salsify and Box accounts, configure Box folders to feed into one or more Salsify orgs, and run auto-sync or full folder syncs to ingest assets.

terms.name: Business Process Analyst (GDSN)
terms.description: Team or role responsible for converting GS1 validation rules from Excel spreadsheets to CSV format for import into Puddle. Also handles scope file creation and maintenance for GDSN schemas.

terms.name: Basic Party Registration
terms.description: A GDSN message type for registering party (trading partner) information in the Global Registry. In gdsn_gateway, BPR messages are routed to the '/bpr' endpoint when communicating with the Global Registry.

terms.name: Brand Compliance Report
terms.description: An insights product in Salsify that provides compliance scoring and reporting for brands. Accessible in the application at insights/reports/inbox?report_type=Brand+Compliance. The report comprises an in-app report grid artifact and an xlsx downloadable report, generated by the Compliance Reporting Engine.

terms.name: Brand Space - Enhanced Content API Service
terms.description: A Rails application that powers the Enhanced Content API Service at Salsify. Serves as the syndication layer for Enhanced Content, handling publishing to retail destinations like Walmart, Amazon, and Lowes. Manages Templates, ModuleTemplates, Layouts, and reporting analytics for EC performance. A backend service that EC Admin UI connects to via GraphQL. Part of the Enhanced Content infrastructure that works alongside dandelion to support EC administration workflows.

terms.name: Brandbank
terms.description: A product content syndication platform that receives product data from Salsify via direct connection. Brandbank provides APIs for data submission and asynchronous feedback, using XML-based data schemas with lookups for data attributes.

terms.name: Exception Reporter Breadcrumb
terms.description: A custom debugging context marker in the exception_reporter gem that provides additional context about what happened before an exception was raised. Supported by Bugsnag/InsightHub. Can include metadata, breadcrumb type (error, request, process, state, user, manual), and whether it was library or application generated.

terms.name: Broccoli CSS Modules
terms.description: A Broccoli plugin for compiling CSS Modules. Transforms CSS files into scoped versions with namespaced class names alongside JavaScript mappings. Supports PostCSS plugins, virtual modules, source maps, custom scoped name generation, and various lifecycle callbacks (onBuildStart, onBuildEnd, onBuildSuccess, onBuildError, onProcessFile). Used for modular CSS compilation in Ember.js and other Broccoli-based build pipelines.

terms.name: Broccoli Gzip Plugin
terms.description: A Broccoli plugin that applies gzip compression to file trees during build. Supports configurable file extensions for compression, optional preservation of uncompressed files, and configurable .gz suffix appending. Used in JavaScript/Ember build pipelines to pre-compress static assets for web serving.

terms.name: Broken Actor
terms.description: In the salsify_kafka Actor Framework, an actor that has failed to process an event after all retry attempts (default 8 attempts/80 minutes with exponential back-off). Broken actors will not process any events and require manual intervention to unbreak them using rake tasks.

terms.name: Bronze Layer - Raw Data Tier
