terms.description: The first tier in the medallion architecture containing raw data with minimal transformation. In lake-dbt, bronze models are typically materialized as views and serve as the initial staging layer for data from sources like Dandelion. Naming convention: bronze_{source}__{entity}.

terms.name: Box Sync v3
terms.description: Abbreviation for Box Sync v3, the webhook-based Salsify integration for syncing assets from Box cloud storage into Salsify organizations. Supports auto-sync via webhooks and full folder sync operations.

terms.name: Build Images - CI/CD Docker Images
terms.description: Salsify's project containing Docker images for CircleCI builds. Preferred over legacy circleci/* images.

terms.name: Build-Time Addon - Non-Runtime Ember Addon
terms.description: Ember addons that operate only during the build process and don't add runtime files to the final application. These addons (like preprocessors such as ember-cli-babel) can safely have multiple versions installed without causing runtime conflicts. ember-cli-dependency-lint pre-allows multiple versions for build-time tools including @embroider/macros, ember-cli-typescript, and ember-auto-import.

terms.name: BuildKit - Container Build Toolkit
terms.description: A toolkit for converting source code to build artifacts, used by Salsify as a remote daemon for building containers. Part of the infrastructure management service architecture.

terms.name: Heroku Buildpack
terms.description: A Heroku buildpack is a set of scripts that are run when an app is deployed. They are responsible for transforming deployed code into a slug, which can then be executed on a dyno. Buildpacks can install dependencies, compile code, and configure the environment.

terms.name: Bulk Insert
terms.description: A database operation that inserts multiple rows in a single SQL statement rather than executing individual INSERT statements for each row. Significantly improves performance for large data imports by reducing database round trips and transaction overhead. The activerecord-import library provides this capability for Ruby on Rails applications.

terms.name: Delayed::Job.bulk_enqueue
terms.description: A monkey patch method for efficiently enqueueing multiple DelayedJobs. Supports array form and block form with configurable batch sizes. Works with enqueue hooks and plugin callbacks but not around callbacks.

terms.name: Bulk Edit Webhook Request Handler
terms.description: A Hermes actor that listens for BulkEditCompleted messages on the Kafka bus. When an organization has an entry in the bulk_edit_webhook_configurations table, it sends a webhook request to the configured URL.

terms.name: Bulk Request (Shopify)
terms.description: A Shopify GraphQL API mechanism used by con-shopify to batch multiple product operations into a single request. Configured via shopify_api.bulk_product_batch_size to control batch sizes. The connector polls for completion status at intervals defined by shopify_api.bulk_polling_interval.

terms.name: Business Review
terms.description: An evaluation of metrics and performance of a supplier program over the previous period. Should be linked to overall strategy and objectives.

terms.name: Buy Box
terms.description: Winning the Buy Box refers to being the vendor chosen to sell your product on a retailer's site. Requires best customer experience via competitive pricing, excellent fulfillment, and good customer service.

terms.name: C4 Model - Software Architecture Diagrams
terms.description: A hierarchical approach to software architecture documentation using four levels: Context, Container, Component, and Code. Salsify infrastructure uses C4 diagrams (implemented in Mermaid) to document system architecture, including C4Context for high-level views and C4Deployment for infrastructure details.

terms.name: CAASPR - Channel as a Service Publish Runtime
terms.description: A Salsify Hackathon 2022 project that provides a GraphQL API layer for channel publish data. CAASPR ingests channel publish JSON, stores it in SQLite databases, auto-generates GraphQL schemas from the data definitions, and exposes a queryable GraphQL API. Built with Ruby, GraphQL-Ruby, SQLite3, and Sinatra. Created by Erman Celen and Keith Barrette.

terms.name: Cache Validator
terms.description: A tool in CPDS used to compare cached product data between different data vendors (Import.io vs Salsify Crawler). Generates an Excel document with parity scores to identify differences and ensure data consistency before rolling out org reports.

terms.name: Canary Organization
terms.description: A dedicated Salsify production organization used for automated testing and monitoring. There are two canary organizations: the Imports Organization (org_id: 3997) used to test imports of varying sizes, and the Exports Organization (org_id: 6554) initialized with 100,000 products, 50,000 digital assets, and 100 properties for testing exports, publishes, and target schema channels. Named after the 'canary in a coal mine' concept - if canary tests fail, it indicates potential issues in production.

terms.name: Canary Service
terms.description: A synthetic test application deployed to validate infrastructure health and functionality. Named after 'canary in a coal mine' - if the canary service fails, it indicates problems with the underlying infrastructure. Used in software deployments to detect issues early before they affect production services.

terms.name: Canary Organization - Salsify Canary Organization Tooling
terms.description: A Rails application service that runs, reports, and alerts on nightly tasks deemed important to Salsify engineers. Used for regression testing, smoke testing, health checks, and general reporting against production Salsify organizations. Maintained by the Data Model (Laser Viper) team.

terms.name: Canary Helper
terms.description: A utility module in con-shopify (lib/canary_helper.rb) that manages the CANARY_DOMAINS constant to determine which Shopify stores should use the canary API version. Enables gradual rollout testing of new Shopify GraphQL API versions before full deployment.

terms.name: SFCC Cartridge
terms.description: A modular, deployable package in Salesforce Commerce Cloud that contains code, templates, scripts, and configuration. Cartridges enable customization and extension of SFCC functionality. They are uploaded to SFCC instances and activated via Code Versions.

terms.name: Cascade
terms.description: A service that configures a network of entities (products and NPEs) which propagate data through an arbitrarily shaped/sized hierarchy. Supports inheritance of properties from upstream to downstream entities, with configurable pointer properties and inheritance direction.

terms.name: Catalog
terms.description: Contains all products an organization sells through their channels. Rise of e-commerce has increased need for frequent updates so brands are digitizing them.

terms.name: Catalog Composer
terms.description: A Salsify feature within the Digital Experiences Platform (DXP) for composing and managing catalogs. The frontend is built as an Ember microfrontend application.

terms.name: Catalog Auth - Authentication Service for Catalogs
terms.description: A Heroku-deployed Rails application that provides OAuth-based authentication for Salsify Catalogs and Lightboxes. Uses Doorkeeper for OAuth implementation and supports multiple authentication types including password-only, username/password, and disclaimer-based protection. Integrates with Google Sheets for customer-specific password management and communicates with Dandelion for the full authentication flow.

terms.name: Catalog Management Service
terms.description: Microservice for creating, editing, deleting, and publishing DXP sites. Communicates with dandelion to retrieve product data, create and update target schemas and channels. Receives ECP-enhanced channel publishes from ECP gateway via Kafka, triggers generation of static websites, and uploads them to CDN.

terms.name: Salsify Catalogs
terms.description: Shareable product catalogs in Salsify that can be protected with various authentication methods including password-only, username/password combinations, and disclaimers. Catalogs are accessed via URLs like https://app.salsify.com/catalogs/:catalog_id and can be configured with identity providers for secure access control.

terms.name: CurrentAggregateVersion
terms.description: Database table in the indexing-service that tracks the current version and epoch of aggregates. Uses epochs as a lazy migration process for versioning records, enabling Elasticsearch's optimistic concurrency control.

terms.name: Continuous Deployment
terms.description: A software development practice where commits to the main/master branch are automatically deployed to production. Used by services like metric-fetcher with deploy notifications sent to team Slack channels. The settings-ui repository uses continuous deployment (CD) where any commits to the master branch are automatically deployed to production once CI passes. Staging deploys are done via Jenkins. Deployment practice where commits on master are automatically deployed to production.

terms.name: Customer Data Feeds
terms.description: A Dagster code location/module in lake-jobs that handles customer-specific data feed processing for the Salsify data lake.

terms.name: Content Delivery Network
terms.description: A geographically distributed group of servers that work together to provide fast delivery of Internet content

terms.name: CloudFormation Linter
terms.description: Tool used in CloudOps to validate CloudFormation templates against AWS specifications. Configured as a pre-commit hook to automatically lint changes to the cloudformation/ directory.

terms.name: Cloud File Service
terms.description: Abbreviation for Cloud File Service. A Salsify internal service for OAuth integrations and secrets management. Runs on port 30036 in development. Uses continuous deployment with commits on master automatically deployed to production.

terms.name: CHANGELOG.md Change Enforcement
terms.description: A Gandalf rule that requires all library updates (Gems, NPM packages) to have a user-facing CHANGELOG entry for publishing internal Release Notes. If a change is not user-facing, the 'No Changelog Needed' label can be applied to the pull request to bypass the check.

terms.name: Channel
terms.description: In Dandelion, a frontend feature that customers interact with to: validate content against retailer requirements in a Readiness Report, publish content to generate exports (Excel, CSV, JSON), and download exports or send them directly to retailers via FTP or API. Used to publish products. Has three components: choice of target schema, product selection, and mappings. Determines where products get published.

terms.name: Channel Authorization
terms.description: Commerce schemas for managing authentication and authorization with retail channels. Tracks connection_authorization_result with status (SUCCESS/FAILED), authorization_id, channel_type, remote_id, and error information for failed authorizations.

terms.name: Channel Inventory
terms.description: Commerce domain for tracking inventory levels at external retail channels. Includes inventory_publish events for syncing inventory to channels. Separate from internal Inventory Pool management.

terms.name: Channel Mapping
terms.description: Process of creating data feeds specific to each channel's requirements (content and format). Translates data from brand format to channel's format.

terms.name: Channel Notification
terms.description: A webhook notification related to syndication channel events in Salsify. Delivered through the Webhook Service to notify external systems about channel-related activities.

terms.name: Channel Onboarding Workflow
terms.description: An automated workflow that guides users through the process of setting up and activating a channel in Salsify. For Amazon Vendor Central, it includes creating the channel, setting up Smart Lists for tracking accepted and rejected products, and configuring email notifications for workflow assignees.

terms.name: Channel Order
terms.description: An order received from a retail channel or marketplace in the Commerce system. Contains channel_type, channel_id, buyer info, shipping info, order items, fulfillments, cancellations, refunds, and status tracking. Links to allocation_id for inventory management.

terms.name: Channel Configuration
terms.description: A data model in con-shopify-commerce that stores channel settings including Shopify credentials. Created when a channel is set up for inventory/order syncing. Contains encrypted API tokens and is used to create Shopify API clients for making API calls.

terms.name: Channels UI
terms.description: Micro-frontend (uFE) for the Channels experience in Salsify. Provides the user interface for channel management, publishing configuration, and target attribute mappings. Built with Ember and supports extension points for other teams (GDSN, Sites/DXP) via ui-alchemy.

terms.name: Chat - Page Event Source
terms.description: A Salsify system that produces page event source data. Generates hourly ORC formatted files containing all page events including date/time, event type (page view, add to cart, etc), retailer/channel, category/tags, page URL, page/product metadata (brand, price), and client metadata.

terms.name: ChatID Content Delivery Network
terms.description: A CDN used by Salsify to serve the Enhanced Content loading script for Shopify. The EC script is hosted at chatidcdn.com and loaded on Shopify product pages via ScriptTags. The S3 source is at prod-eng-welcome@chatidcdn.com/chatbar/shopify/latest.js.

terms.name: Chef - Configuration Management Tool
terms.description: A configuration management tool used at Salsify for automating infrastructure configuration and deployment. Salsify has an ADR documenting the usage of Chef in their infrastructure.

terms.name: ChromaDB - Embedding Database
terms.description: An embedding database recommended for AI use cases at Salsify. Purpose-built for fast and accurate searching of AI embeddings. Used in conjunction with OpenAI and LangChain for vector similarity search and question-answering systems.

terms.name: chruby - Ruby Version Manager
terms.description: A lightweight Ruby version manager used at Salsify for managing multiple Ruby installations. Required for Core Modules local development. Used in combination with .ruby-version files to automatically switch Ruby versions per project.

terms.name: ChurnIQ - Customer Churn Dashboard
terms.description: An internal Salsify dashboard system for tracking customer churn metrics. Provides monthly and quarterly cohort analysis for customer churn data. Data tables are refreshed via the lake-supportiq repository's SQL scripts.

terms.name: CI Ruby Updater
terms.description: A utility tool that updates the versions of Ruby running in CI (Continuous Integration) in bulk across multiple Salsify repositories. Clones each repository from a list, creates a new branch, injects the provided Ruby version into the CircleCI test matrix for any workflow with a 'ruby' parameter, pushes the branch, and creates a PR tagged as 'No Changelog Needed'.

terms.name: Continuous Integration / Continuous Deployment
terms.description: Software development practices that automate building, testing, and deploying code changes. At Salsify, jenkins-deploys provides CI/CD capabilities for product teams.

terms.name: Catalogue Item Confirmation
terms.description: A GDSN message type received asynchronously in response to a CIN (Catalogue Item Notification). Contains the synchronization status and potential feedback/errors from the recipient data pool when attempting to synchronize data.

terms.name: Catalogue Item Notification
terms.description: A GDSN message type sent from a source data pool to notify a recipient data pool about product data. Triggered when publishing a product to GLNs (retail partners). Contains the full catalogue item data for synchronization.

terms.name: CircleCI - CI/CD Platform
terms.description: A continuous integration and continuous delivery platform used by Salsify for building, testing, and deploying code. Salsify hosts build images for CircleCI as documented in their infrastructure ADRs.

terms.name: CircleCI Orb
terms.description: A reusable package of CircleCI configuration that can be shared across projects. Orbs contain jobs, commands, and executors that simplify and standardize CI/CD pipelines. Salsify uses orbs like orb-shared-config to share common configuration snippets.

terms.name: Catalogue Item Subscription
terms.description: A GDSN message type for subscribing to product catalogue updates from trading partners. In gdsn_gateway, CIS messages are routed to the '/cis' endpoint when sent to the Global Registry.

terms.name: Classic Catalogs
terms.description: A Salsify feature/module for managing product catalogs. The 'Classic' designation distinguishes this from newer catalog implementations. The UI was originally part of the Dandelion monolith and was split into its own repository (classic-catalogs-ui) in November 2025. Related to Salsify's core Catalog functionality which contains all products an organization sells through their channels.

terms.name: Classic Catalogs UI
terms.description: The client application for Classic Catalogs at Salsify. This Ember.js client was split out of the Dandelion monolith in November 2025, with commit history preserved. It provides the frontend UI for managing catalogs in the Salsify platform. Development uses Yarn and can be tested standalone or served via Dandelion by setting the CLASSIC_CATALOGS_CLIENT_LOCAL_DIST_PATH environment variable.

terms.name: Classifier Field
terms.description: A type of Enumerated Field in Target Schemas that categorizes products. One of the most common use cases for Value Mappings because customers and retailers often have different product category hierarchies. The amazon_spds_unified_avc_US_en_US target schema's product_type field is an example.

terms.name: Clavis - Retail Analytics Platform
terms.description: A third-party retail analytics platform that receives product data from Salsify via the clavis-connector. Clavis provides feedback via CSV files sent over FTP. Product data is organized by retailers and markets, with each customer having a Clavis-specific naming convention for their organization.

terms.name: Clavis Connector (Decommissioned)
terms.description: A connector service between Salsify and Clavis that has been decommissioned. It enabled data syndication to Clavis, a retail analytics platform. Included a Target Schema (TS) generator that dynamically created schemas based on retailer information, scheduled jobs for updating retailer data, and FTP-based feedback delivery. The connector stored credentials in S3 and published to retailers organized by markets with UPC-level and RPC-level fields.

terms.name: Cleo SFTP Channel
terms.description: An SFTP-based communication channel in gdsn_gateway for file-based GDSN message exchange. Configured with host, user credentials, SSH key, and target path. Supports GLN-based allowlists to control which partners can use the channel.

terms.name: Cloud File Service
terms.description: A Salsify microservice that provides a Secrets API for securely storing and retrieving sensitive credentials. Used by con-shopify to manage Shopify Access Tokens for authenticated store connections. Must be running locally for full Shopify App development and testing.

terms.name: Cloud File Service (CFS)
terms.description: A Salsify service that facilitates OAuth integrations with third-party clients including cloud storage providers (Google Drive, Box, Dropbox) and retailers (Walmart). Applications integrating with CFS request users to grant permission to third-party clients and receive a UUID that can be exchanged for valid access tokens. Also provides a GraphQL API for storing and managing secrets. Originally intended to replace file picker for cloud storage integration but now focuses on being a generic OAuth provider.

terms.name: CloudAuth - Automated Account Provisioning Tool
terms.description: A command line tool (CLI) that helps onboard new engineers by automating user provisioning across multiple services. Uses Foxpass usernames to add users to services like GitHub and Bugsnag, with permissions configured via authorization files. Operated by the Ops team using the 'obt' command.

terms.name: Cloudinary - Digital Asset Management Service
terms.description: A cloud-based digital asset management service integrated with Salsify. Entitlement Reporting collects Cloudinary-related metrics including bandwidth usage, catalogs bandwidth, lightboxes bandwidth, storage file count, and total file size. An external cloud service used by Salsify for asset hosting and transformation. Handles image and media storage, delivery, and on-the-fly transformations. Integrated with the main Salsify application as a key external system.

terms.name: CloudOps Repository
terms.description: Repository containing source code for building Salsify's cloud infrastructure. Includes CloudFormation templates for AWS resources (VPC, IAM, Redshift, Glue, SQS), Kubernetes manifests for ops workloads, Packer builds for AMI creation, Jenkins pipeline scripts, and various operational tools for cost tagging, credential rotation, and SOC compliance reporting. A Git repository containing configuration for cloud operations at Salsify. Used by CloudAuth to read application configurations and authorization rules. The path to this repo is set via the CLOUDOPS_PATH environment variable.

terms.name: Configuration Manifests Service
terms.description: A Salsify service that stores packaged organization configuration as manifests and orchestrates manifest refreshes & installations across services. Enables bootstrapping organizations with fully-configured, complex & complementary feature sets enabled. Uses continuous deployment (CD) with commits on master automatically deployed to production. A Salsify microservice that manages configuration manifests. It exposes a federated GraphQL subgraph that integrates with the GraphQL Gateway, providing configuration manifest data for accounts and organizations.

terms.name: Commerce Merchant Settings ID
terms.description: The ID of the Facebook Commerce Merchant Settings object (also known as Commerce Account) where orders are placed. Required in channel settings if using orders/inventory syncing with Facebook/Instagram commerce.

terms.name: Code Freeze Policy
terms.description: A Salsify policy that restricts updating production software during certain holiday seasons when customers have peak sales and staff is most likely on PTO. Leadership approval is required to merge and deploy during freeze periods. Pull requests can be labeled with ':snowman: Override Approved :snowman:' to bypass the freeze check after obtaining approval.

terms.name: SFCC Code Version
terms.description: A named deployment version in Salesforce Commerce Cloud that contains cartridge code. Code versions must be created and activated in the SFCC Business Manager to make cartridge changes live on an instance.

terms.name: Coding Exercise Review Repository
terms.description: A private GitHub repository used for reviewing coding exercise submissions from job candidates. Contains infrastructure to organize and evaluate candidate submissions across various frameworks and technologies (JavaScript, Node.js, Ember, etc.). Created in 2016 as part of Salsify's engineering hiring process.

terms.name: Colima - Container Runtime
terms.description: A container runtime used by Salsify's local development environment to run Docker containers on macOS. Used by sal devenv to run shared infrastructural services for Dandelion development. Provides a lightweight alternative to Docker Desktop.

terms.name: Comment Service
terms.description: A Salsify microservice that enables platform-wide collaboration through an extensible commenting system. Provides the capability of creating, updating, and deleting comments on various Salsify entities using both GraphQL APIs and Kafka requests. Runs on port 30024 in development.

terms.name: Salsify Commerce Module
terms.description: A Salsify product module that handles commerce-related functionality including order management, inventory allocation, and marketplace integrations. The commerce-order-service is a core component of this module.

terms.name: Commerce Workflow Triggers
terms.description: Event schemas in Commerce for triggering automated workflows. Includes events like order_insufficient_inventory (when orders cannot be fulfilled), order_ship_date_past_due, fulfillment_import_failed, and product_published_without_inventory.

terms.name: Commerce Config Service
terms.description: Microservice hosting configuration for inventory and orders (O+I) syncing connections within organizations. Allows configuration of O+I syncing connections and initiation of OAuth flows for marketplace connections. Created to move away from dandelion Channel objects which had undesirable properties due to channels being ephemeral. Currently powers Salsify's OAuth setup flow for Amazon Seller Central orders/inventory connections. Development paused as of Q4 2022.

terms.name: Commerce Event Service
terms.description: Backend service for the Orders & Inventory module that handles event processing. Used by commerce-ui for Dashboard functionality.

terms.name: Commerce Market Service
terms.description: Core commerce module application which manages the publishing of product inventory to marketplaces, and the redistribution of available inventory across inventory pools. Listens to Kafka topics for product published events from Dandelion and inventory events from the inventory service. Implements a cap-and-trigger system for managing inventory pool replenishment. Backend service for the Orders & Inventory module that handles market-related functionality. Used by commerce-ui for Inventory page features.

terms.name: Commerce Order Service
terms.description: A Salsify Commerce module service that stores data for all orders ingested into Salsify. Each order contains information about the marketplace it was sold on, the source channel, order and shipping dates, and order status. Provides detailed views of order items, fulfillment history, and capabilities to cancel items or refund orders. When orders come in, it sends requests to allocate inventory to the inventory-service. Backend service for the Orders & Inventory module that handles order-related functionality. Provides GraphQL API consumed by commerce-ui for Dashboard, Order List/Details, and Syncing pages.

terms.name: Commerce Schemas
terms.description: A Ruby gem containing shared Avro schemas for Salsify Commerce services. Provides standardized data structures for orders, inventory, fulfillment, channel integration, and marketplace operations. Uses avro-builder DSL files to define schemas that are shared across Commerce microservices via Kafka messaging.

terms.name: Commerce UI
terms.description: Front-end application for the Orders & Inventory module in the Salsify platform. Built with Ember.js, it provides Dashboard, Inventory, Order List/Details, and Syncing pages. Works alongside commerce-order-service, commerce-event-service, commerce-market-service, and inventory-service. Uses ui-habanero component library. The frontend client for commerce features. EC Admin UI can be deployed to staging with custom revisions by appending client_revision[commerce-ui] query parameter to URLs.

links.description: Referenced in EC Admin UI deployment docs

terms.name: Commerce Connection
terms.description: A model in the commerce-config-service representing a configurable O+I (orders and inventory) syncing connection from Salsify to a particular marketplace account. Associated with an Authorization object that indicates the marketplace account. Intended to replace dandelion Channel IDs for associating inventory pools and orders.

terms.name: Commerce Experience Management
terms.description: A comprehensive system of record for a brand's product content. Unifies PXM capabilities with omni-channel syndication requirements for selling across retailer and D2C ecosystems.

terms.name: Compaction - Claude Context Summarization
terms.description: A context engineering strategy where past conversation contents are summarized into a succinct format and the rest is discarded. Claude performs this automatically when hitting context window limits, but can also be triggered manually to maintain context quality.

terms.name: EC Comparison Chart
terms.description: An Enhanced Content component that displays product comparisons in a tabular format. Supports Boolean value translations for different languages/locales. When adding new EC destinations with unsupported languages, Boolean translations (Yes/No) must be added for comparison charts to render correctly.

terms.name: Complete Stuck Job Groups Job
terms.description: A maintenance job provided by delayed_job_groups_plugin to clean up job groups that are stuck in an incomplete state. This can happen due to a race condition where the final job completes but the worker is terminated before the completion job is enqueued. Recommended to run periodically via cron, especially in high-throughput applications.

terms.name: Compliance
terms.description: The state of being in accordance with established guidelines or the process of becoming in accordance with regulations and corporate standards.

terms.name: Compliance Reporting Engine
terms.description: Salsify service that calculates and reports product compliance scores against syndicated content. Generates product_compliance_grade_snapshots and syndicated_products_compliance_scores data, tracking grades for name, description, bullets, images, and overall compliance. Data stored in S3 (salsify-compliance-reporting-engine-*) and queryable via Athena.

terms.name: Compliance Score
terms.description: A calculated metric in the Compliance Reporting Engine that measures how well products meet compliance requirements. These scores are transformed into insights for the Brand Compliance Report and other reporting products.

terms.name: Compliance Reporting Engine
terms.description: A Salsify microservice responsible for calculating compliance scores and turning those scores into insights. Powers the Brand Compliance Report (accessible at insights/reports/inbox?report_type=Brand+Compliance) which provides an in-app report grid artifact and an xlsx downloadable report. Also supports Syndicated Product Liveness Events. Uses Rails with Sorbet for type checking and runs on port 30012 by default.

terms.name: Compliance Report Job
terms.description: A Delayed::Job in the Compliance Reporting Engine (Reports::ComplianceReports::ComplianceReportJob) that generates compliance reports. Jobs are identified by organization_id and channel, and duplicate jobs for the same org/channel on the same day can be deduplicated using the ReportDedupe class.

terms.name: ComponentSpec - Exclaim Component Specification
terms.description: An internal ember-exclaim object representing a component's specification. Passed to wrapper components as @spec, allowing custom wrapper logic around rendered exclaim components.

terms.name: CSS Modules Composition
terms.description: A CSS property in CSS Modules that allows a class to inherit styles from other classes. Supports composing from the same file, other modules via path (e.g., 'composes: header from "app/styles/headers"'), or global unscoped classes (e.g., 'composes: class-name from global'). The resulting element gets class strings from all composed classes.

terms.name: Brandbank Connector
terms.description: Connector service that enables Salsify customers to submit product data to Brandbank. Dynamically creates zip packages containing XML and image URLs to be sent to Brandbank via their API. Supports both UK and US (Mars-specific) target markets with asynchronous feedback processing.

terms.name: eBay Commerce Connector
terms.description: Connector powering Salsify's eBay integration. This service powers both the content publish and inventory/orders integrations, enabling customers to sync product content, inventory, and orders with eBay marketplaces.

links.description: eBay Connection Readiness Report Mapping (Knowledge Base)

terms.name: Google Shopping Connector
terms.description: Connector service that sends mapped product data from Salsify to Google Shopping (Merchant or Manufacturer) via direct push to Google's FTP/SFTP or API. Only Google Merchant supports API publish. Deployed on Kubernetes.

terms.name: Instagram Commerce Connector
terms.description: Connector service for managing shoppable products on Instagram. Powers content publish and orders/inventory syncing between Salsify and Facebook's commerce platform. Products are published to Facebook product catalogs where they can be used for Facebook/Instagram ads and shops.

terms.name: Kroger VIP Connector
terms.description: Connector that generates Excel files sent via email to customers for upload to Kroger. Uses category-specific Excel templates bundled into a zip file, with automated daily target schema generation. Integrates with 1WorldSync for data synchronization.

terms.name: Con Laser Viper - Connector Development Environment for Laser Viper
terms.description: A tiny connector service with target schema source files for Laser Viper (LV) development. Provides a local development environment for testing connector integrations with Dandelion, including database setup, RabbitMQ message queue listeners, and target schema imports. Used for developing and testing retail channel connector workflows.

terms.name: Magento Connector
terms.description: Direct Connection service that integrates Salsify with Magento e-commerce platforms. Enables syncing product content from Salsify to Magento stores. Built with Ruby, this connector is part of Salsify's ecosystem of retail channel connectors.

terms.name: Commerce Amazon MWS Connector
terms.description: Connector powering Salsify's Amazon integration. Supports inventory management, FBA (Fulfillment by Amazon) orders, and FBM (Fulfillment by Merchant) orders integrations. Content publish is maintained by the Connections team. Uses Amazon's Selling Partner API (SP-API) for orders, inventory, and feeds.

terms.name: One World Sync Connector
terms.description: A Salsify connector service that relays messages between 1WorldSync and Dandelion. Handles product data synchronization via AS2 protocol, generates target schemas for GDSN compliance, and processes publish requests for product information exchange with 1WorldSync's data pool.

terms.name: Connections Packaged Template Service
terms.description: A connector service for generating packaged templates, specifically Excel files for target schemas. Requires a target schema in Salsify with an execution strategy of type connector service, an Excel definition DSL located in config/target_schema_writers, and an Excel template file in S3. Used for generating retailer-specific Excel templates like Amazon Seller Sheets, Home Depot Quicksheets, CVS files, and many others. The connector service for Sheets+ integrations that generates Excel spreadsheets from product data and sends them to target retailer systems. Destinations can be Amazon S3, FTP servers, or email. A service that Schema Tester 3000 integrates with for Packaged Template target schema testing. Requires service-security authentication with a valid SUPERUSER_TOKEN.

terms.name: Salesforce Commerce Cloud Connector
terms.description: Connector service responsible for generating XML files that can be imported to Salesforce Commerce Cloud (SFCC). These XML files allow users to import their product data to SFCC to configure their storefronts. Part of the D2CXM team's portfolio.

terms.name: Connections SFCC Cartridge POC
terms.description: A proof-of-concept repository for a Salesforce Commerce Cloud (SFCC) cartridge that ingests SFCC catalog files from Salsify. The cartridge enables importing Salsify product catalog data into SFCC instances via FTP, using SFCC's job scheduling and service infrastructure.

terms.name: Shopify Connector
terms.description: Connector service that uses Shopify's GraphQL API to publish product data from Salsify to Shopify shops. Handles bulk product publishing, category mapping, OAuth authentication with Shopify stores, and GDPR webhook compliance. Part of the D2C (Direct to Consumer) connector ecosystem, the service receives publication payloads from Syndication Gateway and supports canary testing of new Shopify API versions.

terms.name: Shopify Commerce Connector
terms.description: Salsify commerce connector for syncing inventory and orders to and from Shopify. Handles inventory and order synchronization but does not power content publish to Shopify (which is handled by con-u). Runs on port 41014 in development.

terms.name: Target Commerce Connector
terms.description: Connector powering Salsify's Target Plus integration. This service handles both content publish and inventory/orders integrations for Target Plus marketplace sellers. It includes functionality for generating Target Plus target schemas from Target's Taxonomy API and publishing products via Target's Seller API.

terms.name: Universal Connector (Content Publishing)
terms.description: Universal connector service and target schema generator for publishing product data to retail channels. Provides the infrastructure to connect Salsify with various retailers and marketplaces including Amazon, Walmart, BigCommerce, Wayfair, Instacart, and many others. Manages the publish pipeline, channel configurations, and feedback handling. Salsify connector that manages customer installation of the Shopify app and dynamic generation of customer-specific Shopify target schemas. Handles content publish to Shopify and manages app authorization, receiving API access tokens from Shopify and storing them in its database. Also performs channel settings sync jobs. A namespace or environment context used in Salsify for organizing Target Schemas, particularly for retail connections like Walmart. Target schemas under con-u are configured to use the Fix Up as a Service to ensure no fixups are missed during manual generation. The main API-based connector service at Salsify (con-u = connector-universal). New API connector functionality should use this service. Handles publishing product data to retailers via their APIs.

terms.name: Walmart Commerce Connector
terms.description: A Salsify connector for Walmart Marketplace integration. Supports content publish as well as inventory/order sync for Walmart Marketplace. Note: As of October 2024, the Walmart Marketplace Direct Connection functionality has been superseded by the Walmart Marketplace Item Spec 5 Direct Connection in con-u (part of Walmart OmniSpec Direct Connection). The Orders & Inventory functionality remains active in this service.

terms.name: Delayed::Extensions::ConcurrencyKey
terms.description: A mixin module for DelayedJob jobs that enables custom concurrency key configuration for queue fairness. Use concurrency_key_method to specify which method provides the concurrency key. By default uses organization_id.

terms.name: Conditionally-Required Attribute
terms.description: An attribute that is optional until a specific condition is met that makes it required. For example, some attributes are only required for specific categories or when certain conditions apply.

terms.name: Conductor - Microfrontends Orchestration Framework
terms.description: Salsify's microfrontends orchestration framework that enables multiple independent UI applications (micro-apps) to be composed and run within a host application. Consists of three main packages: @salsify/conductor-host for the host application, @salsify/conductor-micro-app for micro applications, and @salsify/conductor-ember for Ember.js integration. Handles routing, API sharing, mount point management, and lifecycle coordination between host and micro-apps.

terms.name: ConductorOutlet Component
terms.description: An Ember helper component from @salsify/conductor-ember for setting up a Conductor host. Accepts props for the current route, micro-app configuration, API implementation, and entrypoint URL finalization callback. Simplifies Conductor host integration in Ember applications.

terms.name: Config Manifests
terms.description: A Salsify service for managing configuration manifests, accessible via the admin console. Runs locally on port 21046 and provides a GraphQL endpoint at /admin/graphql for administrative operations.

terms.name: Configuration Manifest
terms.description: A YAML-based configuration file used to define entities (like enumerated properties) that can be installed into Salsify organizations. Manifests are created with an external ID, refreshed with updated content, and installed into target organizations. The installation process runs as an import, making re-installations idempotent. A packaged organization configuration stored in the Configuration Manifests Service. Manifests contain complex and complementary feature sets that can be installed to bootstrap organizations with pre-configured settings. Supports refresh and installation operations across services.

terms.name: Configuration Manifests
terms.description: A system at Salsify for exporting and importing configuration between organizations. Supports JSON-based manifests for schema configuration, target schema channels, workflow entity types, lists, and more. Includes features like parameterization, installation tracking, and partner-accessible APIs. Used by the Salsify App Store for installable apps.

terms.name: Configuration Manifests Service Client
terms.description: A Ruby gem that provides a thin wrapper for interacting with the configuration-manifests-service. Used as a client library to communicate with the Configuration Manifests Service API.

terms.name: Configuration Manifests Service
terms.description: A Salsify service that manages configuration manifests. The configuration_manifests_service-client gem provides a client interface to interact with this service.

terms.name: Connector Service
terms.description: A type of execution strategy in Salsify target schemas that enables integration with external services. Con-packaged-template is a connector service that generates Excel files. Connector services are associated with target schemas via admin scripts like associate_target_schema_connector_service. A Salsify service that handles retail channel connector integrations. Listens to RabbitMQ message queues (e. , RABBIT_QUEUE=ConnectorServices) to process connector-related tasks. Works in conjunction with Dandelion for target schema management and channel publishing.

terms.name: Pact Consumer
terms.description: In Pact terminology, the system that initiates requests. In the case of ember-cli-pact, this is typically your Ember application. The consumer generates Pact contracts that define expected API behavior.

terms.name: Consumer-Driven Contract Testing
terms.description: A testing methodology where the consumer (client) defines the expected API behavior in the form of contracts, and the provider (server) verifies its implementation against these contracts. This allows testing API integrations without requiring both systems to be tested simultaneously, catching breaking changes early in the development process.

links.description: Martin Fowler's Article on Consumer-Driven Contracts

terms.name: Content Flow - Salsify Workflow Service
terms.description: A Salsify feature for managing workflow tasks and processes. Also referred to as 'Workflow' in the codebase. Content Flow enables users to create, assign, and track tasks within the Salsify platform. The content-flow-chrome-extension provides a browser extension interface for creating these tasks. Salsify's workflow platform for managing content processes. Provides configurable workflow templates, task management, and step-based content flows. The technical implementation is powered by content-flow-service. A Salsify service that executes workflows. FlowBuilder generates flows that run on this service. Flows can include tasks with UI, tracking callbacks, and JavaScript-based logic for dynamic behavior. Salsify's workflow automation system that enables importing, configuring, and triggering workflow templates. Accessed via the /content_flow API endpoints for flow_imports and flow_templates.

terms.name: Content Grade
terms.description: Quality scoring metrics for crawled product content. Includes overall_grade, title_grade, description_grade, bullets_grade, a_plus_content_grade, images_grade, image_resolution_grade, ratings_grade, and reviews_grade. Used to assess the quality and completeness of product listings on retailer websites.

terms.name: Content Owner GLN
terms.description: The Global Location Number identifying the party responsible for the product data in GDSN. Used in subscriptions to identify which products to synchronize. Different from the data recipient GLN (the retailer).

terms.name: Item Master Content Plus
terms.description: A small target schema channel used for sending retailer-specific product descriptions and images to Item Master. Currently only supports sending to Peapod, though this is a strategic rather than technical limitation.

terms.name: Content Quality Workflow
terms.description: A validation workflow in Salsify that uses AI models to check product content against style guides and extract data from nutrient labels. Powered by Azure AI (for style guide checks) and Google Cloud Document AI (for nutrient/ingredient label extraction).

terms.name: Content Refresh
terms.description: The process of updating existing product data in a retailer's system (as opposed to New Item Setup which populates data for the first time). Retailer process to add or change information for products they already carry. May require different information than item setup process.

terms.name: Product Content Quality Score
terms.description: A metric (0-120 points, graded A-F) that evaluates product content quality. In ec-mcp, calculated based on title, description, bullets, ratings, review count, enhanced content presence, image count, and high-resolution image count. Used to assess how complete and compelling product listings are.

terms.name: Content Flow
terms.description: A GraphQL backend service used by the DAM UI for content workflow functionality. Provides a GraphQL API at localhost:21012/graphql during development. Handles content-related operations within the Digital Asset Management system.

terms.name: Content Flow Chrome Extension
terms.description: A Chrome extension for adding Workflow tasks to Salsify orgs. Built with Ember.js and uses the Dandelion GraphQL API. Allows users to create Content Flow/Workflow tasks directly from their browser. Published to the Chrome Webstore as 'Salsify Task Creation Extension'.

terms.name: Content Flow Service
terms.description: Backend service powering the Salsify workflow platform. Handles workflow orchestration, task management, and event processing. Built on Rails with Kafka for event-driven architecture. Integrates with Dandelion for user/product data and publishes events to email-service, indexing-service, and dependency-service.

terms.name: Context Engineering
terms.description: The practice of curating the Claude context window to contain high-quality, relevant information for the task at hand. Strategies include compaction (summarizing past contents), structured note-taking (outputting important info to external files), and sub-agents (isolating context windows between agents). Helps prevent context rot in long-running Claude sessions.

terms.name: Context Rot
terms.description: The degradation of Claude agent effectiveness that occurs when the context window becomes filled with low-quality or irrelevant information over long-running sessions. Mitigated through context engineering strategies like compaction, structured note-taking, and sub-agents.

terms.name: Pact Contract
terms.description: A document describing the expected ways in which a consumer and a provider will interact with one another. A contract is tied to one consumer and one provider, and is composed of one or more interactions. In ember-cli-pact, contracts are generated as JSON files containing provider states, requests, and responses.

terms.name: Controller - FlowBuilder Task Abstraction
terms.description: An abstraction of a task in FlowBuilder where you can define attributes either statically or dynamically with JavaScript. Created by subclassing FlowBuilder::Controller. Supports including JavaScript files, building views with the View DSL, defining buttons, and using inline JavaScript for dynamic behavior like skip conditions and descriptions.

terms.name: Cookie Consent Gem
terms.description: A Ruby gem providing Rack middleware (Rack::Middleware::CookieConsent) that restricts users from accessing application content unless they have a special cookie set on their browser. Acts as both the setter and checker of consent cookies. Used for GDPR and privacy compliance by gating access until users accept cookie policies.

terms.name: Cookiecutter
terms.description: A Python utility for creating projects from project templates (cookiecutters). Used by Salsify to generate new Ruby gems with standardized boilerplate and configuration. Templates are implemented using Jinja templating. Requires version >= 1.4.0 for the salsify-gem template.

terms.name: Cookiecutter Salsify Gem Template
terms.description: A cookiecutter template repository for creating new Salsify Ruby gems with pre-configured boilerplate. Supports both public and private gem configurations, includes Rubocop (based on salsify_rubocop), Overcommit hooks, and CI configuration. Uses Python's cookiecutter utility with Jinja templating.

terms.name: Email Notification Cooling Period
terms.description: A time window in the Alerts Service during which email notifications for a given alert are batched together before delivery. This mechanism decreases the frequency of email notifications but increases their latency, preventing users from being overwhelmed with individual emails for each product change.

terms.name: GraphQL Gateway Coprocessor
terms.description: An HTTP server written in Go that provides a hook into the Apollo Router for Salsify-specific logic. It is primarily responsible for applying organization segmentation by splitting operations by organization and generating organization-scoped JWTs. Runs as a sidecar container alongside the Router in Kubernetes pods. An external service that integrates with Apollo Router to customize GraphQL request/response processing. Coprocessors can inspect and modify GraphQL operations at various stages of the request lifecycle. At Salsify, implementations exist in both Ruby and Go for performance comparison.

terms.name: Core Service Group
terms.description: A predefined group of services in sal devenv that contains the essential infrastructure services needed to run Dandelion locally. Started with 'sal devenv start -g core'. Can be set as the default group with 'sal devenv set-default-group core' to omit the -g flag in future commands.

terms.name: Core Modules - Salsify Engineering Team
terms.description: A Salsify engineering team that owns 60+ artifacts spanning multiple product domains including Insights (analytics and reporting), Crawling (product data extraction), Sites & Catalogs (DXP catalog management), Integration Solutions (SolEng tools), and Enhanced Content. The team maintains services, libraries, and UI applications across these domains.

links.description: Core Modules Dev Conductor - Local development tools

terms.name: Core Modules Dev Conductor
terms.description: A GitHub repository containing local development tools aimed at automation around the 60+ artifacts that Core Modules owns. Provides shell scripts for cloning/updating repos, cleaning local branches, removing modules, and listing dependencies. Requires chruby, PostgreSQL, yarn, and node. Uses 'sal devenv start -g core' for Docker container setup.

terms.name: Correlation Registry Service
terms.description: A Salsify service that stores and retrieves correlations between external system identifiers and Salsify internal IDs. Enables mapping of IDs from third-party platforms (like BigCommerce, Amazon, etc.) to Salsify product/entity IDs. Uses Kafka for write operations (STORE/DELETE) and REST API for read operations (FETCH). Supports organization-scoped and global record types. A Salsify service that correlates Retailer IDs (such as ASIN, TSIN, etc. Supports both organization-agnostic records (GlobalRecord) and organization-specific records (OrganizationRecord). Uses Kafka for asynchronous STORE and DELETE operations, and REST API for synchronous FETCH operations. A service that matches retailer IDs (ASIN, TSIN, etc. Enables product correlation across different systems. Also available as a gem that abstracts the service's interface.

terms.name: Correlation Registry Client Gem
terms.description: A Ruby gem that provides a client interface for interacting with the Correlation Registry service from Ruby Salsify services and applications.

terms.name: Correlation Registry Client
terms.description: A Ruby gem that serves as the client library for the Correlation Registry service. Provides methods to STORE, FETCH, and DELETE correlation records via Kafka messaging and REST API. Supports both organization-specific and global records. Used to map external system IDs (like BigCommerce product IDs) to Salsify internal IDs.

terms.name: Cost Reporting
terms.description: A Rails application that runs in the production cluster and generates cost reports every morning at 7:37 UTC. Uses AWS Cost Explorer and Prometheus to account for the relative cost of production services. Generates k8s limits reports and AWS usage reports.

terms.name: Crawled Product Data Service
terms.description: A Salsify service that provides an API for retrieving crawled product data from retail websites. Supports fetching product data by retailer + RSU or by product URL, with optional freshness filtering. Also provides endpoints for retrieving recent crawl errors. Used by services like reporting engines to access cached product information from retailers like Amazon. Acronym for Crawled Product Data Service. A product cache and crawl scheduler that stores and serves product data crawled from retailer websites. Determines the appropriate data vendor based on retailer and usage, sends ProductScheduleEvents via Kafka to crawl services, and caches the crawled product data for client requests. A Salsify service that crawls and caches product data from external sources. Uses Sem3 (Semantics3) for product data queries. The cache can be selectively cleared using scripts when rate limit errors or other issues occur. Accessed via salsifyk8s for production Rails console operations. A Salsify service that processes and stores crawled product data from web crawling operations. Receives data from cpds-importio-service via Kafka after Import. io completes batch crawls of retailer product pages and search results. A service within the Crawling domain that manages crawled product data from retail websites. Part of the Core Modules Crawling infrastructure which includes the fetcher, extractor, scheduler, and data services.

terms.name: CPDS Cache
terms.description: The caching layer within the Crawled Product Data Service that stores product data organized by vendor (based on retailer and usage). Supports Cache-Control max-age headers to prevent returning stale data. The cache can be configured to skip specific retailers during issues via the RETAILERS_TO_SKIP_FROM_CACHE environment variable.

terms.name: CPDS Import.io Service
terms.description: A Salsify service that integrates with Import.io for web crawling of retailer product pages and search results. Generates and uploads batches of URLs to S3 for Import.io to crawl, polls for completed results, extracts canonical payloads, and sends data to CPDS via Kafka. Part of the Analytics crawling architecture. A service that integrates with CPDS (Crawled Product Data Service) to handle crawling operations through the Import. io data vendor. Receives ProductScheduleEvents from CPDS and coordinates with Import. io to extract product data from retailer websites.

terms.name: Consumer Packaged Goods
terms.description: Products that are sold quickly and at relatively low cost. Examples include food, beverages, cosmetics, and cleaning products. One of Salsify's verticals.

terms.name: Configure Price Quote
terms.description: Software that helps sales teams generate accurate quotes for configurable products and services

terms.name: Can't Realize any Profit
terms.description: Amazon term for products that are discontinued as 1P sellers due to price or other issues that prevent Amazon from winning the Buy Box profitably.

terms.name: Crawled Product
terms.description: A timeseries entity representing product data that has been crawled from retailer websites. Contains fields such as product_id, brand, name, retailer_external_id, RSU, URL, price, description, feature_bullets, images, videos, reviews, ratings, ranks, and various content grade scores (title_grade, description_grade, bullets_grade, a_plus_content_grade, images_grade, etc.).

terms.name: Crawled Product Data Service Client
terms.description: A Ruby gem that provides a simple HTTP client for consuming the Crawled Product Data Service (CPDS) API. Enables fetching cached product data and crawl errors by retailer + RSU or product URL. Leverages service-security for authentication and requires configuration of the CPDS URL and identity provider key.

terms.name: Crawled Product Data Service
terms.description: A product cache and crawl scheduler that provides a JSON API to expose product information crawled from retailer websites such as Amazon and Walmart. Integrates with cpds-importio-service and crawler-scheduler-service to schedule product URLs to be crawled by Import.io and/or the Salsify crawler.

terms.name: Crawled Product Event Batch Handler
terms.description: A Kafka consumer in CPDS that listens for product data events from crawl services. When product data has been crawled and extracted, this handler receives the events and writes the data to the CPDS cache.

terms.name: Crawler Extractor Service
terms.description: Salsify service that extracts structured data from crawled retailer product pages. Outputs JSON data to S3 partitioned by crawl entity type (product/search), retailer, and date. Data is queryable via the crawler_extractor_output_raw and crawler_extractor_products Athena tables.

terms.name: Crawler Fetcher Service
terms.description: Salsify service that fetches raw product pages from retailers. Works in conjunction with the Crawler Extractor to provide the crawling pipeline. Data is stored in S3 and queryable via crawler_fetcher_products Athena tables.

terms.name: Crawler Fetcher Service
terms.description: A Salsify service that receives product crawl requests from the crawler-scheduler-service via CrawlInputBatchFileEvent. Part of the Analytics crawling architecture responsible for actually fetching/crawling products.

terms.name: Crawler Scheduler Service
terms.description: A scheduling service that is part of the Analytics crawling architecture at Salsify. Responsible for listening for product schedule events, storing scheduled products in its database, building hourly jobs to request product crawls (ensuring each product is crawled once per day), and sending product crawl requests to the fetcher service. Uses time buckets and crawl cadences to manage scheduling. A service that integrates with CPDS (Crawled Product Data Service) to handle crawling operations through the Salsify crawler. Receives ProductScheduleEvents from CPDS and schedules URLs to be crawled by the internal Salsify crawler.

terms.name: Crawling - Core Modules Domain
terms.description: A Core Modules product domain focused on product data extraction from retail websites. Includes services: cpds-importio-service, crawler-fetcher-service, crawler-extractor-service, crawled-product-data-service, crawler-scheduler-service. Libraries: crawled_product_data_service_client.

terms.name: Crawling Kubernetes Nodes
terms.description: Specialized Kubernetes nodes (2 instances) dedicated to running crawling microservices. Isolated from standard nodes to manage resource allocation and prevent crawling workloads from impacting other services.

terms.name: Crawl Input Batch File Event
terms.description: An event sent by the crawler-scheduler-service to the crawler-fetcher-service containing an S3 URL pointing to a batch of products to be crawled. Generated by CreateScheduledBatchJob after uploading the input file to S3.

terms.name: Create Scheduled Batches Job
terms.description: An hourly clock job in the crawler-scheduler-service that iterates through all data vendors and retailers with scheduled products, initiating a CreateScheduledBatchJob for each data vendor/retailer combination.

terms.name: Create Scheduled Batch Job
terms.description: A job in the crawler-scheduler-service that identifies the set of products configured to run for the current hourly block, builds an input file, uploads it to S3, and sends the S3 URL to crawler-fetcher-service via CrawlInputBatchFileEvent.

terms.name: Cross-Actor Batching
terms.description: A feature in the salsify_kafka Actor Framework that allows bulk operations across all actors in each worker's batch. Useful when you have a large number of actors or distinct event types and need to efficiently interact with external systems through load_batch and flush_batch hooks.

terms.name: Cross Organization Model
terms.description: An ActiveRecord concern for models that are shared across multiple Salsify Organizations. Used for data that is not tenant-specific and needs to be accessible globally. Counterpart to OrganizationScopedModel in the multi-tenancy architecture.

terms.name: Customer Retention Rate
terms.description: Metric based on customer counts. One of the metrics used to measure retention (others are GDRR and DRR). Customer (logo) retention rate - the percentage of customers retained over a given period.

terms.name: CRUD Events - Entity Lifecycle Events
terms.description: Pattern for Kafka events representing Create, Update, Destroy operations on entities. Uses separate schemas (e.g., entity_created_event_value, entity_updated_event_value, entity_destroyed_event_value) published to a shared topic for ordering.

terms.name: Customer Satisfaction Survey
terms.description: Survey measuring how well customer expectations are met

terms.name: CSID - Customer Session ID
terms.description: A UUID assigned to users visiting product pages with Enhanced Content. Used to track unique visitors and calculate metrics like unique page views, unique ATC events, and conversion rates across the EC Digital Shelf analytics pipeline.

terms.name: Customer Success Manager
terms.description: Helps align on strategic business goals and objectives, focuses on right tactics, puts together programs, and tracks KPIs to measure success.

terms.name: Content Service Provider
terms.description: A technology partner that helps brand manufacturers streamline the process of getting product data to retailers. Example: Salsify is a CSP for brands to get content to Walmart.

terms.name: Certificate Signing Request
terms.description: Request for SSL/TLS certificates. CloudOps includes csrgen.sh script for generating certificate signing requests.

terms.name: CSS Modules
terms.description: A CSS file format where all class names and animation names are scoped locally by default. In ember-css-modules, each class is automatically namespaced (e.g., '.hello-class' becomes '._hello-class_1dr4n4') to ensure it doesn't conflict with classes defined in other modules. Provides isolation and modularity for stylesheets similar to how ES6 modules work for JavaScript.

terms.name: Common Table Expression
terms.description: A SQL feature used in ec-mcp to implement row-level security. CTEs create temporary named result sets that wrap user queries, joining raw data tables with policy tables to filter results based on user permissions. Allows transparent security enforcement without modifying user queries.

terms.name: Service-Specific Custom Evaluators
terms.description: Evaluation components specific to individual Salsify services that extend the evaluation-suite framework. These evaluators live in their respective service repositories and provide service-specific evaluation logic.

terms.name: Customer Essendant Integration
terms.description: A Salsify integration repository for Essendant, handling image import/export, Salsify-to-Enable export, and Enable-to-Salsify export workflows. Manages digital asset synchronization, product data transfers, and target schema updates for Essendant suppliers.

terms.name: Hallmark Channel Publishing Portal
terms.description: A customer-specific UI application that allows Hallmark users to scope access to channel publishes by user. Serves as a workaround since Salsify security cannot currently block users from seeing/publishing blacklisted channels. Users can select a list, select a channel, and publish. Includes an admin interface at /admin for managing user privileges.

terms.name: Customer L'Oreal App
terms.description: Rails application for L'Oreal that provides a two-way integration with their DAM (OpenText), as well as asset linking automation for OpenText and Box assets. Includes scheduled processes to import assets from OpenText and link them to products, plus webhook-based asset linking automation for Box assets.

terms.name: Cybersecurity
terms.description: Processes, implementation of controls and security practices orchestrated to protect networks, applications, software programs, computers and data from attack, damage or unauthorized access.

terms.name: Direct to Consumer
terms.description: Business model where brands sell directly to consumers, bypassing traditional retail channels. Also written as DTC. At Salsify, D2C connectors enable brands to syndicate product content directly to e-commerce platforms like Shopify.

terms.name: D2C Shopify Connector
terms.description: A Ruby-based Shopify Connector service using the 'new architecture'. Implements Direct-to-Consumer (D2C) integration with Shopify for brands selling directly to consumers. Uses SQS for message queuing and runs on port 41020 in development.

terms.name: D2CXM Development Group
terms.description: A development environment group identifier used with 'sal devenv start -g d2cxm' to start the required container dependencies (including s3mock) for D2C connector development. Ensures proper local development setup for services like con-shopify.

terms.name: Direct-to-Consumer Experience Management
terms.description: A Salsify engineering team focused on Direct-to-Consumer experience management features, specifically working on 'variant options' extension points. The team develops features that integrate with Dandelion and Alchemy products. Note: The acronym appears inconsistently as both 'D2CXM' and 'D2XCM' in documentation. The Salsify engineering team responsible for Direct-to-Consumer (D2C) connector services including the Shopify connector. Manages alerts, monitors production systems, and can be reached via Slack at #team-network-core. Maintains the con-shopify service and related D2C infrastructure. Salsify team and product area focused on direct-to-consumer commerce integrations. Owns connectors like con-sfcc for Salesforce Commerce Cloud. Related Slack channels include #team-d2cxm, #d2cxm-alerts, and #d2cxm-bugsnags.

terms.name: D2CXM Automated Testing
terms.description: A Node.js repository for automated end-to-end testing of D2CXM team products. Uses Puppeteer with Jest for browser automation testing against staging, test, or production environments. Specifically tests the 'variant options' extension point feature. Not integrated into Dandelion or Alchemy CI/CD pipelines; serves as an automation tool for manual test suites performed during releases.

terms.name: DAG - Directed Acyclic Graph
terms.description: In the context of DBT and data pipelines, a DAG represents the dependency relationships between data models. DBT automatically builds a DAG from model references (ref() function) to ensure models are executed in the correct order. Dagster visualizes and executes pipelines based on DAG structure.

terms.name: Dagster - Data Orchestration Platform
terms.description: The open-source data orchestration platform used by Salsify to schedule and manage Data Lake pipelines. Provides job execution, monitoring, backfill capabilities, and DAG visualization. The production instance is accessible at lake-jobs-prod.lake.salsify.com. A data orchestration platform used by Salsify for ETL (Extract, Transform, Load) workflows. Salsify uses Dagster with YAML configuration for ETL processing of large source files.

terms.name: Digital Asset Management
terms.description: Software that allows organizations to store, organize, find, and share digital assets such as images, videos, audio, presentations. Comes with every Salsify license as platform functionality. A system for organizing, storing, and distributing digital assets like images, videos, and documents.

terms.name: Dandelion - Core Product Platform
terms.description: Salsify's core Items Repository service. Provides user, product, and organization data. Other services like content-flow-service integrate with Dandelion for authentication (via api-gateway), entity data, and event subscriptions. Publishes events for products, digital assets, subscriptions, organizations, users, and groups. The Ruby on Rails backend application that powers app. This is the primary monolith service containing the core PIM functionality, user authentication, GraphQL APIs, and administrative tooling. Uses continuous deployment (CD) where commits on master are automatically deployed to production. The main Salsify monolith repository containing the core backend application. The admin-console-ui was originally part of this repo before being split out. Runs locally on port 5000 and serves the admin GraphQL endpoint at /admin/graphql. Salsify's main monolithic Rails application. Houses core functionality including target schema management, connector service configurations, and channel settings. Con-u interacts with dandelion for target schema setup and configuration. Internal Salsify service that provides product data, target schema management, and channel operations. The catalog-management-service communicates with dandelion to retrieve product data and manage target schemas and channels. A GraphQL backend service used by the DAM UI. Provides a GraphQL API at localhost:5000/graphql during development. Serves as one of the primary data sources for the Digital Asset Management micro app. A backend service that EC Admin UI connects to for Enhanced Content administration. Provides GraphQL endpoints for admin operations. Part of the Enhanced Content infrastructure. The backend server that powers Salsify's product content management system. It serves as the API backend for various Salsify front-end applications including lightboxes-ui. A GraphQL API service that the Salsify UI application communicates with. Used for schema introspection and type generation i...

terms.name: Dandelion Channel
terms.description: The foundation of the Salsify product, also referenced internally as 'Core'. Worked on by the Foundations or Core Foundations team. Was the initial starting point from which all other systems followed, and from which microservices are still being split off. The Salsify system that originates publications destined for connector services. Dandelion sends publish payloads through the Syndication Gateway and receives feedback and publication status updates back via the SyndicationGateway. v1 routing key. Salsify's internal messaging and batch processing system that handles connector service communication. Provides channel configurations, batch handling, and feedback routing between Salsify and external connector services. Salsify's channel publication system that generates payloads for syndication to retail endpoints. The activation-validator service validates these Dandelion Channel publication payloads before they are sent to retailers. Salsify's main backend service that provides REST and GraphQL APIs for the platform. Serves as the primary API backend for micro-frontends like channels-ui, running on localhost:5000 during local development. Salsify internal system for user management. The Email Service checks Dandelion to determine if users are disabled before sending emails to them. Emails are not sent to disabled Dandelion users.

terms.name: Dandelion Admin Service
terms.description: A service class (Services::DandelionAdminService) in con-shopify-commerce that fetches channel configuration settings from Dandelion. Used as an alternative method to get Shopify credentials when a ChannelConfiguration record does not exist locally.

terms.name: Dandy 1000 - Legacy Webhook Handler Server
terms.description: A legacy webhook handler server primarily used to listen for webhooks from alerts, imports, and channels to perform arbitrary actions. Currently in maintenance mode - new webhook handlers should not be set up using this service. In many cases, a workflow configured with a subscription trigger can replace its functionality. Available to Salsify superusers, it receives webhooks for configured webhook integrations within the Salsify ecosystem, enabling actions like product updates on alert triggers. Uses Salsify superuser OAuth for access control and only handles Salsify-signed webhooks from the webhook-service.

terms.name: Data Governance
terms.description: Strategies and technologies that companies use to ensure their business data is in compliance with regulations and corporate standards.

terms.name: Data Lake - Salsify Analytics Storage
terms.description: A centralized data repository at Salsify used for analytics and metrics collection. Stores GraphQL usage metrics that track which clients use specific fields, arguments, types, and enum values. This data is used by the GraphQL Schema Compatibility Checker to identify impacted clients when schema changes are proposed. Accessible via Redash at redash.lake.salsify.com. A centralized repository at Salsify (stored in S3 buckets like salsify-data) that stores raw and processed data from various sources including Mixpanel, Salesforce, and other systems. Used for analytics, reporting, and data science workloads. A dedicated AWS account at Salsify used for data infrastructure. Configured almost entirely using Terraform, with infrastructure definitions managed in the data-ops repository. Houses data processing and analytics infrastructure. A centralized data storage system at Salsify that receives structured events from various applications. Events are sent via Kinesis streams and stored in S3. Salsify's centralized data storage and analytics infrastructure. The lake-services repository provides configuration and deployment management for services that interact with or support the Data Lake.

links.description: Data Lake GraphQL Metrics Setup Guide

terms.name: Data Lake Configuration System
terms.description: A YAML-based configuration system for defining data lake tables and their schemas. Configurations are stored in S3 (bucket: 'salsify-lake-prod-configs') and define table names, databases, columns, partition columns, source formats, and file mappings. The data-lake-api dynamically generates GraphQL types from these configurations.

terms.name: GDSN Data Pool
terms.description: A certified repository within the GDSN network that stores and exchanges product data between trading partners. Can operate as a source data pool (publishing data) or recipient data pool (receiving data). Salsify operates Puddle as a source data pool. A related set of values pulled from a centralized database, such as supply chain information or employee information. In GDSN context, data pools enable secure synchronization of master data between trading partners.

terms.name: Data Recipient
terms.description: In GDSN context, typically a retailer, hospital, purchasing group, or distributor. Subscribes to and receives item data through the recipient data pool.

terms.name: Data Recipient GLN
terms.description: The Global Location Number identifying the retail partner receiving product data in GDSN (e.g., Lowes, Walmart). Each publication targets specific data recipient GLNs. Used to create synchronizations.

terms.name: Data Source
terms.description: In GDSN context, typically a Manufacturer/Distributor. Registers source data in the source data pool to be registered by GS1 and sent to the recipient data pool.

terms.name: Data Vendor
terms.description: In the context of CPDS, a third-party or internal service that provides crawled product data. Examples include Import.io (external vendor) and the Salsify Crawler (internal). CPDS determines the appropriate vendor based on the retailer and usage parameters.

terms.name: Data Lake Reporter
terms.description: A Ruby gem for sending structured events to the Salsify Data Lake via Kinesis to S3 pipeline. Provides a simple API to report events with structured payloads, integrates with rails-multitenant for automatic organization/user context, and handles background event queuing to avoid destabilizing host applications. Supports both Kinesis and logger event sinks.

terms.name: Data Engineer Takehome Challenge
terms.description: An archived Salsify repository that contained the takehome challenge for Data Engineer interviews. The repository was archived by the Data Platform team (ticket DP-457). The original content has been removed and only a minimal README remains.

terms.name: Data Lake API
terms.description: A GraphQL API service for querying the Salsify data lake. Built with Node.js, Koa, and Apollo Server, it provides a dynamic GraphQL schema that exposes data lake databases and tables. Supports querying via both AWS Athena and Presto, with configurations loaded from S3. Used for accessing syndication metrics, publication status, and other data lake resources.

terms.name: Data Ops - Data Lake Infrastructure Repository
terms.description: A GitHub repository containing Terraform definitions for the Salsify data lake AWS account. Manages infrastructure-as-code configuration for data infrastructure, SSH key deployment to Ubuntu EC2 instances, and integrates with Atlantis for Terraform plan/apply workflows in pull requests.

terms.name: Data Products Slack Bot
terms.description: An archived Slack bot integration for the Data Products team at Salsify. The repository was archived by the Data Platform team (reference: DP-460). Originally provided Slack integration capabilities for Data Products workflows.

terms.name: DataGrip IDE
terms.description: JetBrains database IDE recommended by Salsify for heavy data lake querying. Provides a more powerful interface than the Athena web console for working with Salsify's Athena-based data lake. Licenses can be requested from IT.

terms.name: Datasource Configs
