terms.description: Repository containing YAML configuration files that define data sources for the Salsify data lake. Used by lake-jobs YAML ETL module to dynamically generate Dagster assets and processing schedules for each datasource.

terms.name: Database Identifiers Configuration
terms.description: A YAML configuration file in the salsify/pganalyze repository that lists RDS database identifiers to be monitored by PG Analyze. Adding a database identifier to this file triggers infra-mgmt to create a PG Analyze user in that database and set up monitoring.

terms.name: DBT - Data Build Tool
terms.description: An open-source ELT (Extract, Load, Transform) tool used by Salsify's Data Lake team. Enables analysts and engineers to transform raw data using SQL models, apply version control, add documentation, and run tests. Each SQL file generates a table or view in the data lake.

terms.name: Data Definition Language
terms.description: SQL commands used to define and modify database schema structures, such as CREATE TABLE, ALTER TABLE, and DROP TABLE. In PostgreSQL, most DDL operations require ACCESS EXCLUSIVE locks which can cause blocking issues during migrations.

terms.name: Dead Tuples
terms.description: In PostgreSQL, dead tuples are rows that have been deleted or updated but are still physically present in the table. They consume disk space and can slow down queries. The auto vacuum process cleans up dead tuples. Postgres-vacuum-monitor tracks dead tuple counts to ensure vacuuming is keeping up.

terms.name: Debug Logger Function
terms.description: A function exported by ember-debug-logger addon that can be attached to class definitions. Automatically uses the instance's container key as the debug namespace, eliminating manual namespace specification for Ember routes, services, and components. Provides structured logging without requiring explicit namespace strings.

terms.name: Decrement Favoring Idle - Auto Scaler Feature
terms.description: An auto_scaler feature that sets the pod-deletion-cost annotation on idle workers, allowing Kubernetes to preferentially terminate idle pods during scale-down instead of pods actively processing jobs. Requires special Kubernetes permissions, must be used with decrementable=true, and requires JobPump with heartbeats enabled.

terms.name: Delayed Job - Background Processing Library
terms.description: A popular Ruby background job processing library (delayed_job) that Salsify uses for asynchronous task processing. By default uses the ClearLocks plugin to unlock jobs when workers shut down, but this only works for clean shutdowns. The delayed_job_heartbeat_plugin enhances it with heartbeat functionality for handling worker crashes. A Ruby library for executing longer tasks in the background using a persistent back-end queue. At Salsify, the delayed_job_worker_pool gem is used to run multiple Delayed Job workers in the foreground on Heroku PX dynos, rather than using the built-in daemonized worker pooling.

terms.name: DelayedJob Chainable Hooks
terms.description: A Ruby gem that provides DelayedJob lifecycle hooks allowing multiple definitions across modules or parent/child classes. Unlike standard DelayedJob hooks which can be overwritten when using inheritance or modules, chainable hooks use different method names (before_job_attempt, after_job_attempt_error, after_job_failure, after_job_success, after_job_attempt) that can be defined in multiple places and all will execute during the job's lifecycle.

terms.name: Delayed Job Groups Plugin
terms.description: A Ruby gem plugin for Delayed Job that adds job group functionality. Supports canceling all jobs in a group, canceling the group when a job fails, blocking/unblocking jobs, and running additional processing after all jobs complete or a group fails. Useful for coordinating related background jobs that need to be managed as a unit.

terms.name: Delayed Job Heartbeat Plugin
terms.description: A Ruby gem that adds a heartbeat mechanism to Delayed Job workers. Solves the problem of jobs being stuck when workers crash (rather than shutting down cleanly) by allowing jobs from unresponsive workers to be unlocked after a configurable timeout, rather than waiting for max_run_time to elapse. Workers periodically send heartbeats, and jobs from workers that miss their heartbeat timeout can be unlocked via API or rake task.

terms.name: Delayed Job Pump - Scalable Job Processing
terms.description: A Salsify Ruby gem that enhances Delayed Job performance by publishing jobs to Redis for faster job discovery and processing. The pump reads unpublished jobs from PostgreSQL and publishes them to Redis, allowing workers to quickly pop jobs from Redis queues rather than polling the database. Used extensively throughout Salsify's background job infrastructure. Enhancement to Delayed::Job addressing SQL backend scalability concerns. Uses Redis in addition to PostgreSQL for faster job scheduling while maintaining transactional guarantees. Provides improved OOM error handling. An extension to Delayed::Job that uses job metadata stored in Redis to dispatch Delayed::Job workers. Provides enhanced job dispatching capabilities by leveraging Redis for job metadata storage.

terms.name: Delayed Job Worker Pool
terms.description: A Ruby gem that enables running multiple Delayed Job workers in the foreground without daemonization. Unlike Delayed Job's built-in worker pooling which daemonizes all worker processes, this gem keeps workers in the foreground - ideal for environments like Heroku that require foreground processes. Supports memory-efficient preloading, lifecycle callbacks, and multiple worker groups with different queue assignments.

terms.name: Delayed Job Extensions
terms.description: A Ruby gem providing a collection of DelayedJob plugins, monkey patches, and test utilities for Salsify. Includes plugins for exception reporting, metrics, job tracing, organization/user context, distributed tracing, memory reporting, and queue fairness. Also provides monkey patches for bulk enqueueing, job deduplication, queue-to-worker mapping, and various bug fixes. Salsify-specific extensions to Delayed::Job providing queue fairness, job limits, user/organization execution context, metrics reporting, and exception handling integrations.

terms.name: DelayedJob - Background Job Processing
terms.description: A Ruby gem for background job processing that provides job-level hook methods (enqueue, perform, before, after, success, error, failure) and a plugin system for adding lifecycle behavior globally to Delayed::Worker. Jobs are stored in a database and processed asynchronously by worker processes.

terms.name: Demandware (now Salesforce Commerce Cloud)
terms.description: The original name of the e-commerce platform now known as Salesforce Commerce Cloud (SFCC). Acquired by Salesforce in 2016. The Salsify connector service still uses this legacy naming in its codebase. Converts Salsify channel publishes into Demandware/SFCC XML files for Master Catalogs, Site Catalogs, and Pricebooks. The original name of the e-commerce platform before Salesforce acquired it in 2016. Now known as Salesforce Commerce Cloud (SFCC). The 'DW' prefix is still used in SFCC APIs (e. json configuration files, DW API documentation).

terms.name: Demandware Connector Service
terms.description: A Salsify Ruby gem and service that converts Salsify channel publishes into SFCC (Demandware) XML files. Supports three file types: Master Catalog (product hierarchy with masters and variants), Site Catalog (categories and category assignments), and Pricebook (pricing information). Uses Amadeus::Product for casting products and follows the Demandware XSD schema for serialization.

terms.name: Dependency Resolution - Package Version Conflict Handling
terms.description: The process of handling version conflicts in npm/yarn package dependencies. When multiple addons require different versions of the same sub-dependency, package managers install both versions, but Ember's build process merges them with one version overwriting the other. This can cause silent failures or catastrophic errors. Solutions include downgrading to compatible versions, forking addons, or using package.json resolutions.

terms.name: Dependency Service
terms.description: A Salsify microservice that acts as a registry for entity dependencies. Centralizes reference tracking across different microservices, such as tracking properties configured on workflow tasks. Services register and unregister entity dependencies via Kafka events. Exposes a GraphQL API for querying dependency relations, which entity reference reports can use. Salsify service for tracking dependencies between entities across services. Receives dependency registration messages on the dependency_requests Kafka topic. Used to power reports and manage destroyed dependencies. Content-flow-service uses it to track property dependencies of TaskConfigurations.

links.description: ADR - Entity Reference Tracking via dependency-service

terms.name: Deploy Monitor - Deployment Notification Service
terms.description: A Salsify service that polls platforms (Heroku, Kubernetes) every 5 minutes to check the currently deployed commit SHA for applications. Records the latest commit for each application and sends Slack notifications when the deployed commit changes. Auto-registers Kubernetes applications that are not already tracked. Used for deployment tracking and annual audit compliance by exporting deployment lists as CSV.

terms.name: Deployed Application Model
terms.description: A Rails model in deploy-monitor that represents an application being monitored for deployment changes. Stores the application name, platform (heroku or kubernetes), and tracks the latest deployed commit SHA. Created via Rails console to register applications for monitoring.

terms.name: Deploy Generic Service Pipeline
terms.description: A Jenkins pipeline function for deploying non-Rails, non-Node services to Kubernetes. Similar to deployRailsService but skips database migrations and Avro schema registrations. Used for Go services and other generic containerized applications.

terms.name: Deployment Test UI
terms.description: A fake micro-frontend (uFE) application used for end-to-end testing of the deployMicroFrontend Jenkins deployment code. This test repository validates that the micro-frontend deployment pipeline works correctly before deploying real applications.

terms.name: Deploy Micro Frontend Pipeline
terms.description: A Jenkins pipeline function for building and deploying Ember-based micro frontends at Salsify. Unlike Kubernetes deployments, a single pipeline handles both production and staging. Supports yarn workspaces, smoke tests, continuous deployment workflows, and required status checks for SOC compliance. A Jenkins shared library function used at Salsify for deploying micro-frontend applications. Part of the jenkins-shared-libraries repository, it provides a standardized pipeline for building and deploying frontend modules.

terms.name: Deploy Node Service Pipeline
terms.description: A Jenkins pipeline function for deploying Node.js services to Kubernetes. Similar to deployRailsService but skips database migrations and Avro schema registrations. Passes YARN_NPM__SALSIFY__COM to docker build for Artifactory credentials.

terms.name: Deploy Rails Service Pipeline
terms.description: A Jenkins pipeline function for deploying Ruby on Rails services to Kubernetes. Supports database migrations, Avro schema registration, GraphQL subgraph publishing, custom Kubernetes resources, Kafka keystores for event-archiver, and continuous deployment workflows. The most feature-rich deployment function in jenkins-shared-libraries. Supports registerAvroSchemas option for automatic schema registration during deploys.

terms.name: Developer Experience
terms.description: A team at Salsify responsible for maintaining internal developer tools and infrastructure, including jenkins-deploys for CI/CD operations.

terms.name: Developer Experience Team
terms.description: A team or discipline focused on improving the developer experience at Salsify, including tooling, CI/CD pipelines, library publishing automation, and developer productivity. DevX maintains tools like library_release_tool for automated gem publishing. Team maintaining Jenkins, CI/CD pipelines, and centralized automation at Salsify. Reached via #team-infrastructure Slack channel.

terms.name: DevX Test Gem
terms.description: A test Ruby gem created by the DevX team to validate the library_release_tool automated gem publishing workflow. Used for testing GitHub Actions-based gem releases to Artifactory (gems.salsify.com). Compatible with Ruby 2.6.5, 2.7.2, and 3.0.0.

terms.name: Diacritics
terms.description: Marks, points, or signs added or attached to a letter or character to distinguish it from another of similar form, give it particular phonetic value, or indicate stress like a tilde or circumflex.

terms.name: Digital Assets
terms.description: Image, video, or any other file type stored in Salsify. Digital assets may or may not be associated with products.

terms.name: Digital First
terms.description: A communication theory that publishers should release content into new media channels in preference to old media. Approaching opportunities with the assumption solutions should be as digital as possible.

terms.name: Digital Asset Management UI
terms.description: Ember Micro App for Digital Asset Management (DAM). A frontend application that provides the user interface for Salsify's DAM functionality, allowing users to manage digital assets like images, videos, and other media. Built using Ember.js and communicates with backend services via GraphQL APIs including Dandelion and Content Flow.

terms.name: Data Inheritance Hierarchy
terms.description: Product Family - represents a means to organize product content while reusing common data across families of products. E.g., clothing: Style > Color > Size

terms.name: Data Inheritance Hierarchy Level
terms.description: A level within a DIH. E.g., in Style -> Color -> Size, Color is a DIHL.

terms.name: Direct Connection
terms.description: A type of Salsify connector that enables direct integration between Salsify and retail or e-commerce platforms. Direct Connections bypass traditional syndication methods by connecting directly to the destination platform's API, enabling real-time or near-real-time product content synchronization. Examples include con-magento, con-shopify, and con-sfcc. A type of channel integration in Salsify that provides a direct API connection to a retailer or marketplace (such as Amazon Vendor Central). Products can be accepted or rejected through this direct integration, with status tracked via Smart Lists. A type of connection where no customer action is required after pushing the publish button. Includes both API-based connections (retailer provides REST/SOAP API) and Sheets+ connections (Excel/spreadsheet-based).

terms.name: Direct Kafka Delivery Mode
terms.description: A delivery mode in email_service_client that sends email requests directly to Kafka without using the Event Publisher or database transactions. Simpler setup but lacks atomicity with database changes.

terms.name: Distributed Tracing in MetricsReporter
terms.description: A feature in metrics_reporter that enables tracing requests across multiple services. Enabled by setting distributed_tracing.enable = true in NewRelic config. Provides insert_distributed_trace_headers to add trace headers to outgoing requests and accept_distributed_trace_headers to link incoming requests to existing traces. Supports various transport protocols including Kafka.

terms.name: Delayed::Extensions::DistributedTracingPlugin
terms.description: A DelayedJob plugin that adds distributed tracing support using MetricsReporter methods. Requires a headers column on the delayed_job table. Enables tracing across asynchronous job boundaries.

terms.name: Distribution Partner
terms.description: Companies that receive product information through the syndication process in Salsify. Can include retailers, advertising platforms, ecommerce platforms, or any other entity that receives syndicated product content.

terms.name: Docker SFTP
terms.description: A Docker container for development and CircleCI that works as both an FTP and SFTP server. Based on drakkan/sftpgo, it provides a pre-configured SFTP/FTP server for local development and CI/CD testing. The container includes a 'salsify' user configured with key pair authentication for SFTP connections.

terms.name: Definition of Done
terms.description: A checklist or set of criteria in a Jira ticket that defines when a task is considered complete. PRmate uses the DoD from Jira tickets to detect missing tasks and cross-check PR descriptions against ticket requirements.

terms.name: Domo - Business Intelligence Platform
terms.description: A cloud-based business intelligence platform used by Salsify for data visualization and analytics. Salsify maintains a dedicated S3 bucket for Domo data integration as documented in the infrastructure ADRs.

terms.name: Doorkeeper - OAuth Provider for Ruby
terms.description: A Ruby gem used by catalog-auth to implement OAuth 2.0 authorization. Handles the OAuth authorization endpoint, token generation, and access token responses. The catalog-auth implementation customizes Doorkeeper to include organization_id, shareable_type, and shareable_id in access token responses. An OAuth 2 provider gem used by dandelion to provide OAuth authentication services. Applications like authentication-gateway register as Doorkeeper::Application records in dandelion to enable OAuth-based authentication flows.

terms.name: Data Products Decision Records
terms.description: A repository dedicated to collecting and organizing decision records for the Salsify Data Products team. Decision records capture and share information about decisions including title, status, context, decision rationale, and consequences. Records are organized by status (proposed, approved, implemented, deprecated) and named with date and descriptive title in format YYYY-MM-DD-title.md.

terms.name: Disaster Recovery
terms.description: A document that captures and shares information about a decision made by a team. Each decision record includes a title, status (proposed/approved/implemented/deprecated), context describing the background, the decision itself with rationale and trade-offs, and expected consequences both positive and negative. A documented process including procedures or steps (runbook) to recover business and production infrastructure in the event of a disaster.

terms.name: Dollar Retention Rate
terms.description: (Net) dollar retention rate - the percentage of recurring revenue retained from existing customers, including expansion and contraction. Based on ARR (included Upsell). One of the metrics used to measure retention (others are CRR and GDRR).

terms.name: Drummond Group - AS2 Certification Authority
terms.description: An independent certification body that provides AS2 interoperability testing and certification. Salsify uses Drummond certification to validate that its AS2 implementation meets industry standards for secure B2B document exchange with trading partners.

terms.name: Digital Shelf Assessment
terms.description: A report that assesses brands' ecommerce product content online across category and top competitors. Better content leads to better sales and increased market share. Salsify maintains an up-to-date database of millions of online products on retailers like Amazon, Walmart, and Target to produce these assessments. DSAs are generated via an ETL tool that runs in Jenkins and can be triggered by customer success requests, upcoming salsa events, or batch creation processes.

terms.name: Digital Shelf Institute
terms.description: Salsify's Thought Leadership community where you don't have to be a customer to learn about the industry

terms.name: Domain Specific Language (Excel Writer)
terms.description: In the context of con-packaged-template, a Ruby-based domain specific language used to define how Excel files are generated from target schemas. DSL files are located in config/target_schema_writers and define template locations, worksheets, start rows, and column mappings. Can be superseded by target schemas and cleaned up via rake tasks. A programming language specialized for a particular application domain. In the context of Salsify, DSLs are generated from Target Schemas by tools like DSL-O-Matic to provide domain-specific abstractions for working with product data schemas.

terms.name: DSL-O-Matic - Target Schema to DSL Converter
terms.description: A Ruby gem that converts Target Schemas into Domain Specific Languages (DSLs). Provides a programmatic way to transform the JSON-based Target Schema format into more human-readable or specialized language formats for specific use cases.

terms.name: Digital Shelf Report
terms.description: Alternate name for Digital Shelf Assessment (DSA). The terms DSA and DSR are used interchangeably in the lake-etl-dsa codebase. The DSR slide set is automatically generated from a Google Sheet containing product content analysis data.

terms.name: Drop Ship Vendor
terms.description: A vendor that ships products directly to customers on behalf of a retailer

terms.name: Digital Experience Platform (Salsify Sites)
terms.description: Salsify's platform for creating and publishing digital catalog sites. Also referred to as 'Sites' or 'Salsify Sites'. The catalog-management-service is the backend microservice that powers DXP functionality. A Salsify platform for building and managing digital experiences, including Catalogs. The DXP architecture enables microfrontend UIs and modular components for creating digital product experiences.

terms.name: DXP Catalog Composer UI
terms.description: An Ember microfrontend UI for Catalogs within the Digital Experiences Platform (DXP). Provides the user interface for the Catalog Composer feature. Runs on port 6403 locally and uses continuous deployment for automatic deployments on merge to main branch.

terms.name: DXP Catalog Website
terms.description: Next.js frontend UI for catalog sites, contained within the catalog-management-service repository. Used to build and render the static websites for DXP/Sites.

terms.name: AWS Glue DynamicFrame
terms.description: An AWS Glue Scala class used to write data to various AWS services including PostgreSQL databases. Used by page-event-reporting-etl to write processed page event data to the page-event-reporting-engine database.

terms.name: European Article Number
terms.description: A 13-digit barcoding standard (12 data + 1 check). Now renamed International Article Number. Similar to ASIN or GTIN.

terms.name: EAV Format - Extended Attribute Value
terms.description: A data format used in the Essendant integration for extended attribute files. Extended attribute files must be converted to EAV format before being written as CSV files in the Salsify-to-Enable export process. A type of data model applicable to Salsify. Translates to ID, Property, Value.

terms.name: eBay Motors US Marketplace
terms.description: The eBay Motors marketplace for the United States, a specialized marketplace for automotive parts and vehicles with its own category structure and item aspects.

terms.name: eBay US Marketplace
terms.description: The primary eBay marketplace for the United States, used as a marketplace identifier (MARKETPLACE_ID) when generating eBay schemas and category mappings in the eBay Commerce Connector.

terms.name: Enhanced Brand Content
terms.description: Amazon's A+ tool that enables brand owners to change the product descriptions of branded ASINs. Adding EBC to product detail pages can result in higher conversion rates, increased traffic, and increased sales.

terms.name: Executive Business Review
terms.description: Also known as QBR (Quarterly Business Review). Strategic review meeting with executive stakeholders.

terms.name: Elastic Block Store
terms.description: AWS block storage service for EC2 instances. CloudOps includes tag_helper_ebs.rb for cost tagging EBS volumes.

terms.name: Enhanced Content
terms.description: Rich media content (images, videos, comparison charts, feature tours) that brands publish to retail product pages to enhance the shopping experience. Enhanced Content is created using Templates and Layouts in the EC Builder UI, then published to retail destinations like Walmart, Amazon, Target, and others. Also known as Rich Media or A+ Content (Amazon terminology). Rich product content created in Salsify that can be displayed on retailer product detail pages. For Shopify integration, EC is loaded via a script from the ChatID CDN and displayed in a designated container div on product pages. Requires proper JSON payload and content tag configuration in Shopify themes. Rich product content beyond basic product information, including high-quality images, detailed descriptions, feature bullets, videos, and other media that enhance the product detail page experience. Enhanced content presence is one factor in product content quality scoring. Salsify's module that enables creating mobile-responsive enhanced layouts and publishing content-refresh products to syndication partners including Amazon and Walmart. The EC system includes a builder UI, renderer, and component library. EC Admin UI provides internal tooling for managing Enhanced Content operations.

terms.name: Enhanced Content Admin UI
terms.description: The frontend application for managing Enhanced Content at Salsify. Built separately from brand-space and compiled via yarn build. Provides the UI for the EC Builder, template management, and reporting dashboards. Located in the ec-admin-ui repository.

terms.name: Enhanced Content Destination
terms.description: A retail endpoint where Enhanced Content can be published, such as Walmart US, Walmart CA, Amazon US, Target, Lowes, etc. Each destination has specific requirements, locales, and publishing workflows. Destinations are configured in brand-space and content is syndicated to them through the publishing process.

terms.name: EC Digital Shelf - Enhanced Content Analytics
terms.description: A data domain in lake-dbt tracking Enhanced Content (EC) performance across retailer digital shelves. Includes metrics like ec_view_count, module_view_count, module_interaction_count, and ATC (Add to Cart) conversion rates. Used to measure the effectiveness of published enhanced content.

terms.name: EC Admin UI
terms.description: Internal tooling application for Enhanced Content administration. Built with Ember.js, it provides administrative interfaces for EC management, destination configuration, and demo data generation. Connects to dandelion and brand-space backend services via GraphQL.

terms.name: EC-MCP - Enhanced Content MCP Server
terms.description: A Model Context Protocol (MCP) server that provides AI agents with secure, policy-based access to e-commerce product data. Implements row-level security using CTE-based filtering to ensure users can only query data for products they have permission to access. Built with FastMCP framework and SQLite backend.

terms.name: Enhanced Content Snapshot Wrapper
terms.description: An Ember app that provides a lightweight UI shell for rendering and testing Enhanced Content product snapshots in isolation. Features include snapshot metadata display, iframe embedding, locale support, and desktop/mobile view toggling.

links.description: Package in Enhanced Content UI Repository

terms.name: Elastic Compute Cloud
terms.description: AWS virtual server service. CloudOps includes tools for cost tagging EC2 instances and certificate formatting for EC2 (format_cert_ec2.rb).

terms.name: Excel Channel Configuration
terms.description: Configuration for Excel-based channels that export product data as Excel spreadsheets.

terms.name: ECO (Ecosystem Team)
terms.description: The Salsify engineering team responsible for building and maintaining retail channel connectors and integrations. Manages AWS credentials, connector development, and retailer-specific implementations in con-u.

terms.name: Enhanced Content Publishing
terms.description: System for enhanced channel publishing. The catalog-management-service receives ECP-enhanced channel publishes from the ECP gateway via Kafka. Service providing enhanced content capabilities. Channels-ui communicates with the ECP Gateway GraphQL API for enhanced content features. A platform for conducting electronic commerce, often referring to integrations with online retail systems.

terms.name: Elastic Container Registry
terms.description: AWS Elastic Container Registry - Amazon's managed Docker container registry service used by Salsify for storing, managing, and deploying container images. Salsify has ADRs covering ECR lifecycle policies, authentication in local development, and VPC endpoints for ECR access. AWS Elastic Container Registry, used by Salsify for storing Docker container images. Jenkins shared libraries publish container images to ECR as part of deployment and release pipelines. Each container has its own ECR repository identified by imageName. AWS Elastic Container Registry - Amazon's fully managed container image registry service. Used by Salsify to store Docker images. The ecr-concierge service generates temporary authorization tokens for Docker authentication to ECR.

terms.name: ECR Concierge
terms.description: A simple web service that generates temporary authorization tokens for logging into AWS Elastic Container Registry (ECR) via Docker. Primarily used for local development support in an automated flow via the sal CLI tool.

terms.name: Elastic Load Balancer
terms.description: AWS load balancing service. CloudOps includes update_elb.rb script for managing load balancer configurations.

terms.name: Element Info Browser Extension
terms.description: A browser extension for discovering code or documentation related to DOM elements in the Salsify app. When enabled, it highlights elements with data-habanero-element-info or data-element-info-id attributes, allowing developers to click on them and access user documentation, Habanero Storybook docs, and GitHub code search links. Currently focused on Enhanced Content UI layouts.

terms.name: Executive Leadership Team
terms.description: A data integration approach where data is first extracted from sources and loaded into a target system (like a data lake), then transformed. This differs from ETL where transformation happens before loading. Salsify's data lake uses ELT patterns with AWS Glue and Athena views for transformations. The senior leadership team at Salsify.

terms.name: Email Alert Notification
terms.description: An alert notification delivery mechanism in the Alerts Service that sends email notifications when subscribed events occur. Unlike webhooks, email notifications are batched during a cooling period to decrease notification frequency at the cost of increased latency. Processed by the EmailNotificationsDeliverableEventsImporter and sent via the Email Service.

terms.name: Email Service
terms.description: A Salsify service for sending emails via a Kafka API. Handles email delivery through Postmark and provides centralized email management including delivery blocking in staging environments and template-based email composition.

terms.name: Email Service Client
terms.description: A Ruby gem that provides a thin client for sending emails via the Salsify Email Service. Supports multiple delivery modes including transactional (via Event Publisher to Kafka), direct (straight to Kafka), and trap (for testing). Enables templated email delivery using Postmark templates with support for user references, group references, or email addresses as recipients. Supports multiple delivery modes: Transactional (writes to event_publisher_events table for async Kafka publishing), Direct (sends directly to Kafka), and Trap (testing mode that doesn't send). Ruby gem for sending emails via the Email Service. Encapsulates Postmark integration so credentials can be easily rotated and providers swapped.

terms.name: Email Service
terms.description: Salsify microservice that consumes email requests from Kafka and sends email via Postmark. Handles email templating, delivery, deduplication, and recipient validation including checking for disabled Dandelion users. Supports domain/email whitelisting for non-production environments and distinguishes between permanent failures (unrecoverable) and transient failures (retriable). Salsify service responsible for sending emails. Receives events from other services like content-flow-service to trigger email notifications. Used by the Alerts Service to deliver email alert notifications.

terms.name: Embedding Property Recommendations
terms.description: A WildCats team experiment that uses embedding-based machine learning to recommend Organization Properties based on fields found in major Target Schemas. Helps users map their product data to appropriate property definitions by analyzing semantic similarity between Target Schema fields and existing organization properties.

terms.name: AI Embeddings
terms.description: Vector representations of text or data that capture semantic meaning. Used at Salsify for question-answering systems and semantic search. OpenAI provides embedding APIs, and ChromaDB is used to store and search these embeddings efficiently.

terms.name: Ember Exclaim - UI Component Framework
terms.description: A UI component framework that FlowBuilder's View DSL generates code for. The View DSL simplifies the process of writing Ember Exclaim markup by providing Ruby methods for common UI patterns.

terms.name: Ember Object Component Pattern
terms.description: The legacy component pattern in Ember.js that uses Ember's object model with computed properties. The fe-refactor-analyser identifies these as candidates for refactoring to the modern Glimmer component pattern. Detected by looking for Component.extend() patterns in code.

terms.name: Ember Block Slots
terms.description: An Ember.js addon that adds contextual layout to component interfaces by providing support for targeted yield slots within a component block. Enables component authors to create multiple named yield slots, allowing higher-order components to hide complex layouts behind clean component interfaces. Solves the limitation of Ember's single yield by providing multiple yield targets for loose coupling with structured DOM.

terms.name: ember-cli-dependency-lint - Ember Addon Dependency Linter
terms.description: An Ember CLI addon that creates lint tests to ensure only one version of any addon is active in the final built application. Detects version conflicts when package managers install multiple versions of the same sub-dependency, which can cause unpredictable behavior when the build process merges them. Generates test cases for each addon dependency and provides a manual 'ember dependency-lint' command for debugging.

terms.name: ember-cli-pact - Contract Testing for Ember.js
terms.description: An Ember addon that integrates Pact consumer-driven contract testing with Ember.js applications. Allows you to mock your API with tools like Mirage or Pretender, then verify that your mock API behaves the same way as the real one. Generates Pact contract files that can be used by the actual API's test suite to verify behavior matches.

terms.name: Ember CSS Modules
terms.description: An Ember addon that provides Ember-flavored support for CSS Modules, enabling component-scoped CSS styling. It treats styling as a first-class citizen alongside templates and JavaScript, with one CSS file per component or route controller. Classes are automatically namespaced to prevent conflicts, with explicit mechanisms for sharing styles via composition. Supports PostCSS plugins, preprocessors like Sass/Less, and Tailwind CSS integration.

links.description: Blog Post: Good Fences with CSS Modules

terms.name: Ember CSS Modules Sass Plugin
terms.description: A plugin for ember-css-modules that enables Sass preprocessing. Part of the ember-css-modules plugin ecosystem that allows bundling common configurations and extensions for reuse across Ember projects.

terms.name: Ember Debug Logger
terms.description: An Ember addon for attaching debug logging to container-managed objects. Integrates the visionmedia/debug library into Ember.js applications, providing flexible debugging capabilities with namespace-based logging. Features automatic namespace differentiation by color, time tracking between messages, and runtime enable/disable via localStorage. Includes a debugLogger function that automatically uses container keys as namespaces for routes, services, and components.

terms.name: ember-exclaim - Declarative JSON-Configurable UI Addon
terms.description: An Ember addon that allows apps to expose declarative, JSON-configurable custom UIs backed by Ember components. Uses special keys like $component, $helper, and $bind to define UI structure, data transformations, and environment bindings. Supports shorthand syntax for cleaner configuration and component composition through yielding.

terms.name: Enable - Essendant Data Source
terms.description: Essendant's data source system used for product information management. Salsify integrates with Enable through bidirectional exports: Salsify-to-Enable (daily at 5pm EST) transfers reviewed product content, and Enable-to-Salsify (Sundays at 6pm EST) imports Enable data back to Salsify.

terms.name: Engineering Portal - Internal Developer Portal
terms.description: Internal Salsify portal at engineering.internal.salsify.com providing documentation, software catalog, and developer resources. Hosts TechDocs and component information.

terms.name: Engineering Tech Survey
terms.description: A periodic survey conducted within Salsify Engineering to gather feedback and data from engineers. Results and data are stored in a GitHub repository with reports, source code for generating reports, and anonymized survey data. Surveys are organized by year and season (e.g., 2021-fall, 2022-fall). Reports are provided as HTML files that can be downloaded and viewed locally.

terms.name: Engineering Environment Setup
terms.description: A Salsify GitHub repository containing scripts and guides for setting up a development environment on macOS. Includes the setup.sh script for installing dependencies like Homebrew and rbenv, the sal CLI tool, and documentation for troubleshooting and migrating from legacy setups.

terms.name: Enhance Plus - Salsify-Webmerge Integration
terms.description: An enhancement of the integration between Webmerge and Salsify. Enables customers to generate PDF, Word, and Excel documents in bulk via custom-built channel mapping. Built as a Rack-based Ruby web application.

terms.name: Enhanced Content - Core Modules Domain
terms.description: Salsify's module that enables creating mobile-responsive enhanced layouts and publishing content-rich products to syndication partners including Amazon and Walmart. Enhanced Content allows brands to create visually rich product detail pages with images, videos, comparison charts, and interactive elements beyond basic product information. A Core Modules product domain focused on rich content experiences for retail. Includes services: retail-client-events-service, brand-space, enhanced-content-shopify. Libraries: ember-exclaim-editor. UI: ec-admin-ui, enhanced-content-ui.

terms.name: Enhanced Content Extension - Browser Extension
terms.description: A browser extension (available for Chrome and Firefox) that detects if Enhanced Content, powered by Salsify, is running on a webpage. Displays the Salsify logo when enhanced content is detected. Used for testing and verifying Enhanced Content deployment on retailer sites like Walmart and BJ's.

terms.name: Enhanced Content Renderer
terms.description: An Ember FastBoot microservice that renders Exclaim JSON into static HTML or PDF formats. Used for generating enhanced content layouts for syndication. Runs on Express.js/Node.js with fastboot-app-server and uses headless Chrome for PDF rendering. A Salsify service that renders Enhanced Content layouts to HTML for publishing. Required for publishing EC to retail destinations or for HTML rendering features like EC downloads. The rendered HTML is uploaded to S3 (or fakeS3 in development).

terms.name: Enhanced Content Shopify App
terms.description: A Rails-based Shopify App/Addon that allows Salsify customers to display their Enhanced Content on Shopify product detail pages. Requires minimal permissions (read/write ScriptTags and read/write Themes) and integrates with the Shopify App Store ecosystem. Uses OAuth for authentication and stores shop information in an ActiveRecord-compatible database.

terms.name: Enhanced Content UI
terms.description: Monorepo containing all packages that power the Enhanced Content feature set at Salsify. Includes the Enhanced Content Builder (microFE), Enhanced Content Renderer, Exclaim components, and supporting tools for creating mobile-responsive enhanced layouts. The Salsify frontend application for Enhanced Content layouts. Uses Habanero components with data-role and data-element-info-id attributes to enable element discovery and documentation linking via the element-info-browser-extension.

terms.name: Delayed::Job.enqueue_unless_duplicate
terms.description: A monkey patch method for enqueueing a DelayedJob only if no pending duplicate exists. Jobs must implement a deduplication_key method. Requires the deduplication_key column on the delayed_jobs table. Supports use_new_transaction_on_enqueue_unless_duplicate configuration for handling concurrent enqueues.

terms.name: Entitlement Reporting
terms.description: A Rails application that collects nightly statistics on customer usage by organization. Queries data from multiple sources including Dandelion DB, New Relic, Cloudinary, and Exavault. Reports on metrics such as API calls, digital asset counts, product counts, export runs, and storage usage. Data can be queried using Redash.

terms.name: Entity Reference Tracking
terms.description: A pattern for tracking dependencies between entities across Salsify microservices. Instead of each service implementing its own dependency tracking, the dependency-service centralizes this functionality by storing dependencies and providing a query interface for dependency relations.

terms.name: Entity Cache Prototype
terms.description: A prototype Go application that reads events from Kafka and stores versioned copies in Elasticsearch. This service acts as an event-driven cache that consumes Kafka messages and persists entity data with version history to Elasticsearch for fast retrieval and querying.

terms.name: Entity Event Batch Handler
terms.description: A component in the Alerts Service (Alerts::Runtime::EntityEventBatchHandler) responsible for handling batches of product or digital asset change events generated by an alert's subscription. Processes events and routes them to either webhook or email notification handlers based on the alert configuration.

terms.name: Entrypoint URL - Micro-app Entry
terms.description: The URL where a micro-app's entrypoint HTML can be accessed. Specified in the MicroAppDefinition and used by the Conductor host to load micro-apps. Can be customized per-load via the finalizeEntrypointUrl callback. Each micro-app has a unique entrypoint URL (e.g., '/uis/ember-ui').

terms.name: Enumerated Property
terms.description: Picklist/Category property type used when there is a known set of property values to choose from like brands, colors or categories. Presents users with a dropdown menu of available values that can contain hierarchies.

terms.name: Enumerated Embeddings
terms.description: Vector representations of Enumerated Field Values used for similarity matching in the Enumerated Mappings automation experiment. Created using OpenAI's text-embedding-3-small model. The optimal embedding format includes field name, target schema context, and value: '{field} ({target_schema}): {value}'.

terms.name: Enumerated Mappings
terms.description: The process of mapping customer Property Values to retailer Enumerated Field Values. Commonly used for Classifiers (product categories) where customers and retailers have different perspectives on product categorization. Traditionally done via spreadsheets (Value Mapping spreadsheets), Salsify explored using Embeddings to automate this mapping process.

terms.name: Enumerated Embeddings Experiment
terms.description: A Salsify experiment repository to assess the accuracy of using Embeddings (vector representations) to automatically generate Enumerated Mappings. The experiment tested different embedding input formats to find the optimal way to match customer Property Values to retailer Enumerated Values, achieving 24% Recall-at-1 and 42.5% Recall-at-5 with the best format.

terms.name: Enumerated Value Webhook Request Handler
terms.description: A Hermes actor that listens for EnumeratedValueChanged messages on the Kafka bus. When an organization has an entry in the enumerated_value_webhook_configurations table, it sends a webhook request to the configured URL.

terms.name: Environment Formation
terms.description: A Salsify concept for defining and managing test environment configurations. Allows adding or removing services from existing test environments and managing environment-specific settings.

terms.name: Equadis
terms.description: A company selling a PIM solution used by many manufacturers. They send their data into various platforms through Equadis-GS1 integration.

terms.name: EQUIP - Engineering Values
terms.description: Salsify engineering values: Empathy (be aware of how your actions affect others), Quality (write software that is stable, well-factored, and correct), Utility (be pragmatic, add business value), Improvement (cultivate skills), Passion (advocate for important things).

terms.name: Enterprise Resource Planning
terms.description: Systems/software used by an organization to manage day-to-day activities such as accounting, procurement, project management, and manufacturing. Provides 'single version of the truth'.

terms.name: Elasticsearch
terms.description: The main search engine behind the indexing service, powers product searchability in Salsify

terms.name: Elasticsearch Prometheus Exporter
terms.description: A monitoring component deployed on ES Ops Nodes that exports Elasticsearch metrics to Prometheus. Enables observability of Elasticsearch cluster health, performance, and resource utilization.

terms.name: Elasticsearch on Kubernetes
terms.description: Salsify's approach to running Elasticsearch clusters on Kubernetes infrastructure. Includes decisions about tenancy models and cluster management for search and analytics workloads.

terms.name: Elasticsearch Cluster Helm Chart
terms.description: A Helm chart for deploying an Elasticsearch cluster in Kubernetes. Part of the Salsify helm-charts repository. Maintained by the CloudOps team. Includes es-exporter as a dependency for Prometheus metrics export. Requires Kubernetes version 1.19.0 or higher.

terms.name: Elasticsearch Exporter Helm Chart
terms.description: A Helm chart for deploying an Elasticsearch stats exporter for Prometheus. Used as a dependency by the es-cluster chart to provide metrics monitoring capabilities. Exports Elasticsearch cluster health and performance metrics to Prometheus for observability.

terms.name: Extract, Transform, Load
terms.description: A data integration process pattern used to combine data from multiple sources. Extract retrieves data from sources, Transform converts it to the desired format, and Load writes it to the destination. At Salsify, arc-furnace is a Ruby gem that simplifies ETL tasks using a programmatic DSL with Pipeline, Source, Hash, Join, Transform, and Sink components. A data integration process that extracts data from source systems, transforms it into a suitable format, and loads it into a destination system. At Salsify, various lake-etl-* repositories handle ETL processes for different data sources like Mixpanel, loading data into the company's data lake on S3. Data pipeline pattern used in Salsify's analytics infrastructure. CloudOps contains AWS Glue CloudFormation templates including salsify_page_event_reporting_etl. json for processing page event data. The process of extracting data from a source database, formatting (transforming) it to meet system needs, and exporting (loading) it to a destination database.

terms.name: EURO-5 (European Amazon Marketplaces)
terms.description: The five European Amazon marketplaces supported by Salsify's Amazon Seller Central connector: UK, France, Germany, Italy, and Spain. Uses a dedicated EU AWS account managed by the Ecosystem team.

terms.name: Evaluation Suite - LLM Evaluation Framework
terms.description: A Python project for using Azure Evaluations capabilities at Salsify. Provides a framework for running evaluations with shared evaluators defined in the repository or service-specific custom evaluators that live in their respective service repositories. Used for AI-based project evaluation. A separate Salsify repository providing tooling for running evaluations of LLM (Large Language Model) use-cases. Dandelion integrates with this suite to evaluate AI-powered features. Based on the Azure Evaluation SDK.

terms.name: Event Group
terms.description: A unit of event tracking in the Event Group Service. Event groups form a tree hierarchy with parent-child relationships. Each event group has a system_id, parent_id, and root_id. An event group transitions through states: created, completed (when explicitly marked), and finalized (when both it and all children are completed). Root event groups have no parent_id.

terms.name: Event Publisher
terms.description: A component of salsify_kafka that provides methods for publishing messages to Kafka. Offers two modes: Transactional Event Publisher (provides a transactional Postgres gateway for atomically updating database state and enqueuing Kafka messages) and Direct Kafka Event Publishing (higher throughput option that bypasses the transactional gateway). A component of the salsify_kafka gem that writes pending events (such as email requests) to an event_publisher_events database table, which is then asynchronously published to Kafka. Provides atomic database transactions with event publishing and isolates application workers from Kafka availability issues.

terms.name: Event Archiver
terms.description: A Java service that consumes Avro-encoded events from Kafka and writes them in batches to S3 for long-term storage. Supports configurable archive formats (Avro or JSON) and handles consumer group rebalancing. Used for archiving Salsify event streams for data retention and analytics.

terms.name: Event Group Service
terms.description: A Salsify microservice responsible for event lifecycle management. It tracks hierarchical groups of events and emits finalization notifications when all events in a group (and their children) are completed. Currently used by the indexing-service to manage indexing completion tracking for DXP sites. Uses Kafka for asynchronous communication with other services.

terms.name: Event Group Requests Actor
terms.description: A Kafka actor in the Event Group Service that processes event group creation and completion requests. Uses batch processing to efficiently handle multiple requests - importing new event groups and completing existing ones in bulk. Routes messages based on root_id to ensure proper ordering of related events.

terms.name: Exavault - External File Storage Service
terms.description: An FTP service used by Salsify for file transfers with customers like Essendant. Used to transfer image linking CSVs, Enable dump files, and other integration data between Salsify and Essendant systems. An external file storage service integrated with Salsify. Entitlement Reporting tracks Exavault storage usage in bytes per organization as one of its collected metrics. Enables customers and integrations to upload/download files via FTP protocols.

terms.name: Exception Reporter - Bugsnag Integration
terms.description: A Ruby gem for reporting exceptions to monitoring services like Bugsnag and NewRelic. Provides automatic integration with Salsify frameworks (Rails, salsify_grape, salsify_kafka, salsify_graphql-server, delayed-job-extensions). Features include attaching metadata to exceptions, manually reporting exceptions, leaving custom breadcrumbs for debugging context, ignoring specific exceptions, and logging exceptions. Ruby gem for reporting exceptions to Bugsnag with proper attributes including organization, user, superuser, and service information. A Salsify gem that salsify_kafka integrates with for reporting exceptions and errors that occur during Kafka message processing.

terms.name: Delayed::Extensions::ExceptionReporterPlugin
terms.description: A DelayedJob plugin that logs exceptions and reports them to Bugsnag. Automatically registered with Delayed Job to ensure exceptions are properly handled during background job execution.

terms.name: Exclaim - Enhanced Content Layout DSL
terms.description: A JSON-based Domain Specific Language (DSL) used by Salsify to define enhanced content layouts. Exclaim JSON configurations specify components and data bindings that get rendered into HTML or PDF by the enhanced-content-renderer service. Uses $component and $bind syntax to define layout structure and bind environment data to components. A Salsify framework for building dynamic, configurable UI components. Exclaim components are used in Enhanced Content to create layouts that can be built in the EC Builder and rendered by the EC Renderer. Based on ember-exclaim.

terms.name: ExclaimUi Component
terms.description: The entry point component for ember-exclaim UIs. Accepts @ui (configuration object), @env (bindable environment hash), @implementationMap (component/helper mappings), @onChange (change callback), @wrapper (optional wrapper component), and @useClassicReactivity (flag for classic vs tracked reactivity). Renders declarative JSON configuration as Ember components.

terms.name: Expedite - Priority Target Schema Request
terms.description: A mechanism in TASER for customers to request priority handling of their Target Schema request. Organizations have expedite allowances that track how many expedited requests they can make per year. Expedited requests receive higher priority in Jira and may have different SLA handling.

terms.name: Expressivity - Enhanced Mapping UI Initiative
terms.description: A multi-phase initiative at Salsify to enhance the expressiveness and flexibility of channel mappings. Includes features for querying, filtering, and more advanced mapping transformations. Enables sophisticated data transformation logic when exporting product content to retail channels. A product initiative to improve the channel mapping user experience by making the UI more expressive and capable of handling complex nested data structures. Introduced new data models for exploded mapping and analysis, GraphQL APIs, and querying/filtering capabilities.

terms.name: Extended Attributes
terms.description: A piece of descriptive data that is added to a computer file by a user but is not part of that file's regular set of attributes.

terms.name: App Center Extension Application
terms.description: A type of application in the Salsify App Center that extends Salsify's core functionality with additional features or capabilities. Extensions add new capabilities without replacing existing functionality.

terms.name: External ID
terms.description: A customer-facing or externally-visible identifier for a Salsify organization, distinct from the internal system ID. Used for searching and referencing organizations in support and administrative workflows.

terms.name: External Routes - Host-Provided Navigation
terms.description: Routes defined by a Conductor host that micro-apps can navigate to. Specified in the MicroAppDefinition as a mapping from route names to URL patterns with parameter placeholders (e.g., 'user-detail': '/users/{id}'). Micro-apps access these via generateExternalUrl() or transitionToExternal() methods.

terms.name: External Sorting / Offline Sorting
terms.description: A class of sorting algorithms that can handle massive amounts of data that don't fit in memory. The offline-sort gem implements this pattern by dividing data into manageable chunks, sorting each chunk in memory, persisting to disk, then merging the sorted chunks back together in order. Essential for processing large datasets with predictable memory footprint.

terms.name: Facebook Catalog Direct Target Schema
terms.description: A Salsify target schema generated and maintained by the con-instagram-commerce service. Powers product content publishes to Facebook/Instagram catalogs. Field requirements are defined in instagram_commerce_ts_dict.json.

terms.name: FADEL Rights Management
terms.description: A third-party system used by L'Oreal to manage usage rights of digital assets. Rights metadata is pulled from FADEL into OpenText via a separate process, and this data is then used by Salsify integrations for asset linking decisions.

terms.name: Failure Cancels Group - Job Group Configuration
terms.description: A boolean configuration option for Job Groups that determines whether a failed job should cancel the entire group. When set to false, jobs can fail without canceling the group, and the on_completion_job will fire once all jobs have either succeeded or failed. Default is true.

terms.name: Ember FastBoot
terms.description: A server-side rendering technology for Ember.js applications. In the enhanced-content-renderer, FastBoot enables rendering Exclaim JSON layouts on the server rather than in the browser, producing static HTML output suitable for syndication.

terms.name: FastMCP Framework
terms.description: A Python framework for building Model Context Protocol (MCP) servers. Used in ec-mcp to implement the MCP server with tools for SQL query execution, content scoring, and agent instructions. Handles JSON-RPC communication and tool registration.

terms.name: Facebook Business
terms.description: A Facebook Business Manager account that owns product catalogs and Commerce Merchant Settings. Users must have administrator privileges in the FB Business to grant Salsify the necessary access for product publishing and order/inventory syncing.

terms.name: Facebook Product Catalog
terms.description: A Facebook product catalog where Salsify publishes products. Can be used for Facebook/Instagram ads and shops. Identified by Catalog ID and Catalog Name in channel settings.

terms.name: Facebook System User
terms.description: A Facebook account created in a Business Manager that Salsify uses to interact with the Facebook API. Generated during channel setup via the On-Behalf-Of flow. Has an associated access token for API authentication.

terms.name: Fulfillment By Amazon
terms.description: Amazon's fulfillment service where products are guaranteed Amazon Prime. Brands send inventory to Amazon warehouses for storage and shipping. Amazon's fulfillment service where Amazon stores and ships products on behalf of sellers. Different from Fulfillment by Merchant.

terms.name: Fulfillment by Amazon Inventory
terms.description: Commerce schema domain for Amazon FBA inventory tracking. Includes inventory summaries with fulfillable quantity, inbound quantities (working, shipped, receiving), reserved quantities, researching quantities, unfulfillable quantities, and future supply projections.

terms.name: Field Enablement
terms.description: Team or function focused on enabling field sales teams with tools, training, and resources

terms.name: FE Refactor Analyser - Script Assisted Ember App Analyser
terms.description: A TypeScript-based tool for analyzing Ember.js applications to identify components and files that need refactoring. Scans the codebase to index files by role (component, template, service, helper, model, mixin, controller, route, etc.), extracts metrics like line count, dependencies, and component types, and identifies refactoring candidates based on configurable heuristics. Used internally at Salsify for modernizing the Dandelion frontend codebase.

terms.name: EC Feature Tour
terms.description: An interactive Enhanced Content component that allows shoppers to explore product features through guided tours, hotspots, or clickable elements. Part of the rich media content types available in Enhanced Content layouts.

terms.name: Feature Flags - Feature Flag Tooling
terms.description: A Salsify repository for feature flag tooling. Feature flags (also known as feature toggles) enable controlled rollout of new features by allowing features to be enabled or disabled at runtime without deploying new code. This repository appears to be a placeholder or early-stage project for centralizing feature flag management at Salsify.

terms.name: Feedback Message Enricher
terms.description: A Ruby gem that enhances In-App feedback messages by adding informational links and Salsify recommendations. Uses a Google Sheet as the source of truth for message templates, matchers, error codes, URLs, and recommendations. Includes caching mechanisms (Redis/memory) to handle Google API rate limits. Used to provide users with helpful links to knowledge base articles and actionable recommendations when they encounter errors.

links.description: Link Enablement to In-App Feedback GSheet

terms.name: Field Condition
terms.description: A Target Schema concept that specifies conditional logic for when a field should be applicable or required. Part of the Applicable Scope system in Salsify Tailor, Field Conditions can include product type and specific field value requirements that must be met for the condition to be satisfied. A condition object in Amadeus that determines when a field or field value is applicable based on another field's value. Created using find_or_create_field_condition method and supports product types (nil, 'child', 'parent') and value arrays or 'any' for matching all values.

terms.name: Event Group Finalization Event
terms.description: A Kafka event emitted by the Event Group Service when a root-level event group becomes finalized (i.e., when the root event group and all of its descendants are completed). Services consume these events to be notified when an entire tree of events has completed. Published to the 'event_group_finalized_events' Kafka topic.

terms.name: Fix Up - Target Schema Correction Service
terms.description: A Salsify service and process for applying corrections or modifications to Target Schemas. Fix Ups are pre-configured corrections that can be applied to specific target schemas through the Fix Up as a Service API. The process includes stages: Validation, Preparation, Generation, Test, Import, and Complete. Used to automate the correction and updating of Target Schema configurations.

terms.name: Fixup / Fixup as a Service
terms.description: A mechanism for applying corrections or modifications to Target Schemas. 'Fixup as a Service' is a service that applies fixup files to a Target Schema and imports it.

terms.name: Fixup YAML Files
terms.description: YAML configuration files used to apply updates or corrections to Target Schemas. Uploaded to S3 buckets (salsify-fix-up-as-a-service or salsify-fix-up-as-a-service-staging) under the respective target_schema_id folder. Multiple fixup files can be applied in alphabetical order.

terms.name: FlagSet - Feature Flag State
terms.description: An object in infra-mgmt (ff.FlagSet) that loads all feature flag state at the time a workflow is created. Can safely be moved between workflows and activities to query flag state, preventing workflows from failing due to flag changes during their lifecycle.

terms.name: Frontline Manager
terms.description: First-level manager who directly manages individual contributors

terms.name: Flow App - Content Flow Application
terms.description: An abstraction of a content-flow flow in FlowBuilder that makes it easy to define tasks or 'controllers'. Created by subclassing FlowBuilder::App and implementing methods for app attributes like name and thumbnail_url. Can contain one or more controllers and supports tracking callbacks and shared JavaScript helpers.

terms.name: Flow Template
terms.description: A reusable workflow definition in Salsify's Content Flow system that can be imported into an organization and triggered to create tasks. Flow templates contain the structure and logic for automated workflows.

terms.name: FlowBuilder - Content Flow Workflow Builder
terms.description: A Ruby gem that makes it easy to build workflows that run on the content-flow service. Allows writing flows in Ruby and exposes a framework for developing JavaScript-heavy 'flow apps'. Provides abstractions for Apps (workflow containers) and Controllers (task definitions) with a View DSL for UI definition.

terms.name: Flow Template
terms.description: A template that defines the structure of a workflow in the Content Flow platform. Contains configuration for steps, tasks, and the overall flow of content through the workflow process.

terms.name: Fast Moving Consumer Goods
terms.description: Products sold quickly and at relatively low cost. Some are highly perishable (meats, fruits, dairy), others have high turnover (pre-packaged foods, soft drinks, toiletries).

terms.name: forego - Process Manager
terms.description: A process manager used in infra-mgmt for running all services (GraphQL server and Temporal worker) at once during local development. Invoked via 'make forego'.

terms.name: Foundations Services
terms.description: A group of core infrastructure services required for running Salsify services locally. Started using 'sds start -g foundations' command. Provides shared dependencies for services like commerce-order-service.

terms.name: Foxpass - Identity Management Service
terms.description: An external identity management service used by Salsify for user authentication and authorization. CloudAuth uses Foxpass usernames as the primary identifier when provisioning users to various services. Foxpass groups are used to determine user permissions.

terms.name: Front Page Offer
terms.description: Product placement or promotional offer on the front page of a retailer's website

terms.name: File Transfer Protocol
terms.description: A standard network protocol for transferring files between client and server. Salsify's docker-sftp container supports FTP alongside SFTP for development and testing purposes. FTP servers allow files to be accessed by unique URL.

terms.name: Fix Up as a Service
terms.description: A Salsify API service that manages and applies Fix Ups to Target Schemas. Provides endpoints to: list available target schemas with configured fix ups, retrieve active fix ups for a specific target schema, start fix up jobs, and check job status. Jobs progress through stages: Validation, Preparation, Generation, Test, Import, and Complete (or Error). The fix_up_as_a_service_gem provides a Ruby wrapper for interacting with this API. A backend service that allows internal Salsify users to update currently deployed Target Schemas using fixup YAML files. Users upload fixup files to S3, request a job via the API, and the service applies the fixups and imports the updated Target Schema to Dandelion. Currently configured primarily for Walmart target schemas under con-u.

terms.name: Full Flat
terms.description: The term used for the final print layout of a product's packaging. Generally the print layout for all information on the final product (cans, jars, trays). Can be STITCHED or UNSTITCHED images.

terms.name: Goldiloader Fully Load Option
terms.description: A Goldiloader association option that forces associations to load completely when evaluating methods like exists?, size, or any?. Prevents unexpected SQL queries by ensuring the full association is loaded before evaluation.

terms.name: Gandalf - GitHub Bot for Status Checks
terms.description: A GitHub bot that decides whether you shall or shall not pass, depending on internal Salsify processes. Powers GitHub status checks for Salsify-specific requirements including code freeze enforcement and CHANGELOG.md change enforcement for libraries (Gems, NPM packages). Can be overridden with approved labels during code freeze periods.

terms.name: Gandalf - Required Status Check
terms.description: A required status check configured in Salsify's default GitHub branch protection rules. Referenced in github-settings as a required context for pull request merges on master and main branches. Likely a CI/CD gatekeeper service that must pass before code can be merged.

terms.name: General Data Protection Regulation
terms.description: EU legislation that updates and unifies data privacy laws. Applies to companies with EU presence or that offer goods/services to EU residents. Went into effect May 25, 2018.

terms.name: Gross Dollar Retention Rate
terms.description: Based on ARR. One of the metrics used to measure retention (others are CRR and DRR).

terms.name: Global Data Synchronization Network
terms.description: An internet-based, interconnected network of interoperable data pools and a global registry (GS1 Global Registry) that enables companies to exchange standardized supply chain data. The gdsn_gateway gem provides Salsify's interface for communicating with this network.

terms.name: GDSN Gateway
terms.description: A Ruby gem that provides a simple interface for sending and receiving messages to/from the GDSN (Global Data Synchronization Network). Supports multiple communication channels including AS2, HTTP API (Global Registry), and Cleo SFTP. Handles partner configuration, message routing, callbacks for message processing, and storage backends (in-memory, local filesystem, Azure).

terms.name: Salsify Gem Server
terms.description: Salsify's private gem server hosted via Artifactory, used for distributing internal Ruby gems. Authentication is handled via ARTIFACTORY_AUTH_STRING.

terms.name: GEO Partners
terms.description: Up and coming partners that aren't RSI, GSI, or Agency partners

terms.name: gifmachine - A Machine for Gifs
terms.description: A Ruby Sinatra web application for sharing animated GIFs with coworkers. Provides an HTTP API for posting GIFs with meme text overlays (top and bottom text). Uses WebSockets for real-time updates to connected clients and is designed to run in kiosk mode on an unused computer/monitor for fullscreen display. Sometimes humorously referred to as GMaaS (Gif Machine as a Service).

terms.name: GitHub Settings Repository
terms.description: A Salsify repository that defines default settings for GitHub repositories across the organization. Other repositories can inherit these settings by referencing them in their .github/settings.yml file using the _extends directive. Works with Probot-based applications to enforce consistent repository configuration including branch protections, merge settings, and team permissions.

terms.name: GitHub Settings Bot
terms.description: A Salsify project that deploys and manages safe-settings for GitHub repository configurations. Uses the open-source safe-settings tool from GitHub to enforce consistent repository settings across the organization. Configurations are stored in the admin repository. Works in conjunction with the admin repository to apply organization-wide and repository-specific settings across the Salsify GitHub organization.

terms.name: Glimmer Component
terms.description: The modern component architecture in Ember.js, replacing the older Ember Object-based components. Glimmer components use native JavaScript classes and are identified by the fe-refactor-analyser as a component type. They represent the target state for component refactoring efforts.

terms.name: Glint - TypeScript for Ember Templates
terms.description: A tool for typed templates in Ember.js applications. The ember-css-modules addon provides Glint types for the '{{local-class}}' helper, enabling strict type checking in TypeScript templates. Requires extending the app's Glint registry with EmberCssModulesRegistry for loose mode templates.

terms.name: Global Location Number
terms.description: A 13-digit GS1 identification number used to identify parties and physical locations in the GDSN network. Used in gdsn_gateway to identify datapools, partners, and the Global Registry. Each partner and datapool is configured with its unique GLN. A unique number assigned to locations to enable worldwide identification. Part of GS1 systems. Used to identify physical locations or legal entities.

terms.name: GS1 Global Registry
terms.description: The central registry in the GDSN network that maintains product and party registration information. In gdsn_gateway, it serves as an HTTP API channel for sending and receiving GDSN messages, supporting message types like party (BPR), CIS, RFCIN, RCI, and GS1 responses. The central GDSN component maintained by GS1 that tracks registered products (catalogue items). Source data pools register products with the Global Registry before they can be synchronized with trading partners. Enables the registration and distribution of party information, identifying actors and roles in the GDSN network. Part of the GS1 Global Registry system.

terms.name: Global Record - Correlation Registry
terms.description: An organization-agnostic correlation record in the Correlation Registry service. Used when the Retailer ID to Salsify ID mapping applies globally across all organizations.

terms.name: Glue Boto3 Module
terms.description: A module within lake-athena-toolbox that provides Python functions for managing AWS Glue partitions. Supports listing partitions (glue_list_partitions), adding partitions (glue_add_partition), and updating partitions (glue_update_partition) for Glue tables in the Salsify data lake.

terms.name: Gif Machine as a Service
terms.description: A humorous acronym used to describe gifmachine, referencing the common 'as a Service' naming convention in cloud computing (SaaS, PaaS, IaaS, etc.). Used jokingly to describe the gifmachine application as a 'web-scale solution to animated gif needs'.

terms.name: Google Merchant Center
terms.description: Google's platform for managing product data feeds for Google Shopping ads and free listings. The con-google-shopping connector publishes product data to GMC via API or FTP/SFTP.

terms.name: Gross Merchandising Value
terms.description: The total value of merchandise sold through a platform or marketplace over a given period.

terms.name: Go-Live Events
terms.description: Events published to RabbitMQ by the Insights service indicating when products become live on retailer Product Detail Pages (PDPs). These events are consumed by the live-on-pdp-feedback service to generate feedback for syndication-gateway.

terms.name: Go Service Support - Shared Go Microservices Library
terms.description: A mono-repo containing shared code common to most Go micro-services at Salsify. Provides core functionality including logging, metrics reporting, and exception reporting. Serves as the foundational library for Go-based microservices in the Salsify ecosystem.

terms.name: Gold Layer - Analytics-Ready Data Tier
terms.description: The third and final tier in the medallion architecture containing aggregated, analytics-ready data optimized for reporting and consumption. Gold models are typically materialized as tables and may use incremental loading. Naming convention: gold_{domain}__{entity}.

terms.name: Golden Path Deployment
terms.description: Salsify's recommended and standardized deployment approach. Non-Golden Path deployments may use GitHub Actions as an alternative for specific use cases.

terms.name: Golden Record
terms.description: An antiquated term referring to a single version of product information. In modern ecommerce, there are multiple versions customized for each retailer or endpoint.

terms.name: Goldiloader Custom Preload Method
terms.description: A Goldiloader method for defining custom preloads in non-standard scenarios. Useful for aggregations, complex queries, external API calls, and JSONB column operations that cannot be handled by standard ActiveRecord eager loading.

terms.name: Goldiloader - Automatic Rails Eager Loading
terms.description: A Ruby gem that automatically handles eager loading in ActiveRecord, eliminating the need to manually specify eager load strategies. Transforms inefficient N+1 queries into optimized batch queries by intelligently loading associations when first accessed across all loaded models using IN clauses rather than individual queries per model.

terms.name: Google Shopping Manufacturer
terms.description: Channel type in Salsify for publishing product data to Google Manufacturer Center. Uses FTP/SFTP for delivery (pull-based instead of direct push). Legacy approach still used by some customers.

terms.name: Google Shopping Merchant
terms.description: Channel type in Salsify for publishing product data to Google Merchant Center. Supports both FTP/SFTP and API delivery methods. Uses the Google Shopping Connector service.

terms.name: Google Sheet Password Provider
terms.description: An authentication provider class in catalog-auth that retrieves passwords and user credentials from Google Sheets. Requires sharing the Google Sheet with catalog-auth-server@salsify-catalog-auth.iam.gserviceaccount.com. Supports columns for Catalog, Username, Password, and Disclaimer depending on the authentication mode.

terms.name: goprocessor - Go Apollo Router Coprocessor
terms.description: A prototype implementation of an Apollo Router Coprocessor written in Go. Used for performance benchmarking against Ruby coprocessor implementations. Supports testing with mock subgraphs and includes tooling for multi-threaded performance testing to compare Go vs Ruby (with YJIT) implementations.

terms.name: GoReleaser
terms.description: An open-source tool for releasing Go projects. Used at Salsify via the releaseGoBinary Jenkins pipeline to build and publish internal Go binaries to Artifactory. Requires a .goreleaser.yml configuration file. See go-template repository for example configuration.

terms.name: Global Product Classification
terms.description: Classifies products by grouping them into categories based on essential properties and relationships. Offers a universal set of standards for products.

terms.name: gqlgen - Go GraphQL Code Generator
terms.description: A Go library used by infra-mgmt to generate GraphQL resolvers from Schema definitions. The resolvers are added to graph/resolver.go where business logic is added. The model package serves as the public shape of data, differing from database models.

terms.name: GraphiQL - GraphQL IDE
terms.description: An in-browser IDE for exploring GraphQL APIs. Provides an interactive interface for writing, validating, and testing GraphQL queries with features like syntax highlighting, intelligent type-ahead, and documentation explorer. At Salsify, graphiql-rails-jwt is used to mount GraphiQL with JWT authentication for local development.

terms.name: GraphiQL Rails JWT
terms.description: A Ruby gem that mounts the GraphiQL IDE in a Rails application with JWT authentication support. Fork of graphiql-rails specifically designed for development environments where users need to impersonate organizations and users via JWT tokens. Allows developers to query GraphQL endpoints with customizable JWT payloads containing organization IDs, user IDs, and superuser flags.
