WARNING: Should only be used in development as it creates security vulnerabilities in production.

terms.name: GraphQL Gateway
terms.description: A GraphQL API gateway used at Salsify, with support added for test environments to enable GraphQL-based testing and development.

terms.name: GraphQL Gateway
terms.description: A Salsify service that uses Apollo Federation to serve a unified 'supergraph' composed of disparate GraphQL APIs from microservices. At runtime, the Gateway decomposes GraphQL requests into one or more subgraph GraphQL requests and returns the unified results to the client. It consists of two components: the Router (Apollo Router instance) and the Coprocessor (Go HTTP server for Salsify-specific logic like organization segmentation and JWT scoping).

terms.name: GraphQL Schema Hash
terms.description: A Node.js tool that generates hashes of GraphQL SDL (Schema Definition Language) schema files in a manner consistent with Apollo Engine. Used to create deterministic schema fingerprints for caching, comparison, and versioning of GraphQL schemas.

terms.name: Grocery Accelerator
terms.description: A specialized accelerator within Salsify designed to help grocery brands quickly onboard to Salsify with pre-configured workflows, channels, and integrations for grocery retail. Includes support for Open Catalog, Universal Properties, Nutrition Label Visualization, Grocery Category Guide, and integrations with retailers like DoorDash and Albertsons.

terms.name: Grunt - JavaScript Task Runner
terms.description: A JavaScript task runner used for automating repetitive tasks like minification, compilation, unit testing, and linting. In the context of heroku-buildpack-webapp-client, grunt is used to run the 'build' task that compiles the client application into the 'dist' folder.

terms.name: GS1
terms.description: An international not-for-profit organization that maintains the only global system for bar coding and standardized identification of products, assets, services, places and organizations.

terms.name: Global Solution Integrators
terms.description: Partners like Accenture, Deloitte, big consulting firms

terms.name: Global Trade Item Number
terms.description: A globally unique 14-digit number used to uniquely identify trade items, products, or services. Can be used to identify all trade items in the supply chain.

terms.name: Go to Market
terms.description: Go to Market strategy, referring to how products or features are brought to market. Often used in context of market verticals. Strategy that allows a company to deliver its unique value proposition to customers and achieve competitive advantage.

terms.name: Globally Unique Identifier (Brandbank)
terms.description: In the Brandbank connector context, a channel setting provided by Brandbank that defines the target environment (Staging or Production) on Brandbank's side for data submission.

terms.name: Engineering Guidelines Repository
terms.description: Central repository containing Salsify engineering guidelines, best practices, and recommendations. Published to the Engineering Portal and represents the 'happy path' of development. Includes guidelines for microservices, ADRs, Avro, feature flags, logging, database migrations, and more. Owned by all of engineering.

terms.name: Habanero
terms.description: Salsify's internal UI component library and design system. Used by EC Admin UI and other Salsify frontend applications for consistent styling and components.

links.description: Used as dependency in EC Admin UI

terms.name: Habanero - Salsify Design System
terms.description: Salsify's internal design system and component library. Components are tagged with data-habanero-element-info attributes to identify their type. Documentation is available via an internal Storybook instance at habanero.internal.salsify.com. A library of re-usable components used to build UIs across Salsify applications. Includes Storybook documentation and is the foundation for consistent UI/UX across Salsify products. Salsify's modern UI component library and design system for building frontend applications. Used as the standard for modernizing legacy Backbone and classic Ember components in Salsify micro-frontends. Salsify's design system. The infrastructure ADRs include documentation about how designers can contribute to Habanero documentation.

terms.name: Habanero CMS - OAuth Provider
terms.description: A GitHub OAuth provider that supports authentication for Habanero's Content Management System. Enables secure authentication for the Habanero design system's documentation and CMS functionality.

terms.name: Hackathon 23 OpenAI Examples
terms.description: A GitHub repository containing example notebooks for using OpenAI and associated tools created for the March 2023 Salsify Hackathon. Includes examples for langchain agents, OpenAI embeddings, chat APIs, image generation, and speech-to-text functionality. Uses Salsify's public developer documentation as sample data.

terms.name: Handlebars Template
terms.description: The templating language used by Ember.js applications. Files with .hbs extension contain component templates. The fe-refactor-analyser parses these to count component invocations and analyze template complexity.

terms.name: Headless Commerce
terms.description: E-commerce architecture where the front-end is decoupled from back-end commerce functionality. Can update/edit without interfering with front-end.

terms.name: Health Check Scoping
terms.description: A feature in the health_checks gem that allows different levels of health verification. By default health checks are shallow (no authentication required, suitable for load balancers). Clients can request deeper checks like data_stores scope to verify database and service connectivity, which requires token authentication.

terms.name: Health Check Authentication Token
terms.description: A UUID-based token used to secure access to non-shallow health check endpoints. Configured via Rails.configuration.x.health_check_token or HealthChecks.configure. Different tokens should be used per environment (development uses well-known tokens, production uses SecureRandom.uuid generated tokens from environment variables).

terms.name: Health Metrics System
terms.description: An automated monitoring and reporting system in infra-mgmt that collects data from GitHub, Snyk, and Bugsnag to identify potential issues. Tracks stale PRs, stale branches, security vulnerabilities, and recurring errors. Uses Temporal workflows for data collection with a daily scheduler running at 2 AM UTC.

terms.name: Health Checks - Ruby Health Check Framework
terms.description: A Ruby gem that provides a framework for implementing health checks in a consistent manner across Rails-based services. Features include scoping (shallow vs data store connectivity checks), token-based authentication for non-shallow checks, consistent result format, and integration with activerecord-extensions and salsify_kafka for database and Kafka connectivity checks. Ruby gem for implementing /health_check HTTP endpoints in microservices. Supports data_stores and services scopes with token authentication for deep checks.

terms.name: Health Checks Controller Module
terms.description: A Ruby module included in Rails controllers to enable health check functionality. Provides methods like data_store_checks for declaring built-in checks (database, kafka) and data_store_check for custom checks using Procs. Used to create standardized health check endpoints across Salsify services.

terms.name: Helm - Kubernetes Package Manager
terms.description: The package manager for Kubernetes used at Salsify for deploying and managing applications on Kubernetes clusters. Salsify has an ADR discussing the decision between using helm install vs helm template approaches.

terms.name: Salsify Helm Charts Repository
terms.description: A repository for storing Helm charts used in Salsify's Kubernetes deployments. Provides a lightweight way to configure and deploy Kubernetes resources across Salsify clusters. Contains charts for Elasticsearch cluster deployment (es-cluster) and Elasticsearch metrics exporting (es-exporter). Uses pre-commit hooks for documentation generation and testing.

terms.name: Hermes - AS2 Server Application
terms.description: A microservice named after the Greek God of Merchants and Schemas. Listens for messages on the Kafka bus and emits webhook request messages. Originally developed to assist SolEng (Solutions Engineering) in Belk integrations. Uses continuous deployment with commits on master automatically deployed to production. Salsify's internal AS2 server application used for certification testing. Named after the Greek messenger god. Deployed as a Docker container and handles AS2 protocol communication for EDI document exchange. Part of the as2-certification repository.

terms.name: Heroku Buildpack Multi
terms.description: A Heroku buildpack that allows running multiple buildpacks during deployment. Configured via a .buildpacks file that lists the buildpacks to run in order. Used when an application requires multiple build processes, such as building a client-side application alongside a server-side application.

terms.name: Heroku Buildpack Webapp Client
terms.description: A Heroku buildpack for grunt-based web applications located in a 'client' directory. Installs npm and bower dependencies, runs grunt, and supports compass. The buildpack runs when it finds a 'client' directory containing a gruntfile and requires a 'build' task that outputs to 'client/dist'. Designed to be used with other buildpacks via heroku-buildpack-multi.

terms.name: Higher-Order Components (Ember Pattern)
terms.description: A design pattern in Ember.js for creating composite components that arrange multiple sub-components with complex layouts. ember-block-slots enables this pattern by providing multiple yield targets, allowing component authors to manage layout changes, component updates, and action proxying without exposing implementation details to consumers.

terms.name: Delayed::Extensions::HireFire::Middleware
terms.description: An extension to the hirefire-resource gem for autoscaling DelayedJob workers via hirefire.io. Consolidates queue count queries and maps job queues to workers. Supports default_worker_name, worker_queue_mappings, static_workers, and per-organization job_limits configuration.

terms.name: High Level Technical Overview
terms.description: A document format used at Salsify to provide a high-level technical overview of a project or feature. The image-hashing-benchmarks project was created to support the Compliance Image Comparison HLTO document.

terms.name: Hierarchical Navigable Small World
terms.description: An indexing algorithm used in the Enumerated Embeddings experiment for fast similarity search across high-dimensional Embedding vectors. Implemented via the hnswlib.rb Ruby gem. Enables quick lookup of likely Enumerated Value candidates for each Property Value without costly direct similarity searches.

terms.name: Holdback - A/B Testing Control Group
terms.description: An A/B testing mechanism in Enhanced Content analytics where some page sessions have EC content withheld (hidden) to measure its impact. Enables comparison of conversion rates between users who see EC content versus those in the holdback group.

terms.name: Homebrew Tap
terms.description: A third-party repository for Homebrew formulas. Salsify maintains its own tap at salsify/tap to distribute internal development tools. Added via 'brew tap salsify/tap git@github.com:salsify/homebrew-tap.git'.

terms.name: Salsify Homebrew Tap
terms.description: Salsify's Homebrew Tap repository for distributing internal development tools via Homebrew package manager. Provides a centralized location for Salsify engineers to install company-specific CLI tools like 'sal'. Requires Salsify GitHub organization membership and SSH key configuration to access.

terms.name: Host API - Conductor Host Interface
terms.description: The domain-specific API that a Conductor host exposes to its micro-apps. Includes versioned implementation with semver matching, methods like getActiveUser(), and configuration for version mismatch handling. Micro-apps request the API via conductor.getAPI('^1.0.0') with a semver range. In Salsify UI, defined by @salsify/salsify-ui-host-api package.

terms.name: Hosting Platform
terms.description: Salsify's infrastructure team responsible for managing cloud infrastructure. Owns default PagerDuty services for microservice alerts ('Hosting Platform Production Infrastructure - Alerts' and 'Hosting Platform Production Infrastructure - Warnings'). Teams can configure their own PagerDuty services or route alerts to Hosting Platform's services.

terms.name: Hosting Platform Jenkins
terms.description: Jenkins architecture used by Salsify's Hosting Platform team for CI/CD automation. Part of the continuous delivery infrastructure.

terms.name: Hosting Platform Canary
terms.description: A canary service used to test the microservice framework and infrastructure from a hosting platform perspective. Acts as a synthetic test service to validate that the Salsify hosting platform infrastructure is functioning correctly. Runs on port 23032 in development.

terms.name: Horizontal Pod Autoscaler
terms.description: The native Kubernetes autoscaling mechanism that scales pods based on metrics. Mentioned as a potential future replacement for auto_scaler once Kubernetes provides better control over pod termination during scale-down to protect long-running jobs.

terms.name: HPI - Best Buy Vendor Portal Integration
terms.description: A Best Buy vendor portal or integration system used for product data exchange. The Best Buy HPI connector allows Salsify customers to syndicate product information to Best Buy through automated template downloads and target schema management. Templates are downloaded via browser automation using Playwright. A type of connector interface at Salsify. HPI connectors are created and maintained by the PAO team, sometimes with joint ownership with the Connections team.

terms.name: Hosted Product Page
terms.description: Enables retailers to display detailed product information based on platform data (text, picture, video, recipe). Generated on servers and called by retailers on their website.

terms.name: HTTP REPORT Method
terms.description: A registered HTTP method defined in RFC 3253, Section 3.6. Used for requesting information about a resource, typically with a request body that specifies what information is desired. The net-http-report gem provides Ruby support for this method via the Net::HTTP::Report class.

terms.name: HTTP Service - Kubernetes Service Configuration
terms.description: A ksonnify process configuration option that creates a Kubernetes Service for HTTP endpoints. Supports health checking with configurable paths for liveness and readiness probes, port configuration, service type (ClusterIP or LoadBalancer), and custom annotations. Replaces the deprecated 'ingress' configuration option.

terms.name: HTTP Runner
terms.description: A Ruby gem library to facilitate executing many HTTP requests that can be executed in parallel and generate new requests to be executed. Features include error handling by status code or exception class, retry policies, concurrent execution, support for HTTP/1.0, HTTP/1.1, HTTP/2.0, Gzip/Deflate and TLS, and definition of nested/chained requests. Loosely inspired by the scrapy library for Python.

terms.name: HTTPRunner Error Handlers
terms.description: A module in the http-runner library providing public error handling utilities. Includes log handler (logs error messages with configurable level and logger) and retry handler (retries failed requests with configurable max_retries, delay strategy, on_error and on_failure handlers). Default retry uses 3 attempts with exponential backoff delay plus jitter.

terms.name: HTTPRunner Request
terms.description: A data class in the http-runner library used to configure HTTP requests and their response callbacks. Includes HTTP attributes (method, url, query params, headers, body) and callback attributes: on_success (callable for successful responses), on_error (mapping of status codes/exceptions to callables), and callback_args (hash of arguments passed to callbacks).

terms.name: HTTPRunner Result
terms.description: A data class in the http-runner library returned by on_success and on_error callbacks. Can include result 'items' (objects to be included in the final array returned by the runner), new requests to execute, both, or neither.

terms.name: HTTPRunner Runner
terms.description: The main class in the http-runner library that executes HTTP requests. Provides the run method which accepts initial requests and a concurrency limit (default 10). Has its own on_error mapping as a fallback for unhandled errors, with default retry behavior for safe-to-retry status codes (408, 425, 429, 500, 502, 503, 504) and exceptions (ConnectionFailed, SSLError, TimeoutError).

terms.name: Infrastructure Architecture Decision Record
terms.description: Architectural Decision Records (ADRs) specifically for Salsify's infrastructure components. These documents capture significant infrastructure decisions, their context, and rationale. The infrastructure-adrs repository maintains a collection of these records organized by category (AWS, Kubernetes, Terraform, etc.).

terms.name: Identity and Access Management
terms.description: AWS service for managing access to cloud resources. CloudOps contains IAM CloudFormation templates including iamk8s.json for Kubernetes access, and tools for auditing IAM MFA status and user access keys.

terms.name: IC - Multiple Meanings
terms.description: Has multiple meanings at Salsify: Implementation Consultants (configure Salsify for customers), Incident Commander (coordination on incidents), or Individual Contributor (non-management role).

terms.name: ICAPS - Essendant Product System
terms.description: An Essendant product information system that exports data to Salsify (Sundays at 9pm EST). Uses Item Number to identify products instead of Master Item Number, requiring a mapping process to match products correctly in Salsify.

terms.name: ICECAT Dataset
terms.description: A publicly available product data catalog used at Salsify for testing and hackathon purposes. One of the approved datasets that can be used with OpenAI tools since it is public data (adhering to Salsify's 'no internal data' policy for AI services).

terms.name: Ideal Customer Profile
terms.description: Description of the type of company that would get the most value from your product or service

terms.name: Identity Provider
terms.description: A system entity that creates, maintains, and manages identity information for principals (users, services, or systems) and provides authentication services to relying applications. OmniAuth Multi Provider allows configuration of multiple identity provider instances of the same type (e.g., multiple SAML IdPs).

terms.name: Intrusion Detection System
terms.description: A device or software application that monitors network/systems for malicious activity or policy violations. Different from IPS (Intrusion Prevention System).

terms.name: ExceptionReporter::IgnorableError
terms.description: A Ruby module that can be included in exception classes to mark them as not being reported to exception monitoring services. Used for exceptions that don't need external reporting, such as bad user input errors. Part of the exception_reporter gem.

terms.name: Item Management
terms.description: 1WorldSync's Item Management system and data format. The IM Participant Dictionary defines the schema and validations for product data exchange. Salsify uses IM version files (e.g., IM8.41) to generate target schemas and models for the 1WS connector. A third-party product information management system that Salsify integrates with via the Item Master Connector. Receives product data from Salsify through XML serialization via their API.

terms.name: Image Hashing Benchmarks
terms.description: A benchmarking research project to support the Compliance Image Comparison HLTO document. Tests both the performance of different hashing algorithms and storage/indexing solutions for image comparison use cases.

terms.name: Image Compare Tool
terms.description: A debugging utility in the Compliance Reporting Engine for comparing images between two URLs for a specific retailer. Useful for troubleshooting image comparison mismatches that confuse customers, which can occur due to bot protection defenses when the system downloads images in mass vs. browser-based downloads.

terms.name: Infrastructure Management Platform
terms.description: Salsify's internal platform for managing infrastructure environments and services. Referenced in the terraform repository where environments/ directories map to IMP environments and services/ directories contain IMP service definitions with their cloud resources. Accessible at infra-mgmt. Used to view and manage services like the Configuration Manifests Service across staging and production environments. Provides visibility into service deployments across staging and production environments. Internal Salsify platform for managing service infrastructure. Internal Salsify tool for managing infrastructure, deployments, and microfrontend client revisions across environments (staging, production). Accessible via VPN at infra-mgmt. Services like content-flow-service can be viewed and managed at infra-mgmt. Services like the GraphQL Gateway can be monitored and managed through this platform. A platform used at Salsify for simplified deployment of services. Referenced in lake-services as the deployment mechanism for Data Lake related services. A Salsify internal platform for managing and monitoring services in production and other environments. Used to monitor and manage deployments of services like the Email Service.

terms.name: Implementation Map - Exclaim Component Registry
terms.description: A hash passed to ExclaimUi that maps component and helper names to their implementations. Each entry contains: 'component' (the Ember component to invoke), 'helper' (a function for helpers), and optional 'shorthandProperty' (property name for shorthand $ syntax). Controls what components and helpers are available in the UI configuration.

terms.name: Import Notification
terms.description: A webhook notification sent when an import job completes or reaches a specific state in Salsify. Delivered through the Webhook Service to notify external systems about import status changes.

terms.name: Import.io Crawling Service
terms.description: Third-party web data extraction service used by Salsify for crawling retailer product pages. Import.io data flows through the cpds-importio-service and is stored in S3 buckets (salsify-cpds-importio-service-*), queryable via import_io_output_products and related Athena tables. Captures product attributes like name, description, bullets, images, offers, and grocery attributes.

terms.name: Import.io - Web Crawling Vendor
terms.description: A third-party web crawling service used by Salsify to crawl retailer product pages and search results. Receives batches of URLs from cpds-importio-service, performs the crawling, and returns structured data. Salsify is transitioning some crawling to an internal Salsify Crawler. An external data vendor service used by Salsify for web crawling and product data extraction from retailer websites. CPDS integrates with Import. io through the cpds-importio-service to schedule and retrieve crawled product data.

terms.name: imptest - infra-mgmt Test Suite
terms.description: A test suite module in infra-mgmt for testing complete service functionality including running asynchronous Temporal workflows. Provides utilities like AuthenticateAsEngineer(), ConfigureRepository(), InsertScenario(), and RequireNoWorkflowError() for end-to-end testing.

terms.name: In-App Feedback Messages
terms.description: User-facing error and status messages displayed within the Salsify application, particularly during publication to retail channels. These messages can be enriched with additional context, links to help documentation, and Salsify recommendations using the feedback_message_enricher gem.

terms.name: Inbox-Outbox Pattern - Inter-Service File Sharing
terms.description: Pattern for asynchronous inter-service file sharing using S3 buckets with inbox/ and outbox/ prefixes. Secondary services have write-once access to inbox, primary service writes to outbox. Used when Kafka events are insufficient for data size/format.

terms.name: Incremental Model - Partition-Based Data Loading
terms.description: A DBT materialization strategy that only processes new or changed data rather than rebuilding entire tables. Uses date partitioning (min_date_inclusive, max_date_exclusive) for efficient daily processing. Requires backfills when upstream changes affect historical data.

terms.name: InDesign
terms.description: A publishing software created by Adobe. Allows you to design and publish high-quality documents for digital or print.

terms.name: Indexing Service
terms.description: Salsify microservice that enables fast and extensible indexing, percolation, and search across Salsify. Clients emit aggregate change events which the service persists to Elasticsearch and makes available via an API abstracted from the underlying schema. Handles products, digital assets, and other entities. Salsify service that powers search and indexing functionality, including the task index page in the workflow platform. Receives events from content-flow-service.

terms.name: Infrastructure Management Service
terms.description: A Salsify internal service for managing infrastructure resources. Handles scoped AWS access, scoped Kubernetes access, authentication, and deployment configuration. Uses Temporal for workflow orchestration.

terms.name: Infrastructure Architecture Diagrams Repository
terms.description: A GitHub repository containing Mermaid C4 architecture diagrams from the infrastructure group perspective. Documents the deployment architecture for Salsify applications, microservices, Elasticsearch clusters, and Kafka infrastructure. Uses C4 model notation (Context, Container, Deployment) to visualize system relationships.

terms.name: Infrastructure Management - Deployment System
terms.description: A Salsify internal service for managing infrastructure, including Kubernetes clusters. Provides a GraphQL API (via GraphiQL) for creating environments and clusters. Automatically handles cluster creation, bootstrap processes, and cluster updates via Temporal workflows. Environment status can be monitored through the UI. A service managing all things Infrastructure at Salsify, powered by Temporal and GraphQL. Consolidates infrastructure operations including deployments, health metrics, AWS credentials management, and service instance management. Built in Go with a GraphQL server and Temporal worker processes. Internal Salsify platform for managing service deployments and triggering manual deployments to staging or production environments. Accessible at infra-mgmt. com/services/con-shopify for the Shopify connector service. A Salsify repository that manages infrastructure operations. Contains Temporal workflows for various infrastructure tasks, including the rolling update of kops instance groups (migrated from k8s-admin). Salsify's infrastructure management system that automatically deploys changes to kube-prometheus on master merge. Runs UpdatePrometheus workflows via infra-temporal in the infra-production namespace. Automated deployment system that releases Kubernetes manifest changes to infrastructure on PR merge to master. Used by CloudOps for deploying applications like infra-temporal.

terms.name: Infrastructure Temporal
terms.description: An ops workload running on Kubernetes that is automatically released via infra-mgmt when CloudOps PR changes are merged to master.

terms.name: Infrastructure Labs
terms.description: A Salsify GitHub repository containing a collection of laboratories and tutorials on Infrastructure concepts and technologies. Provides tutorials with overview and in-depth explanation on engineering-facing pieces of the Infrastructure stack at Salsify, along with step-by-step How-To-Guides. Primary focus is on Kubernetes fundamentals including cluster anatomy, defining workloads, and how clusters work.

terms.name: Salsify Insights (Product Content Grader)
terms.description: A Salsify product feature that analyzes and grades product content quality on retailer product pages. Generates merchandising reports containing product page data that can be used for analytics and reporting. Data is stored in S3 and can be processed for use in data lakes with tools like AWS Athena. A Core Modules product domain focused on analytics and reporting. Includes services: analytics-reports-api, buybox-reporting-engine, compliance-reporting-engine, product-content-grader-api, search-term-reporting-engine, timeseries-service. Libraries: retailer_context. UI: analytics-reporting-ui. Salsify's analytics and reporting platform that provides various report types including Brand Compliance, Buy Box & Availability, Search Share, SEO, Product Page, MAP Violation, Traffic, and Reviews reports. Uses Target Schemas stored in Dandelion for data structure definitions.

terms.name: Insights Data Pipeline
terms.description: The data pipeline architecture that powers Salsify Insights reporting. CPDS is a component of this pipeline, providing cached product data that reporting engines use to generate reports about product information from retailer websites.

terms.name: Insights Target Schemas
terms.description: Target Schema definitions specific to Salsify Insights reports. Stored in Dandelion and backed up in the analytics-scripts repository for version control and diff comparison. Includes schemas for Analytics Reviews, Brand Compliance Report, Buy Box Report, Search Share Report, SEO Report, Product Page Report, MAP Violation Report, and Traffic Report.

terms.name: Insights Refresher
terms.description: A Shell script that cleans Salsify Insights product page data stored in S3, transforming it into a format usable by AWS Athena in the data lake. Downloads merchandising reports from the Product Content Grader API production bucket, converts multi-line JSON to single-line format using jq, and uploads the processed files to the salsify-data bucket for analytics.

terms.name: Insights Data Infrastructure Data Lake
terms.description: A repository containing collection of lake tables, queries, and views used by the Analytics Data Infrastructure team. Contains Athena table definitions for crawler data, import.io data, compliance scores, product liveness events, and timeseries data. Supports both staging and production environments with S3-backed external tables.

terms.name: InSitu - AS2 Client
terms.description: The AS2 client component used in Salsify's AS2 certification testing. Supports ADMIN mode for test execution and MONITORING mode for ongoing status checks. Part of the as2-certification repository infrastructure.

terms.name: Instacart
terms.description: A same-day grocery delivery startup offering delivery in as little as 1 hour. Customers can choose from stores like Safeway, Trader Joe's, Whole Foods, Costco.

terms.name: Instagram
terms.description: A photo and video-sharing social networking service owned by Facebook/Meta. Used for product marketing and social commerce.

terms.name: App Center Installation
terms.description: The process and state of installing an application from the Salsify App Center. Installations have different states including Running, Stopped, Completed, and Failed. The installation process may require developer contact or be automated through workflow type links.

terms.name: Channel Instructions Tab
terms.description: A tab in Salsify Channels that displays help content and documentation for users. Content is stored as static HTML in the Channel's Target Schema.

terms.name: App Center Integration Application
terms.description: A type of application in the Salsify App Center that connects Salsify with external systems, platforms, or services. Integrations enable data flow between Salsify and third-party systems.

terms.name: Integration Solutions - Core Modules Domain
terms.description: A Core Modules product domain (also known as SolEng tools) focused on customer integrations and internal tooling. Includes services: box-sync-v3, cascade, customer-hallmark, customer-hallmark-ui, customer-loreal-app, demandware_connector_service, salsisheets, soleng-charlie-work, soleng-job-runner, soleng-labs. Libraries: amadeus, muffin, soleng-arc-furnace, soleng-styles.

terms.name: Integration Testing - API Platform Testing Service
terms.description: A Ruby-based service for API-driven platform integration testing at Salsify. Provides automated testing capabilities for validating platform integrations and API behavior. Uses Foreman for local development (runs on port 21038) and RSpec for testing.

terms.name: Pact Interaction
terms.description: Captures the contents of a request from the consumer and the corresponding response from the provider. Interactions may also include additional matching rules that loosen the definition of what constitutes an acceptable 'replay' of that interaction. Each Pact test should contain exactly one interaction.

terms.name: Internal Readiness Report
terms.description: A Readiness Report based on your organization's properties. Allows analyzing product readiness based on Salsify properties and shows completion level per property at a high level.

terms.name: Inventory
terms.description: Raw materials, work-in-progress goods, and finished goods being held by the company

terms.name: Inventory Cap
terms.description: The maximum size the market service will request an inventory pool to be, and thus also the maximum quantity of inventory published to a marketplace for a specific product. Default value is 100. Can be overridden per organization using the inventory_limits_manager rake task.

terms.name: Inventory Pool
terms.description: A sub-division of inventory for a particular product, reserved for a specific purpose such as selling on a particular marketplace. For example, a product might have separate inventory pools for Amazon, Shopify, and other channels. Managed by the inventory service, with the market service listening for pool updates and requesting transfers when pools need replenishment. A Commerce domain concept representing a partitioned allocation of product inventory. Contains pool_size (total capacity), available_inventory (stock ready for orders), and allocated_inventory (reserved for pending orders). Pools are identified by organization_id, product_external_id, and pool_id.

terms.name: Inventory Trigger
terms.description: The threshold value under which the market service will attempt to replenish an inventory pool. When available inventory in a pool falls below this trigger value, the service emits an inventory pool transfer request to Kafka asking the inventory service to increase the pool size. Default value is 30. Can be overridden per organization using the inventory_limits_manager rake task.

terms.name: Inventory Service
terms.description: A Salsify Commerce service that handles inventory allocation for products in orders. When an order comes in through the commerce-order-service, the inventory-service receives requests to allocate inventory for the products in that order. Backend service for the Orders & Inventory module that handles inventory tracking and syncing. Used by commerce-ui for Inventory and Syncing pages.

terms.name: Incident Response
terms.description: An organized approach to addressing and managing the aftermath of a security breach or cyberattack. Goal is to limit damage and reduce recovery time and costs.

terms.name: International Organization for Standardization
terms.description: An independent, non-governmental international organization that develops standards to ensure quality, safety, and efficiency of products, services, and systems.

terms.name: Delayed::Extensions::IsolatedContextPlugin
terms.description: A DelayedJob plugin that runs each job with an isolated rails-multitenant context. Ensures the isolated context is set for all job lifecycle hooks: before, perform, error, failure, success, and after.

terms.name: Item Repository (Dandelion)
terms.description: The core Salsify service (Dandelion) that stores and manages product and digital asset data. Maintains alert subscriptions that use Elasticsearch percolate queries to match products/assets against subscription filters. Publishes change events to the alert_subscription_events Kafka topic.

terms.name: Item Setup Sheets
terms.description: The form a brand fills out with product content and attributes, then sends to the retailer so the product can be uploaded onto the retailer's ecommerce site.

terms.name: Walmart Item Spec
terms.description: The JSON schema files provided by Walmart that define the structure and requirements for product data in Walmart Marketplace. These files are used as input for target schema generation. Versions include Item Spec 3.X, 4.X, and 5 (latest). Item Spec JSON files are stored in the con-walmart-commerce repository under app/resources/.

terms.name: Item Master Connector
terms.description: A one-way connector service from Salsify to Item Master. Includes target schema generators for two separate target schemas: 'Item Master Connector Service' (large channel with many attributes for sending product information) and 'Item Master Content Plus' (small channel for retailer-specific product descriptions and images). Published channel data goes to a RabbitMQ queue and is processed by a Kubernetes worker that serializes product info to XML and delivers it to Item Master via API.

terms.name: JavaScript Mapping Formulas
terms.description: A feature that allows using JavaScript for complex mapping formulas in Salsify channels. Provides a JavaScript Mapping API for accessing product data, referenced products, and transformation utilities. Enables custom business logic in channel exports beyond what standard formulas support.

terms.name: Jenkins Deploys
terms.description: A Jenkins instance managed by the Developer Experience team for product teams to deploy applications and libraries. Used for running CI/CD jobs at Salsify.

terms.name: Jenkins Shared Libraries
terms.description: A Salsify repository containing shared Jenkins pipeline steps pre-configured for Salsify infrastructure. Provides standardized deployment and release functions for Kubernetes-based services, micro frontends, and library artifacts. Includes deploy functions (deployMicroFrontend, deployRailsService, deployNodeService, deployGenericService) and release functions (releaseGoBinary, releaseContainers). A Salsify repository containing shared Jenkins pipeline code, including the release-library job that uses Library Release Tool. Contains constants like LIBRARY_RELEASE_TOOL_DOCKER_TAG_VERSION for managing the Docker image version used in release automation.

terms.name: Job Group - Delayed Job Groups Concept
terms.description: A logical grouping of Delayed Job background jobs that can be managed together. Job Groups support operations like: marking queueing complete, blocking/unblocking all jobs, canceling the entire group, running completion callbacks when all jobs finish, and running cancellation callbacks when the group fails. Created via Delayed::JobGroups::JobGroup.create!.

terms.name: Job Pump
terms.description: The component of delayed_job_pump that reads unpublished background jobs from the delayed_jobs PostgreSQL table and publishes them to Redis for faster worker consumption. The pump runs as a separate process and continuously monitors for new jobs to publish. Key classes include Delayed::JobPump::Pump and Delayed::JobPump::PumpJobRepository.

terms.name: JobPump - Delayed Job Worker Enhancement
terms.description: A Salsify component used with Delayed Job workers that supports heartbeats and integrates with auto_scaler's decrement_favoring_idle feature. Version 0.55.0 or higher is required when using pod deletion cost annotations, and worker heartbeats must be enabled for proper idle worker detection.

terms.name: Delayed::Extensions::JobSecurityContext
terms.description: A module for DelayedJob jobs that specifies how organization, user, and superuser contexts are captured. Supports :required (raises error if nil), :optional (saves attribute, allows nil), and :not_captured (ignores attribute) modes. Default: organization_context=required, user_context=required, superuser_context=optional.

terms.name: Delayed::Extensions::JobSecurityContextPlugin
terms.description: A DelayedJob plugin that runs jobs in the enqueuing security context. Captures organization_id, user_id, and superuser_id from jobs and sets RailsMultitenant context for all lifecycle hooks. Supports required, optional, and not_captured modes for each context attribute. Replaces the deprecated OrganizationContextPlugin and UserContextPlugin.

terms.name: Delayed::Extensions::JobTracePlugin
terms.description: A DelayedJob plugin that logs when job attempts start and finish. Shows job details including job_id, queue_time, organization_id, and job attributes. Supports excluded_logging_attributes method for omitting large attributes from logs. Supports custom job logging via to_h method.

terms.name: JS_BLOCK - FlowBuilder JavaScript Code Block
terms.description: A format for defining JavaScript code blocks in FlowBuilder .js files. Uses //JS_BLOCK_START and //JS_BLOCK_END comments to delimit named code blocks. Blocks can be referenced in controllers via js.block_name and support the defer option for callback-style execution.

terms.name: JavaScript Object Notation
terms.description: A plain-text data format primarily developed for JavaScript, now widely used across the internet in modern web APIs.

terms.name: JSON Patch (RFC 6902)
terms.description: A JSON document format for expressing a sequence of operations to apply to a target JSON document. Defined by RFC 6902, it specifies operations like add, remove, replace, move, copy, and test. The hackathon-jsonpatch-diff library generates JSON Patch documents by comparing two JSON values and outputting the minimal set of operations to transform one into the other.

terms.name: JSON Pointer (RFC 6901)
terms.description: A string syntax for identifying a specific value within a JSON document, defined by RFC 6901. Used in JSON Patch operations to specify the path where operations should be applied. Format uses forward slashes to separate path segments (e.g., '/foo/bar/0'). The hackathon-jsonpatch-diff library implements JSON Pointer with proper escaping (~0 for tilde, ~1 for slash).

terms.name: JsonModels - JSON Serialized ActiveRecord Attributes
terms.description: A Ruby gem providing efficient, user-friendly support for JSON serialized ActiveRecord attributes and Ruby models with ActiveRecord reference attributes. Enables storing nested model objects as JSON columns in the database while maintaining proper parent-child relationships, validation, and serialization. Built on Virtus for attribute definition and supports ActiveModelSerializers for JSON output.

terms.name: JsonModels Model Base Class
terms.description: The base class for models stored as JSON in database columns. Provides nested JSON model saving, validation via Virtus, ActiveModel serialization support, parent-child relationship management, and reference associations. Models inherit attribute tracking for simple, complex (nested), and collection attributes.

terms.name: Jsonnet - Data Templating Language
terms.description: A data templating language developed by Google that ksonnify uses to template and render Kubernetes configuration output. Supports external variables (extVars) for runtime configuration. Ksonnify configurations are written as .jsonnet files that define app_name, processes, config_maps, and other Kubernetes resource specifications. A data templating language used by kube-prometheus to generate Kubernetes manifests. Allows customization of upstream Prometheus resources with Salsify-specific configurations. Build files like build. jsonnet are used to render changes added to upstream resources.

terms.name: JSON Patch Diff
terms.description: A Salsify hackathon project that implements JSON Patch (RFC 6902) diff functionality in Rust with Python bindings. Takes two JSON documents and generates a list of patch operations (add, remove, replace) that transform the original document into the target. Written in Rust for performance, with PyO3 bindings for Python integration. Supports nested objects, arrays, and all JSON value types.

terms.name: JSON Streaming Parser for PHP
terms.description: A streaming JSON parser for PHP that processes large JSON documents without loading the entire document into memory. Works similar to SAX parsers for XML, providing event-based parsing via a Listener interface. Users implement the Listener interface to receive events as the parser processes the JSON stream. Compliant with PSR-4, PSR-1, and PSR-2 standards. Published on Packagist as 'salsify/json-streaming-parser'.

terms.name: JSON Web Token - Service Authentication
terms.description: A compact, URL-safe means of representing claims to be transferred between two parties. At Salsify, JWTs are used for authentication between services, containing claims like organization ID, user ID, and superuser status. The service-security gem handles JWT generation and validation, while rack-jwt-auth provides Rack middleware for JWT authentication. In Salsify's GraphQL Gateway context, JWTs are used for authentication with two scopes: non-organization scoped JWTs (used by the API Gateway for initial routing) and organization-scoped JWTs (generated by the Coprocessor for services that require organization-level authorization). Self-contained, cryptographically signed tokens used for securing REST API communication between services. Generated via Dandelion's /api/internal/token endpoint. Contains user, superuser, and organization information.

terms.name: Kubernetes
terms.description: An open-source container orchestration platform for automating deployment, scaling, and management of containerized applications. At Salsify, Kubernetes fundamentals are covered in the infrastructure-labs repository with tutorials on cluster anatomy, defining workloads, and how clusters work.

terms.name: Kubernetes Limits Report
terms.description: A cost report generated by the cost-reporting application that analyzes Kubernetes resource limits and their associated costs in the production cluster.

terms.name: k8s-admin - Kubernetes Admin CLI Tool
terms.description: A deprecated CLI tool that provided extended Kubernetes admin functions. The logic has been migrated to infra-mgmt and is now implemented as a Temporal workflow for rolling updates of kops instance groups.

terms.name: Key Attribute - Batched Operation Grouping
terms.description: In batched_operation, a key_attribute defines how operations are grouped together. Only operations with the same key_attribute values will be processed together in a batch. Supports group_with option for custom grouping logic and optional flag for non-required attributes.

terms.name: Kibana - Elasticsearch Visualization
terms.description: An Elasticsearch visualization and management tool deployed on ES Master nodes in the Production ES Kubernetes Cluster. Provides dashboards, log exploration, and cluster management capabilities for Elasticsearch data. The visualization and management interface for Elasticsearch used at Salsify. Salsify has an ADR covering Kibana access and user management policies.

terms.name: Kinesis Event Sink
terms.description: An event sink type in data_lake_reporter that writes structured events to AWS Kinesis streams. Automatically converts stream names from snake_case to spinal-case. Used in production and staging environments. Supports batching, retries with exponential backoff, and role-based AWS authentication.

terms.name: Knowledge Owl - Knowledge Base Platform
terms.description: A third-party knowledge base platform integrated with Salsify. Users can access Knowledge Owl documentation using their Salsify OAuth credentials via the authentication-gateway. The KO Widget allows embedded access to Knowledge Owl content.

terms.name: Kubernetes Operations (kops)
terms.description: An open-source tool used by Salsify for creating, destroying, upgrading and maintaining production-grade Kubernetes clusters. The kubernetes-clusters repository stores cluster specifications as YAML files to be used with kops. Different kops versions are cached as binaries in the format /usr/local/bin/kops-v$VERSION. A tool used to manage Kubernetes clusters on AWS. At Salsify, k8s-admin provided extended admin functions for kops-managed clusters, including rolling updates of instance groups. This functionality has been moved to infra-mgmt as a Temporal workflow.

terms.name: Kroger Direct Connection
terms.description: A direct integration channel for syndicating product content to Kroger. One of the initial focus areas for the activation-validator service development.

terms.name: Kroger VIP Queue Name
terms.description: The RabbitMQ queue name used by the Kroger VIP connector service for processing publication requests.

terms.name: Ksonnify - Deployment Configuration Format
terms.description: A Ruby gem CLI tool for building Kubernetes JSON manifests from jsonnet abstractions. Wraps Jsonnet for generating Salsify deploy artifacts based on a Procfile. Used both to bootstrap new applications on Kubernetes and during deployments. Provides Salsify-specific defaults including pre-defined pod sizes (salsify_1x through salsify_8x), health checking, config maps, and auto-scaling configuration. Salsify's homegrown deployment configuration format for Kubernetes. Originally depended on the jsonnet library ksonnet, but was slimmed down to only Salsify's requirements after that project was abandoned. Originally a Ruby CLI, now directly embedded in infra-mgmt. Handles database migrations during deployment. A Salsify deployment tooling system used alongside Jenkins for Kubernetes deployments. Used in avro-schema-registry-deploy for standard Salsify deployment workflows to staging and production clusters.

terms.name: Ksonnify - Kubernetes Deployment Tool
terms.description: A Salsify internal tool used for Kubernetes deployments. Processes application configurations and deploys resources to Kubernetes clusters. Supports features like app-name-override for parallel namespace deployments, custom Kubernetes resources, and environment-specific configurations. Used by Jenkins shared libraries for Rails, Node, and generic service deployments.

terms.name: Ksonnify Build - Kubernetes Resource Generator
terms.description: A ksonnify command used to convert ksonnify configuration into valid Kubernetes JSON documents. Subcommands include 'build all' for full generation, 'build bootstrap' for cluster configuration (used by sal service create-instance), and 'build release' for deployment updates. Accepts parameters for image name, build tag, app environment, and git SHA.

terms.name: Ksonnify Init - Application Bootstrap Command
terms.description: A ksonnify command used to bootstrap deployment configuration for a new application. Generates deployment/jenkins and deployment/kubernetes directories with pipelines and configuration. Parses the Procfile to create process definitions with inferred commands, arguments, and config maps. Supports options for migrations, Avro schema registration, and superuser tokens.

terms.name: Kube-Prometheus - Salsify Kubernetes Monitoring Stack
terms.description: A Salsify repository containing configuration to deploy a Prometheus-based monitoring stack on Kubernetes. Uses jsonnet libraries to generate manifests, integrates with Thanos for long-term storage and querying, and includes AlertManager for alerting. Deployed automatically on master merge via infra-mgmt. Repository for configuring Kubernetes AlertManager alerts. Routes alerts to team Slack channels or PagerDuty based on severity.

terms.name: kubectl app - Application Management Command
terms.description: A kubectl plugin command for managing applications in Kubernetes. Supports restart, stop, and start operations. Can target specific process types within an application. Requires elevated privileges.

terms.name: kubectl authenticate - Kubernetes Authentication Command
terms.description: A kubectl plugin command that sets up the ~/.kube/config file for authenticating to Salsify Kubernetes clusters. Uses OIDC flow via kubelogin. Required before any other kubectl commands will work.

terms.name: kubectl elevate - Privilege Elevation Command
terms.description: A kubectl plugin command that grants temporary read-write privileges in a Kubernetes namespace. Base Engineer role has read-only access; this command provides 1-hour elevated access windows. Supports checking status of active elevated sessions across namespaces.

terms.name: kubectl jobs - Long-running Jobs Command
terms.description: A kubectl plugin command for creating and managing long-running jobs in a Kubernetes namespace. Supports create, get, and delete operations with configurable TTL and container sizes. Get operations do not require privilege elevation.

terms.name: kubectl rollback - Deployment Rollback Command
terms.description: A kubectl plugin command to rollback an application and all its deployments to the previous revision in Kubernetes. Supports skip confirmation with --yes flag. Requires elevated privileges. Warning: performing a second rollback restores the failed deployment.

terms.name: kubectl run-cmd - Remote Command Execution
terms.description: A kubectl plugin command to launch commands in an application's Kubernetes environment. Supports different container sizes (small to 4xlarge), process types, and quiet mode. Commonly used for running Rails console sessions. Requires elevated privileges.

terms.name: kubectl run-psql - Database Console Command
terms.description: A kubectl plugin command to run psql sessions against an application's database in Kubernetes. Supports interactive sessions or executing SQL commands directly. Requires elevated privileges.

terms.name: kubectl_plugins - Kubernetes CLI Extensions for Salsify
terms.description: DEPRECATED. A set of plugins for kubectl to perform Salsify-specific actions in Kubernetes clusters. Provides commands for authentication, privilege elevation, running commands/consoles, database access, app management, jobs, and rollbacks. Commands have been moved to the 'sal' CLI tool.

terms.name: kubectl-run-psql
terms.description: A Docker image and kubectl plugin for running PostgreSQL client (psql) commands in Kubernetes clusters. Provides a convenient way to connect to PostgreSQL databases from within a Kubernetes environment. Built and automatically pushed to ECR on merge to master.

terms.name: kubelogin - OIDC Authentication Plugin
terms.description: A third-party kubectl plugin required for Salsify's Kubernetes cluster authentication OIDC flow. Installed via Homebrew: brew install int128/kubelogin/kubelogin.

terms.name: Kubernetes Operator Pattern
terms.description: A design pattern in Kubernetes that extends the API to manage complex applications using custom resources. The auto-scaler-operator implements this pattern to manage auto-scaling configuration declaratively. Operators use custom controllers to watch for changes and reconcile the desired state with the actual state.

terms.name: kubernetes-clusters - Kubernetes Cluster Management Repository
terms.description: A Salsify repository containing code for building and managing Kubernetes clusters using kops. Contains cluster specifications, bootstrap resources (monitoring, logging, ingress), and migration tools. Clusters are created and managed via infra-mgmt using GraphQL mutations, with bootstrap resources automatically applied via Jenkins jobs.

terms.name: Lake Athena Snapshots
terms.description: A bash script repository for extracting all CREATE TABLE and VIEW SQL code from AWS Glue databases. Uses AWS Glue APIs to iterate through databases and tables, extracting the original SQL for views and storing them in organized files. Snapshots are committed via Jenkins for version control tracking of Athena view definitions.

terms.name: Lake Athena Toolbox
terms.description: A Python package providing commonly used Athena functions for the Salsify data lake. Includes utilities for running Athena queries, managing Glue partitions, and alerting. Key modules include athena_boto3 for query execution (run_query, get_query_dict, get_query_df), glue_boto3 for partition management (list/add/update partitions), and alertUtils for datetime utilities.

terms.name: Lake DBT - Salsify Data Lake DBT Project
terms.description: The DBT (Data Build Tool) project for Salsify's Data Lake. Contains SQL models that transform raw data into analytics-ready datasets using the medallion architecture (bronze, silver, gold tiers). Orchestration is handled by Dagster in the lake-jobs repository. Uses AWS Athena as the query engine. Repository containing dbt (data build tool) models for data transformations in the Salsify data lake. Used by lake-jobs ELT module to run SQL-based transformations on data stored in Athena.

terms.name: Lake ETL DSA - Digital Shelf Assessment ETL
terms.description: An archived Salsify tool that generates Digital Shelf Assessment reports. Runs in Jenkins and is triggered by three business requirements: DSA requests from customer success, upcoming salsa events, or DSA batch creation. Uses Docker to run Python scripts that query data from the product graph and generate slide decks and Google Sheets with content score benchmarks against competitors.

terms.name: Lake ETL Mixpanel - Mixpanel Data Extractor
terms.description: A Salsify tool that exports Mixpanel analytics data in JSONL format from the Mixpanel API and uploads it as gzipped files to S3. Supports extracting data for specific date ranges and is part of the data lake ETL (Extract, Transform, Load) pipeline. Outputs to the salsify-data S3 bucket by default.

terms.name: Lake ETL OwnBackup - Salesforce Data Extractor
terms.description: A Node.js application that exports Salesforce data using the OwnBackup API, extracts tables from the export, gzips them, and uploads them to an S3 bucket with a key prefix of 'ownbackup/dt=YYYY-MM-DD'. Part of Salsify's data lake ETL pipeline for backing up Salesforce data.

terms.name: Lake Google Toolbox
terms.description: A Python library for dealing with common Google Suites API use cases at Salsify. Provides utilities for interacting with Google Sheets, including functions like get_sheet_data, load_google_sheets, delete_sheet_data, and update_sheet_data. Requires OAuth authorization flow on first access and credentials.json file for local development.

terms.name: Lake Hash Column
terms.description: A Python utility for hashing column values in the data lake. Used to create consistent hash values for lake columns, typically for partitioning, deduplication, or data comparison purposes.

terms.name: Lake Jobs - Data Lake Pipeline Orchestration
terms.description: Data processing orchestrator built on Dagster for the Salsify data lake. Manages data pipelines including ETL/ELT operations, YAML-based datasource processing, customer data feeds, Salesforce data, and snapshots. Integrates with lake-dbt for transformations and datasource-configs for configuration management. The Dagster-based pipeline orchestration repository for Salsify's Data Lake. Handles job scheduling, execution, and monitoring of DBT models and other data pipelines. Manages deployment to development (staging) and production environments.

terms.name: Lake Product Graph Staging to Prod
terms.description: Scripts that gate the push of products_with_account changes from staging to prod. Part of the Data Lake infrastructure supporting the Product Graph initiative. This repository is archived (DP-426).

terms.name: Lake Redash to Sheet
terms.description: An archived Python script with custom libraries that enables taking results from a Redash query and updating a Google Sheet. Previously used by the Data Platform team for automated data reporting workflows. Archived as part of DP-462.

terms.name: Lake Services Repository
terms.description: A centralized hub for managing and deploying services related to Salsify's Data Lake. Contains configuration files, deployment scripts, and documentation to streamline service management. Supports multiple services with simplified deployment using the Infrastructure Management Platform (IMP).

terms.name: Lake SupportIQ - Support Dashboard Data Pipeline
terms.description: A data lake repository containing SQL scripts and automation for refreshing SupportIQ dashboard tables. SupportIQ is a support intelligence dashboard that aggregates data from Zendesk tickets, Salesforce accounts, and Salsify organization/user data to provide insights for support teams. The dashboards track power users, ticket severity levels, account associations, user login patterns, and Skilljar course activity. Repository archived by Data Platform team (DP-382).

terms.name: Lake Athena Toolbox Python Package
terms.description: The Python package name for lake-athena-toolbox. Installed via pip from the GitHub repository. Contains submodules: alertUtils (with alert_utils), athena_boto3, and glue_boto3. Used in data lake ETL jobs and analytics pipelines.

terms.name: Lake Google Toolbox Python Package
terms.description: The Python package name for lake-google-toolbox. Import as 'from lakeGoogleToolbox import get_sheet_data' or 'from lakeGoogleToolbox import load_google_sheets'. Provides programmatic access to Google Sheets for reading and writing data.

terms.name: LangChain
terms.description: A Python library recommended at Salsify for creating applications that use LLMs (Large Language Models). Simplifies complicated AI use cases with minimal developer overhead. Used in hackathon examples for agents, embeddings, and chat functionality.

terms.name: Laser Viper - Data Model Team
terms.description: The Salsify engineering team responsible for data model functionality. Current maintainer of the Canary Organization tooling. Team names at Salsify often use codenames like this.

terms.name: EC Layout
terms.description: A customer-specific configuration of an Enhanced Content Template. Created when a customer selects a Template and configures it with their desired Salsify property references, static values, images, and content. Layouts are composed of modules and can be published to retail destinations.

terms.name: Library Release Tool
terms.description: An internal Ruby gem CLI for managing the release of Salsify libraries (Rubygems, NPM) to private and public repositories (Artifactory, NPM, Rubygems.org). Creates GitHub Releases with Changelog information. Designed to be used programmatically by CI/CD systems like Jenkins. Supports dry run mode for testing without publishing. A tool maintained by DevX for automating Ruby gem publishing at Salsify. Integrates with GitHub Actions to automatically create git tags, push commits/tags, and publish. gem files to Artifactory when code is merged to the default branch.

terms.name: Salsify Lightbox
terms.description: A shareable collection of assets in Salsify that supports the same authentication mechanisms as Catalogs. Lightboxes can be protected using catalog-auth identity providers and share the same OAuth-based authentication flow with Catalogs. A feature in Salsify that enables sharing digital assets with external users who do not have a Salsify ProductXM login. Lightboxes provide a curated view of digital assets for external stakeholders.

terms.name: Lightboxes UI
terms.description: Ember.js web application that provides a user-friendly interface for sharing digital assets to external users without a Salsify ProductXM login. This is the front-end for the lightboxes module.

terms.name: LinkOut Component
terms.description: An Ember component from @salsify/conductor-ember that creates links to micro-app external routes. Accepts route name, optional params for route parameters, onClick callback, and disabled state. Enables micro-apps to navigate to host-defined external routes.

terms.name: JsonStreamingParser Listener Interface
terms.description: The PHP interface (\JsonStreamingParser\Listener) that users must implement to receive parsing events from JsonStreamingParser. The listener receives callbacks as the parser encounters different JSON elements during streaming parse operations.

terms.name: Live on PDP Feedback Service
terms.description: A Salsify service (code name: AWTY - Are We There Yet) that consumes go-live events published to RabbitMQ by Insights and generates Attribute, Product, and Publication feedback. This feedback is delivered to syndication-gateway so that it surfaces to Dandelion. Used to track when products are live on retailer Product Detail Pages (PDPs).

terms.name: Large Language Model
terms.description: AI models trained on vast amounts of text data that can understand and generate human-like text. OpenAI's GPT series are examples of LLMs. LangChain is designed to make building applications with LLMs easier.

terms.name: LMV (Syndicated Product Liveness)
terms.description: A feature in the Compliance Reporting Engine related to Syndicated Product Liveness Events. Has its own database schema, events schema, and multi-stage processing architecture. The LMV system appears to track product liveness across syndication channels.

terms.name: Local Class Attribute/Helper
terms.description: An Ember template attribute and helper provided by ember-css-modules for referencing CSS Module classes. The 'local-class' attribute is used on HTML elements and component invocations (e.g., '<div local-class="foo">') to apply scoped styles. The '{{local-class}}' helper provides programmatic access to local classes, with optional 'from' parameter to import classes from other modules.

terms.name: Lock Timeout
terms.description: A PostgreSQL session-level setting that specifies the maximum time to wait when attempting to acquire a lock on a table. If the lock cannot be acquired within this time, the statement is aborted. Used by activerecord-safer_migrations to prevent migrations from blocking indefinitely while waiting for locks. Default is 750ms.

terms.name: Log Service 1.x - Salsify Chat Logging Service
terms.description: An Ansible-based project for building and deploying the Log Service 1.x AMI for Salsify Chat. Uses Packer for image building, Ansible for configuration, and integrates with terraform-prosody infrastructure. The project includes image templates, Ansible playbooks, deployment files, and application code for the logging service.

terms.name: Logger Event Sink
terms.description: An event sink type in data_lake_reporter that writes structured events to a log file instead of Kinesis. Used in development and test environments. Output can be directed to a file or stdout.

terms.name: Long Running Transactions
terms.description: Database transactions that remain open for an extended period. In PostgreSQL, these can prevent auto vacuum from cleaning up dead tuples, leading to table bloat. Postgres-vacuum-monitor tracks transactions exceeding a configurable threshold (default 5 minutes) and reports their state, duration, and most recent query.

terms.name: Brandbank Lookups
terms.description: XML files containing data attribute definitions and IDs used by Brandbank's Ingestion Engine. These lookups define valid values for product attributes and are essential for data validation. They refresh daily and should be updated regularly in connector systems.

terms.name: Loopio
terms.description: An RFP tool also used to store customer security questions and answers while creating a centralized place for common content.

terms.name: Laser Viper
terms.description: Codename for a Salsify connector or retail channel integration project. Con-laser-viper provides the development environment and target schema source files for LV development.

terms.name: Login with Amazon
terms.description: Amazon's OAuth 2.0 authentication service used for SP-API integration. Provides client identifiers and secrets for authenticating API requests to Amazon's selling partner services.

terms.name: Lightning Web Components
terms.description: A modern web component framework for building Salesforce user interfaces. LWC uses standard web technologies like HTML, JavaScript, and CSS to create reusable components.

terms.name: Multilingual Content
terms.description: Abbreviation for multilingual content (m + 18 letters + t = multilingualization)

terms.name: Magento E-commerce Platform
terms.description: An open-source e-commerce platform owned by Adobe. Salsify's con-magento connector enables brands to publish product content directly from Salsify to Magento-powered storefronts, supporting the D2C (Direct to Consumer) channel strategy.

terms.name: Manifest Installation
terms.description: The process of applying a manifest's entities to a Salsify organization. Runs as an import operation, making re-installations idempotent (no-op if nothing changed). Only one installation can run at a time per manifest.

terms.name: Manifest Refresh
terms.description: The process of uploading a new or updated manifest file to an existing manifest in Salsify. A manifest can be refreshed repeatedly without creating a new manifest. When the manifest is installed, it always uses the content from the last refresh.

terms.name: Manifest Scripts
terms.description: A collection of helper scripts for working with configuration manifests at Salsify. Provides utilities for creating, refreshing, and installing manifests into organizations. Uses superuser tokens for API access and supports multiple environments (production, staging, local development).

terms.name: Monitoring, Alerting, and Observability
terms.description: Framework in lake-jobs for tracking data pipeline health. Emits events to New Relic for job runs and dbt executions, including metrics like execution duration, rows affected, data scanned, and job status. Supports cost estimation for Athena queries and SLA analysis.

terms.name: Mappings
terms.description: Bridge between customer's data schema (product properties) and retailer's data requirements. Channel mappings tie everything together for syndication.

terms.name: Marginalia - SQL Query Comment Gem
terms.description: A Ruby gem that attaches comments to ActiveRecord SQL queries. By default, it adds the application, controller, and action names as a comment at the end of each query, helping when searching log files for queries and identifying where slow queries originated. Originally created at 37signals (Basecamp). Supports MySQL, PostgreSQL, and SQLite databases.

terms.name: Marginalia Comment Module
terms.description: The core module in Marginalia that handles SQL query comment generation. Configurable via Marginalia::Comment.components to specify which metadata to include in query comments. Built-in components include: :application, :controller, :action, :line, :controller_with_namespace, :job, :hostname, :pid, :db_host, :socket, and :database. Custom components can be added by defining new module methods.

terms.name: SFCC Master Catalog
terms.description: An SFCC catalog type that defines the product hierarchy with Master Products (style-level) and Variant Products. Generated from Salsify channel publishes using PARENT_ID and STYLE mappings to link Salsify parent/variant relationships to SFCC master/variant relationships. The connector serializes master products first, then variant products, and outputs XML formatted according to catalog.xsd.

terms.name: Master Item Number - Essendant Product Identifier
terms.description: The primary product identifier used in Salsify for Essendant products. Differs from Item Number used in ICAPS, requiring a mapping process during ICAPS-to-Salsify imports.

terms.name: Pact Matching Rules
terms.description: Rules that define what constitutes a successful match when verifying interactions with data that's impossible to predict (like generated IDs or timestamps). Matchers include type(), regex(), equality(), integer(), decimal(), allOf(), anyOf(), arrayElements(), and hashValues(). Specified using specifyMatchingRules() in ember-cli-pact.

terms.name: Monthly Average Users
terms.description: Metric tracking the average number of users engaging with a product each month

terms.name: Model Context Protocol
terms.description: An open-source standard created by Anthropic for connecting AI assistants to external systems where data lives, including content repositories, business tools, and development environments. Functions like a 'USB-C port for AI applications' - providing a standardized way to connect AI applications to external systems. Supports three core primitives: tools, resources, and prompts. Adopted by major AI products including ChatGPT, Cursor, Gemini, and Microsoft Copilot. A protocol that enables AI agents to securely interact with external data sources and tools. MCP servers expose tools that can be called by AI agents to perform actions like executing SQL queries, calculating scores, or loading instructions. Supports JSON-RPC communication and can be deployed as web services. Used by Claude Desktop and other AI applications. Salsify's ai-pathfinding-projects repository includes MCP servers that allow AI agents to search and explore product catalogs via GraphQL queries.

terms.name: MCP Sites - Consumer-Facing Sites MCP Server
terms.description: A barebones Python MCP (Model Context Protocol) server for consumer-facing sites applications. Provides tools for retrieving product catalogs, getting catalog assistant instructions, flagging product content issues, and obtaining support contact information. Built using Python with uv for dependency management.

terms.name: Model Context Protocol User Interface
terms.description: A Salsify experimental playground for exploring and prototyping user interface concepts for the Model Context Protocol (MCP). This repository serves as a sandbox for MCP-UI experimentation and development.

terms.name: Master Data Management
terms.description: The effort made by an organization to create one master source for all data. Includes data cleansing, transformation, and integration capabilities. The processes, governance, standards, and tools used to manage and ensure consistency of an organization's shared data assets.

terms.name: Message Disposition Notification
terms.description: A receipt mechanism in AS2 protocol that confirms message delivery and integrity. In gdsn_gateway, MDN handling is managed through callbacks (receipt_received, receipt_sent) and can be configured for synchronous or asynchronous delivery.

terms.name: Mechanic - Improvement-Focused Engineering Role
terms.description: A rotating engineering role focused on making improvements. Unlike the Medic who handles urgent issues, the Mechanic works on smaller product work that never gets scheduled, improvements, and handling tech debt. Typically allocated 1-3 weeks with a 'bag' of things to do.

terms.name: Medallion Architecture - Data Lake Tier Structure
terms.description: A data lake design pattern used by Salsify organizing data into three quality tiers: Bronze (raw data, minimal transformation), Silver (cleaned and conformed data, business logic applied), and Gold (aggregated, analytics-ready data). Each tier is represented by folders within the DBT models directory.

terms.name: Medic - On-Call Engineer Role
terms.description: A rotating engineering role responsible for handling support escalations and urgent issues. The Medic acts as a next level of support for the Support team, investigating and resolving customer-impacting issues. When not handling specific issues, the Medic focuses on continuous improvements and unblocking the team.

terms.name: Megasurvey - Slack Survey Application
terms.description: A Slack-based application for creating and sending surveys within Salsify. Enables teams to gather feedback, conduct polls, and collect responses directly through Slack integrations.

terms.name: Delayed::Extensions::MemoryReporterPlugin
terms.description: A DelayedJob plugin that logs memory usage before and after invoking a job. Reports before_job_memory and after_job_memory in MB for monitoring job memory consumption.

terms.name: MetricsReporter Memory Sampler
terms.description: A utility class in the metrics_reporter gem (MetricsReporter::MemorySampler) that provides memory sampling capabilities. Used to collect memory usage metrics from Ruby processes.

terms.name: Merchandising Reports
terms.description: JSON reports generated by the Product Content Grader API containing product page analysis data. Stored in S3 with monthly prefixes (e.g., YYYYMM format). Processed by insights_refresher to convert to single-line JSON format for AWS Athena compatibility.

terms.name: Message Router
terms.description: A component of the salsify_kafka Actor Framework that pushes messages from Kafka into an actor's pending events table. Can be run via the rake task 'actors:route_messages'. Handles consumer group coordination and message distribution to appropriate actors.

terms.name: Avromatic Message Decoder
terms.description: An Avromatic component (Avromatic::Model::MessageDecoder) used to decode a stream of messages encoded from various Avromatic models using the messaging approach. Must be initialized with the list of models to decode, enabling a single decoder to handle messages from multiple model types.

terms.name: Metric Fetcher
terms.description: A service that runs cron jobs to pull metrics from various non-Salsify services (e.g., Bugsnag, Circle, Jenkins). Outputs metrics to files in S3 that are ingested into the data lake. Note: This service has been superseded by pa-buddy and is scheduled to be removed.

terms.name: Metric Fetcher 2
terms.description: A Rails application for automated maintenance processes for the PA team. Successor to the original metric-fetcher service.

terms.name: Metrics Reporter - New Relic Metrics Library
terms.description: A Ruby gem that encapsulates reporting metrics to a metrics service. Currently uses NewRelic via the newrelic_rpm gem as the underlying provider, but abstracts the API to allow easy swapping of providers. Provides methods for adding transaction attributes, recording events, recording metrics, starting transactions, distributed tracing, and memory sampling. Integrates with Rails, Grape, salsify_grape, salsify_kafka, Delayed Job, delayed-job-extensions, and salsify_clockwork. A Salsify library used to report application metrics to New Relic. Used by auto_scaler to report ScaleCheck events with worker queue counts, current/desired worker counts, and scaling actions. A Salsify gem that salsify_kafka integrates with for emitting metrics and transactions to New Relic. Provides visibility into actor framework and event publisher operations. Ruby gem for sending metrics to New Relic. Provides helpers for custom events with proper naming conventions (camelized words with colon-separated namespaces).

terms.name: MetricsReporter Instrumentation Module
terms.description: A module in the metrics_reporter gem that provides instrumentation capabilities.
