Includes add_method_tracer for adding method calls as nodes in transaction traces, add_transaction_tracer for starting new metric transactions, with_execution_trace for tracing blocks of code, and with_transaction_trace for tracing arbitrary code blocks.

terms.name: Delayed::Extensions::MetricsReporterPlugin
terms.description: A DelayedJob plugin that adds job information to metrics generated by the metrics_reporter gem via New Relic integration. Captures job_type, job_id, queue, queue_time, attempt, and organization_id. Allows jobs to override transaction names via the job_name method.

terms.name: Multi-Factor Authentication
terms.description: Security feature for AWS IAM users. CloudOps includes audit_iam_mfa.sh script to audit MFA status for IAM users.

terms.name: Micro-app - Microfrontend Application
terms.description: A standalone frontend application that can be loaded and orchestrated by a Conductor host. Micro-apps are independent UI applications that mount within the host's designated mount point and communicate with the host via a shared API. Each micro-app has its own entrypoint URL, root route, and can define external routes for navigation to host-provided pages. Uses @salsify/conductor-micro-app package to connect to the host.

terms.name: Micro Frontend
terms.description: A frontend architecture pattern used at Salsify where small, independent frontend applications (micro frontends) are composed into a larger application. The Enhanced Content UI Builder is implemented as a microFE that integrates into the main Salsify platform.

terms.name: Man-in-the-Middle Attack
terms.description: A cyberattack where the attacker secretly intercepts and potentially alters communications between two parties who believe they are communicating directly with each other. Without SSL certificate verification, applications are vulnerable to MITM attacks because they cannot verify the identity of the server they're connecting to.

terms.name: Mixpanel - Product Analytics Platform
terms.description: A third-party product analytics platform used by Salsify to track user behavior and product usage. Data is extracted via the Mixpanel API using lake-etl-mixpanel and stored in the Salsify data lake for analysis.

terms.name: Pact Mock Provider
terms.description: A component responsible for capturing the details of interactions that will ultimately be recorded in Pact contracts. ember-cli-pact ships with mock provider implementations for Pretender and Mirage, and also supports custom mock providers defined in tests/helpers/pact-providers/.

terms.name: Mock Subgraph - Testing Component
terms.description: A testing utility in goprocessor that simulates a GraphQL subgraph for performance benchmarking. Supports configurable response delays to simulate varying request latencies. Used to isolate coprocessor performance from actual subgraph dependencies.

terms.name: JsonModels Model Adapter
terms.description: A wrapper class in JsonModels that adapts non-JsonModels::Model objects to work within the nested model hierarchy. Allows mixing of different model types while maintaining proper parent-child relationship tracking and reference resolution capabilities.

terms.name: JsonModels Model Collection Proxy
terms.description: A proxy wrapper for arrays of JsonModels::Model objects that manages parent-child relationships for collection elements. Ensures that models added to or removed from collections are properly parented/unparented, maintaining the integrity of nested model hierarchies.

terms.name: Avromatic Model Registry
terms.description: A component in Avromatic that stores generated nested models by their full Avro schema name. Allows nested models to be shared across different generated top-level models. Supports customization to remove namespace prefixes from schema names. Accessible via Avromatic.nested_models.

terms.name: App Center Module Application
terms.description: A type of application in the Salsify App Center that provides additional modular functionality that can be enabled or disabled independently. Modules represent discrete feature sets that can be added to Salsify.

terms.name: EC Module Template
terms.description: A blueprint for a 'slice' or sub-container of UI components within an Enhanced Content Template. Each module represents a distinct section like 'Standard Left Image and Text' which includes specific UI components (image, header, paragraph). ModuleTemplates are versioned and defined in the app/models/m directory. When modules need breaking changes, a new version is created to preserve existing customer layouts.

terms.name: Monorail - Target Schema Generator Repository
terms.description: A GitHub repository (Salsify-ts/monorail) that contains Target Schema builder configurations. TASER's MonorailIngest job attempts to match incoming Target Schema requests against existing builders in Monorail and ingest files into the correct subfolder. Part of the dream to have only two generator repos (Monorail and Auto-dump) and phase out legacy builders.

terms.name: Mount Point - Micro-app Container
terms.description: The DOM node where Conductor micro-apps are mounted. Provided to the Conductor host during initialization and accessed by micro-apps via getMountPoint(). During loading, the mount point receives a 'data-conductor-hidden' attribute to prevent showing partially rendered content.

terms.name: Message Router 3
terms.description: 1WorldSync's message routing system used for GDSN data synchronization. The destination queue '1WorldSync.MR3' and connector 'Salsify.1WorldSync.MR3' are used in publish request payloads to route product data through 1WorldSync's infrastructure.

terms.name: Most Recent Crawl Source Data Timestamp
terms.description: Timestamp field in syndicated products compliance data indicating when the most recent crawl source data was captured. Used alongside crawl_data_timestamp to track freshness of compliance score comparisons.

terms.name: Merchandise Type Attribute
terms.description: An attribute in Amazon's product data model that categorizes products by their merchandise type.

terms.name: Muffin - Solution Engineering Gem
terms.description: A Ruby gem developed by Salsify's Solution Engineering (SolEng) team providing various clients and helpers for internal services. Includes the Analytics Reports Client for uploading reports to the Salsify Insights tab, and Admin Audits Helpers for paginated access to audit events and modifications. Used to integrate with services like salsify-analytics-reports-api and the Audits Service.

terms.name: Multi-value Property
terms.description: A property that stores more than one piece of product information in separate Salsify values within a single property. Not a comma-separated list in a single value.

terms.name: MyWebGrocer
terms.description: A leading software and digital media company connecting Retailers, Manufacturers and Consumers through modular products and services.

terms.name: Marketplace Web Service
terms.description: Amazon's legacy API for marketplace sellers, now replaced by the Selling Partner API (SP-API). MWS was used for product listings, orders, inventory management, and other marketplace operations. The con-mws-commerce connector at Salsify was originally built for MWS but has since migrated to SP-API. Used for automating data exchange between sellers and Amazon's marketplaces.

terms.name: N+1 Query Problem
terms.description: A common database performance anti-pattern where code executes N additional queries to fetch related data for N records, instead of fetching all data in a single query. In the context of inserts, this means generating one INSERT statement per record instead of bulk inserting all records at once. activerecord-import solves this by generating minimal SQL insert statements that follow associations.

terms.name: N+1 Query Problem
terms.description: A common performance issue in ActiveRecord applications where accessing associations on a collection of models results in one query per model (N queries) plus the initial query to load the collection (1 query). Goldiloader solves this by automatically batch-loading associations using IN clauses.

terms.name: Nested JSON Model Attribute Declaration
terms.description: A DSL method in JsonModels for declaring that an ActiveRecord attribute contains a serialized JSON model. Automatically generates setters that handle hash coercion, parent relationship management, and nested model validation. Supports both single model and array model attributes.

terms.name: Net::HTTP::Report - HTTP REPORT Request Library
terms.description: A Ruby gem that adds the Net::HTTP::Report class for building HTTP REPORT requests using Ruby's standard net/http library. HTTP REPORT is a registered HTTP method defined in RFC 3253, Section 3.6. The gem allows sending REPORT requests with payloads (such as JSON) and follows the same patterns as other Net::HTTPRequest classes.

terms.name: Netlify CMS
terms.description: An open-source content management system for static site generators. Provides a web-based editing interface that commits content changes directly to Git repositories. Supports external authentication providers (since version 0.4.3) allowing self-hosted OAuth solutions like netlify-cms-github-oauth-provider.

terms.name: Netlify CMS GitHub OAuth Provider
terms.description: A Node.js OAuth authentication provider for Netlify CMS that enables GitHub, GitHub Enterprise, and GitLab authentication. Created by reverse engineering Netlify's own GitHub OAuth client, it allows self-hosting the OAuth flow instead of relying on Netlify's service. Sends tokens in form format as Netlify's service does. Supports environment-based configuration for OAuth credentials, origins, and custom hostnames.

terms.name: Salsify Network
terms.description: The ecosystem of brands and retailers connected through the Salsify platform. Brands publish product content to retailers through the network. The network-growth-viz project visualizes how this network of connections has grown over time, showing the relationships between brands (content creators) and retailers (content destinations).

terms.name: Network Growth Visualization
terms.description: A hackathon project that visualizes Salsify's network growth over time using D3.js. Displays brands and retailers as nodes in a force-directed graph, with connections representing publishing relationships. Node sizes are proportional to publish counts, with brands shown in cyan (#00c4ff) and retailers in purple (#8a25f9). The visualization animates through monthly snapshots to show how the Salsify network expanded.

terms.name: New Relic - Observability Platform
terms.description: An observability platform used by Salsify for logging infrastructure and monitoring. Salsify has ADRs covering the switch to New Relic for logging, use of drop filters for log management, and removal of distributed tracing.

terms.name: NewRelic Firehose
terms.description: NewRelic data stream archived to S3 (new-relic-firehose bucket) and queryable via Athena. Used by the Insights Data Infrastructure team to analyze CPDS query patterns, determine crawling schedules, and generate usage statistics by retailer and organization.

terms.name: New Item Setup
terms.description: The process of populating product data in a retailer's system for the first time. Contrasts with 'content refresh' which updates existing product data. Retailer process to add a new product they haven't received product information for before.

terms.name: National Institute of Standards and Technology
terms.description: US Department of Commerce organization that develops information technology best practices including a framework for cybersecurity.

terms.name: Non-Breaking Error
terms.description: In the salsify_kafka Actor Framework, an error type that allows an actor to continue processing subsequent events after a failure instead of becoming broken. Useful for scenarios like external webhooks that may only succeed for certain payloads.

terms.name: Non-Product Entity
terms.description: An entity type in Salsify that is not a product but can participate in data inheritance hierarchies. NPEs have a type property and pointer properties that define relationships to other entities. Used in Cascade for propagating data through hierarchies alongside regular products.

terms.name: Net Promoter Score
terms.description: Measures how well you're being perceived by audience. Scale: 0-6 detractors, 7-8 passive, 9-10 promoters. Passives don't count.

terms.name: New Relic Query Language
terms.description: Used to gather and monitor metrics about systems in New Relic

terms.name: NTC - Jira Project
terms.description: A Jira project identifier used at Salsify. Referenced in the clavis-connector decommission ticket (NTC-2129).

terms.name: Orders & Inventory
terms.description: A Salsify module that handles order management and inventory tracking. The front-end is powered by commerce-ui, with backend services including commerce-order-service, commerce-event-service, commerce-market-service, and inventory-service.

terms.name: Orders and Inventory
terms.description: Refers to the orders and inventory syncing functionality at Salsify. O+I syncing allows customers to synchronize order and inventory data between Salsify and external marketplaces like Amazon Seller Central. Historically relied on dandelion Channel objects but is migrating to CommerceConnection objects via the commerce-config-service.

terms.name: Open Authorization
terms.description: An open standard authorization protocol that enables applications to access user data from other services without exposing credentials. In the context of netlify-cms-github-oauth-provider, OAuth is used to authenticate users with GitHub or GitLab, allowing Netlify CMS to make commits on their behalf.

terms.name: OAuth 2.0
terms.description: An authorization framework that enables applications to obtain limited access to user accounts on third-party services. OAuth2 is one of the identity provider types supported by OmniAuth Multi Provider for multi-provider authentication scenarios.

terms.name: On-Behalf-Of Flow
terms.description: Facebook's authentication flow used by Salsify connectors to act on behalf of a user. After user authorization, Salsify uses this flow to ensure a System User exists in the FB Business with the necessary access to publish products and sync orders/inventory.

terms.name: OBT - Onboarding Tool Command
terms.description: The CLI command used to interact with CloudAuth for user provisioning. Supports commands like 'obt add' for adding users to services, 'obt project_ids' for fetching project/team IDs, and flags like '-r' for real (non-dry-run) execution and '-l' for specifying specific services.

terms.name: Omnichannel Buying Experience
terms.description: The experience of purchasing products across multiple channels seamlessly

terms.name: offline-sort - Ruby Gem for Memory-Efficient Sorting
terms.description: A Ruby gem to sort arbitrarily large collections of data with limited and predictable memory usage. Works by breaking input data into sorted chunks, persisting the chunks to disk, and returning an Enumerator that streams results in final sorted order. Supports configurable chunk sizes and multiple serialization strategies including Marshal, MessagePack, and YAML.

terms.name: OmniAuth - Ruby Authentication Framework
terms.description: A flexible authentication library for Ruby/Rails applications that standardizes multi-provider authentication. OmniAuth provides a common interface for authenticating users via different strategies (SAML, OAuth, OAuth2, etc.). The omniauth-multi-provider gem extends OmniAuth to support multiple instances of the same provider type. A Ruby authentication framework that standardizes multi-provider authentication. Allows applications to authenticate against various providers (like Box, Google, Facebook) using a consistent interface. OmniAuth strategies are gems that implement provider-specific authentication logic.

terms.name: OmniAuth Salsify Strategy
terms.description: A Ruby gem that provides an OmniAuth strategy for Salsify OAuth2 authentication. Allows applications to use OmniAuth as the OAuth2 client for authenticating users against Salsify. Supports both standard user OAuth applications and superuser OAuth applications. Provides routes for initiating authentication flows and handling callbacks.

terms.name: OmniAuth Box OAuth2 Strategy
terms.description: An unofficial OmniAuth strategy for authenticating to Box using OAuth v2 API. A Ruby gem that enables Salsify applications to authenticate users via Box cloud storage service. Requires Box Developer API credentials (BOX_KEY and BOX_SECRET) for configuration.

terms.name: OmniAuth Multi Provider
terms.description: A Ruby gem that provides a simple extension to OmniAuth for supporting multiple identity provider instances of a given type. Generalizes the omniauth-multi-provider-saml approach to work with various identity providers like SAML or OAuth2. Allows dynamic configuration of multiple provider instances through OmniAuth::MultiProvider.register() with support for identity_provider_id_regex and path_prefix options.

terms.name: OmniAuth Salsify Gem
terms.description: A Ruby gem that provides OmniAuth strategy for Salsify authentication. Used by Cloud File Service (CFS) to ensure users have a valid Salsify session when integrating from third-party applications. Redirects users to the Salsify login page if no session is found.

terms.name: Omnichannel
terms.description: A cross-channel strategy to improve customer experience. Channels cooperate together so consumers have one seamless experience across all platforms (in store, retail sites, D2C sites).

terms.name: Order Management System
terms.description: Software that organizes and facilitates order fulfillment process across channels. Brings together order processing, customer service, inventory/warehouse management, and accounting.

terms.name: On Cancellation Job - Job Group Callback
terms.description: A job registered with a Job Group that runs if the group is canceled or fails. Configured when creating a JobGroup via the on_cancellation_job parameter. Can include additional options via on_cancellation_job_options (e.g., queue, priority).

terms.name: On Completion Job - Job Group Callback
terms.description: A job registered with a Job Group that runs after all jobs in the group have successfully completed. Configured when creating a JobGroup via the on_completion_job parameter. Can include additional options via on_completion_job_options (e.g., queue, priority).

terms.name: Out of Memory Error
terms.description: Memory exhaustion errors in background jobs. Delayed::Job cannot detect OOM crashes by default, leading to indefinite retries. Delayed::JobPump provides improved OOM handling.

terms.name: Salsify Open Catalog
terms.description: A Salsify feature providing access to standardized product data and category structures for grocery products. Part of the Grocery Accelerator offering, it provides pre-built schemas and data for grocery industry product information.

terms.name: Salsify Open Catalog MCP Server
terms.description: An experimental FastMCP server for agentic product exploration. Provides tools for searching products using keyword/property filters via Salsify's GraphQL API. Supports pagination, property sets (none, summary, detail), and custom property selection. Part of the APES pathfinding projects.

terms.name: OpenAI-Scout Azure Instance
terms.description: Salsify's Azure OpenAI instance used by the AI Scout Squad for AI experimentation. Hosted in the SupplierXM Azure account under the dev-aew-openai-scout resource group.

terms.name: OpenText DAM
terms.description: The Digital Asset Management system used by L'Oreal to house their digital assets. Stores metadata on each asset detailing related products, asset type, and other information. L'Oreal pulls usage rights metadata from their FADEL system into OpenText. Salsify's customer-loreal-app has scheduled processes that import assets from OpenText and link them to products.

terms.name: Batched Operation Type
terms.description: A distinct type of batched work in the batched_operation gem. Defined by including Batched::OperationType concern. Configures batching characteristics via key_attribute (for grouping), batched_attribute (for combining values), and timing settings (cooldown_minutes, starvation_minutes, max_batch_size). Implements a #process method to handle batch execution.

terms.name: AWS OpsWorks - Kafka Infrastructure
terms.description: AWS OpsWorks is used for managing the production Kafka infrastructure at Salsify. Hosts both Zookeeper nodes (3) and Kafka nodes (5) with Auto Scaling Groups (ASG). Includes New Relic daemon integration for monitoring with PagerDuty alerting.

terms.name: Orb Shared Config
terms.description: A Salsify GitHub repository containing shared CircleCI configuration snippets. Provides reusable CircleCI orb configurations that can be shared across multiple Salsify projects to standardize CI/CD pipelines.

terms.name: Optimized Row Columnar
terms.description: A columnar storage file format used by Salsify for storing page event data from the Welcome ETL pipeline. Chat produces hourly ORC formatted files containing all page events for that hour. These files are stored in S3 and crawled by AWS Glue to create a data catalog.

terms.name: Order Flow
terms.description: The process of managing orders in Salsify Commerce, from ingestion through fulfillment. Includes order data storage, inventory allocation, fulfillment tracking, and order management operations like cancellations and refunds. Exposed via the commerce-order-service GraphQL API.

terms.name: Organization ID
terms.description: Unique identifier for a Salsify organization. Required when a user is associated with multiple Salsify organizations. Found in the URL path after /orgs/.

terms.name: Organization Properties
terms.description: Customizable fields defined by a Salsify organization to store product information, digital asset metadata, and other data. Each organization can create their own set of properties tailored to their specific product catalog needs. These properties can be mapped to Target Schema fields when syndicating content to retail channels.

terms.name: Organization Repository (Dandelion)
terms.description: A service within Dandelion that manages organization data. The Alerts Service queries it for organization information to include in webhook payloads and receives events when organizations are destroyed or clear their data.

terms.name: Organization Activity Slack Consumer
terms.description: A service that consumes messages from a RabbitMQ queue and notifies Slack on the 'syndication-stream' channel. Only events that are publishes with a Target Schema are sent to Slack. Uses the sneakers gem for queue consumption and slack-notifier gem for Slack integration.

terms.name: Delayed::Extensions::OrganizationContextPlugin (Deprecated)
terms.description: A deprecated DelayedJob plugin that runs jobs in the context of an organization using rails-multitenant. Extracts organization_id from jobs and sets RailsMultitenant[:organization_id] for all lifecycle hooks. Use JobSecurityContextPlugin instead.

terms.name: Organization Inventory Limit
terms.description: A model in the commerce-market-service that stores organization-specific overrides for inventory cap and trigger values. Created or updated via the inventory_limits_manager:set_limit rake task.

terms.name: Organization Record - Correlation Registry
terms.description: An organization-specific correlation record in the Correlation Registry service. Used when the Retailer ID to Salsify ID mapping is specific to a particular organization.

terms.name: Organization Scoped Model
terms.description: An ActiveRecord concern for models that are scoped to an individual Salsify Organization. Part of the multi-tenancy architecture ensuring data isolation between organizations. Used with RailsMultitenant for automatic organization context in queries.

terms.name: Organization Scoped Operation Type
terms.description: A batched_operation extension (Batched::Extensions::OrganizationScopedOperationType) for organization-scoped work. Automatically pulls organization_id from RailsMultitenant and uses it as a key_attribute. Scheduled jobs respect organization fairness.

terms.name: Overcommit
terms.description: A Git hook manager used in Salsify Ruby gems to enforce code quality checks before commits. Automatically integrated into gems created from the cookiecutter-salsify-gem template.

terms.name: OwnBackup - Salesforce Backup Service
terms.description: A third-party backup and recovery service for Salesforce data. Provides an API that allows programmatic access to export Salesforce table backups. Salsify uses OwnBackup to maintain backups of Salesforce data which are then processed and stored in the data lake.

terms.name: Open Experience Alliance
terms.description: A growing consortium of 85+ brands that collaborates with leading retailers to power an open ecosystem delivering the best possible digital experience for consumers.

terms.name: PA Team (Unknown - needs clarification)
terms.description: An internal team at Salsify mentioned in the metric-fetcher-2 repository. The exact meaning of 'PA' is not defined in the repository documentation. Possible meanings could include Platform Automation, Product Analytics, or another internal designation. This term needs clarification from team members. A team at Salsify responsible for platform-level administration, operations, and tooling. The PA team manages cross-cutting concerns related to platform reliability, service level objectives, and internal tooling for maintaining the Salsify platform infrastructure.

terms.name: PA Buddy - Platform Administration Tool
terms.description: A Rails application for administering the Platform Administration (PA) team at Salsify. Provides tooling for team administration, Service Level Objectives (SLO) management, and New Relic integration. Features a DSL for defining and syncing SLOs to New Relic, supporting REST API, GraphQL API, Delayed Jobs, and Actor Framework components with bucketed latency and availability metrics. The successor service to metric-fetcher for collecting metrics from non-Salsify services. Replaces the deprecated metric-fetcher service.

terms.name: Platform as a Service
terms.description: Salsify's internal platform infrastructure for deploying and managing applications. The PaaS Primer documentation provides guidance on scaling applications and managing worker counts.

terms.name: PaaS Primer - Salsify Platform Documentation
terms.description: Documentation guide for Salsify's Platform as a Service infrastructure. Covers how to use kubectl commands (now sal commands) for interacting with Salsify's Kubernetes-based platform.

terms.name: Packaged Template Target Schema
terms.description: A special type of Target Schema in Salsify that includes additional metadata for templating. Packaged Templates support columns, data formatting, custom formulas, and splitting settings for fields. The Salsify Tailor gem includes JSON schema definitions for packaged template target schemas. A type of target schema managed by the PAO team. Packaged Template target schemas require special handling and testing procedures in Schema Tester 3000, including Jira integration and GitHub repository management in the salsify-ts organization.

terms.name: Pact - Consumer-Driven Contract Testing Framework
terms.description: A family of frameworks for performing consumer-driven contract testing. Allows you to set up interactions between a consumer and a provider (i.e. a client and a server) and then verify them independently. In the context of Ember apps, it lets you mock your API and verify that the mock behaves the same way as the real API without testing both at the same time.

terms.name: Pact Broker
terms.description: A service for sharing Pact contracts between projects. Provides APIs for managing published contracts, tagging particular versions for use as provider testing targets, and firing webhooks to trigger test suites when contracts are updated. Also provides autogenerated network diagrams and repo badges. ember-cli-pact can publish to a Pact Broker using 'ember pact:publish'.

terms.name: PactEnabled Serializer Mixin
terms.description: A mixin that must wrap the Mirage application serializer to enable the Mirage mock provider in ember-cli-pact. Allows Mirage models to expose matching rules for attributes and provides getMatchingRules() method for request/response matching rules.

terms.name: Page Event Reporting Engine
terms.description: A PostgreSQL database that stores page event data processed by the page-event-reporting-etl Glue job. Serves as the target database for page event analytics and reporting.

terms.name: Page Event Reporting ETL
terms.description: An AWS Glue ETL job for loading page event data from the Welcome ETL pipeline into the page-event-reporting-engine PostgreSQL database. Reads from Chat's page event source data (ORC formatted files), uses Spark DataFrames for filtering, transformations and aggregation (rolling up counts by day), and uses Glue's DynamicFrame class to write results to PostgreSQL. Written in Scala. An ETL (Extract, Transform, Load) pipeline used to load page event data into the Page Event Reporting Engine. Required for staging and production environments to populate the Traffic Report with real data. Data can be imported to either local PostgreSQL or RDS database instances.

terms.name: Paid vs. Organic Search
terms.description: Paid search allows companies to pay for website display on search results when specific keywords are typed. Organic search is based on unpaid, natural rankings from search engine algorithms using SEO methods.

terms.name: Partner Account Manager
terms.description: Drives new partner business into the pipeline

terms.name: Partner Automation Operations
terms.description: A Salsify team responsible for helping customers with product content acceleration and operational tasks, including Amazon A+ Content creation. The PAO team uses browser extensions and internal tools to streamline Enhanced Content layout creation for Amazon Vendor Central. Team responsible for managing Packaged Template target schemas at Salsify. Handles over 400 target schema requests per month and uses Schema Tester 3000 for testing workflows triggered via Jira TSR tickets. A team at Salsify that creates and maintains HPI (Hybrid Powered Interfaces) connectors. May have joint ownership with the Connections team on some connectors.

terms.name: PAO A+ Content Browser Extension
terms.description: A browser extension (Firefox and Chrome) that helps the Product Acceleration and Ops team with automated Enhanced Content layout creation in Amazon A+ Content. The extension operates within Amazon Vendor Central's A+ content manager, fetching project info from Salsify's admin API and rendering a UI within an iframe. Built with Ember.js for the UI and uses WebExtension APIs for browser integration.

terms.name: Parent Product
terms.description: Base product with variants associated with it. Contains properties with common values across all variants (e.g., Brand, marketing copy).

terms.name: Parsing Canonical Form
terms.description: A specification from Apache Avro that defines a normalized JSON representation of Avro schemas for consistent parsing and fingerprinting. The Resolution Canonical Form extends this to include additional attributes needed for schema compatibility checking.

terms.name: Parslet - Ruby Parsing Library
terms.description: A small Ruby library for building complex parsers using Parsing Expression Grammars (PEG). Focuses on providing excellent error reporting and avoiding auto-generated code. Allows incremental language construction, starting from atoms and building up. Features include transformers for AST generation, accelerators for performance optimization, pluggable error reporters, Graphviz export, and RSpec testing support. Salsify maintains a fork of this library. A Ruby parsing library that inspired Botanist's transformation system. Parslet provides a pattern for defining transformations over parsed data structures. Botanist adapted this concept for JavaScript, enabling similar structural pattern matching and rule-based transformations on tree structures.

terms.name: Parslet Accelerator - Performance Optimizer
terms.description: A feature in Parslet that transforms parsers to improve their execution speed. Accelerators optimize the parsing process, making complex grammars more performant while maintaining the same parsing behavior and results.

terms.name: Parslet Transformer - AST Generator
terms.description: A component of the Parslet library that converts parsed output into Abstract Syntax Trees (ASTs). Transformers apply pattern matching rules to the parse tree, enabling structured data extraction and semantic analysis of parsed content.

terms.name: Athena Partition Projection
terms.description: AWS Athena feature used in Salsify data lake tables to automatically manage partitions without requiring MSCK REPAIR TABLE operations. Configured via table properties to define partition types (enum, date) and ranges for retailers and dates, enabling efficient querying of partitioned S3 data.

terms.name: Partner Client
terms.description: The frontend client application for Salsify partner-level operations. Built as part of the partner-ui repository and served either locally or via Dandelion. Accessed at the /partner/ route (localhost:4200/partner/ in development or app.salsify.com/partner in production).

terms.name: Partner Client Local Distribution Path
terms.description: A Dandelion environment variable that specifies the local file path to the partner-ui distribution folder. Used to serve local partner-ui assets through Dandelion during development. Set in the .env file of the Dandelion repository.

terms.name: Partner UI
terms.description: An Ember.js application for partners to administer account-level interactions at Salsify. Houses the client for Salsify partner level operations that lives at app.salsify.com/partner. Can run in isolation with dummy data or in tandem with Dandelion to interact with standard APIs. Uses GraphQL for backend communication and Percy.io for visual regression testing.

terms.name: Password Only Authorizer
terms.description: An authentication type class in catalog-auth that validates access using only a password (no username required). Configured per organization in the Organization module and typically paired with GoogleSheetPasswordProvider for credential storage.

terms.name: Product Content Management
terms.description: Refers to the digital content lifecycle, from creation to storage to deletion. Content can be copy, images, video, etc.

terms.name: Product Detail Page
terms.description: A web page on an eCommerce site that presents a description about a specific product. Includes size, color, price, shipping info, reviews, etc. Key Salsify feature powered by GraphQL. The page displaying detailed product information to users.

terms.name: Product Decision Record
terms.description: Documentation for product decisions including entitlement-related feature flags. Reviewed by Support and shared in #pdrs Slack channel.

terms.name: Peapod Retailer
terms.description: A grocery delivery retailer that receives retailer-specific product content (descriptions and images) from Salsify via the Item Master Content Plus channel.

terms.name: Parsing Expression Grammar
terms.description: A type of formal grammar used to describe the syntax of programming languages and other structured text formats. Unlike context-free grammars, PEGs are unambiguous and use ordered choice. Parslet is a Ruby library that implements PEG-based parsing, allowing developers to define grammar rules that match strings, character sets, and complex patterns.

terms.name: Penetration Testing
terms.description: A specialized assessment conducted on information systems to identify vulnerabilities that could be exploited. Salsify has independent 3rd party conduct penetration testing.

terms.name: Page Event Reporting Engine
terms.description: A reporting engine that provides analytics based on data extracted from retailer pages through on-page JavaScript or third-party observation. Utilizes the page events data domain and requires data loaded through the page-event-reporting-etl pipeline. Runs on port 30014 in development and requires PostgreSQL 10 for table partitioning support.

terms.name: PG Analyze - PostgreSQL Performance Monitoring
terms.description: A third-party service (pganalyze.com) used by Salsify to monitor PostgreSQL database performance. The salsify/pganalyze repository contains configuration for adding RDS database instances to PG Analyze monitoring. Changes are automatically deployed via infra-mgmt on master merge.

terms.name: PgBouncer
terms.description: A lightweight connection pooler for PostgreSQL. When using PgBouncer in transaction pooling mode, session-level settings like lock_timeout and statement_timeout cannot be reliably used because connections are shared between sessions. activerecord-safer_migrations is incompatible with transaction pooling mode.

terms.name: Professional Growth Conversation
terms.description: Typically done every six months at Salsify within the CS, product, and Engineering team Conversations focused on personal and professional development at Salsify.

terms.name: pgvector - PostgreSQL Vector Extension
terms.description: An open-source PostgreSQL extension that adds support for vector similarity search. Enables storing vector embeddings and performing efficient similarity queries using algorithms like cosine similarity, L2 distance, and inner product. Used in AI/ML applications for semantic search, recommendations, and RAG (Retrieval-Augmented Generation) systems.

terms.name: pgvector Investigation
terms.description: A Salsify repository containing scripts that exercise pgvector (a PostgreSQL extension for vector similarity search) with Target Schema data. Used for evaluating and testing vector database capabilities for potential use with Salsify's Target Schema system.

terms.name: Privacy Impact Assessment
terms.description: A GDPR requirement used to identify and reduce privacy risks. Aids in designing efficient processes for handling personal data.

terms.name: PickList Generator
terms.description: A helper class in Amadeus for managing picklists within Target Schemas. Provides methods to append field values to fields, commonly used for taxonomy and enumerated value lists in Target Schemas.

terms.name: Parallel Implementation of GZip
terms.description: A parallel implementation of gzip for multi-processor, multi-core machines. Used by lake-etl-ownbackup for efficient compression of Salesforce table data before uploading to S3. Provides faster compression than standard gzip by utilizing multiple CPU cores.

terms.name: Personally Identifiable Information
terms.description: Sensitive personal data that should not be logged, stored indefinitely, or included in Avro references. Includes user emails and external IDs. Subject to scrubbing on request.

terms.name: Product Information Management
terms.description: A central repository that stores product information like marketing copy, feature descriptions, and logistics details. Provides data brands and retailers need to sell across the digital ecosystem. A subset of Master Data Management focused on managing product information. Core to what Salsify provides as a platform.

terms.name: Product Index Page
terms.description: The main Salsify page when you log into the app that lays out all your products.

terms.name: Product Life Cycle Management
terms.description: A process supported by software that manages products through their entire life cycle from ideation to retirement.

terms.name: Product Line Team
terms.description: Team organized around a product line

terms.name: Product Manager
terms.description: Role responsible for the strategy, roadmap, and feature definition of a product

terms.name: Product Marketing Manager
terms.description: Role responsible for product positioning, messaging, and go-to-market strategy

terms.name: Partner Success Manager
terms.description: Similar to success managers, but for partners

terms.name: Purchase Order
terms.description: A commercial document and first official offer issued by a buyer to a seller indicating types, quantities, and agreed prices for products or services

terms.name: Proof of Concept
terms.description: A small project or demonstration that validates whether an idea, approach, or technology is feasible before committing to full development. POCs are commonly created during Hackathons to explore new product ideas or technical solutions. A demonstration or prototype that validates the feasibility of a concept or idea before committing to full development. Used to test technical approaches or integrations with minimal investment.

terms.name: POC Talking Data - Hackathon 2025 Proof of Concept
terms.description: A proof of concept repository created for Salsify Hackathon 2025. The project is in early stages and contains only boilerplate documentation. The name suggests it may involve conversational or voice-based interaction with data.

terms.name: Pod Size - Kubernetes Resource Allocation
terms.description: Pre-defined resource allocation configurations in ksonnify for Kubernetes pods. Sizes range from salsify_1x (0.25 CPU cores, 512MiB memory) to salsify_8x (3 CPU cores, 8192MiB memory). Special 'testenv' size exists for Test Environments with minimal resources. Custom pod sizes can also be defined with specific CPU and memory limits/requests.

terms.name: Purchase Order Exception Form
terms.description: When a customer requires a PO but can't provide the number yet, they sign this form declaring everything is fine and they're cutting the PO, allowing revenue recognition.

terms.name: Policy Evaluator - Superuser Authorization Engine
terms.description: The authorization engine in Dandelion that evaluates superuser permissions. Provides dynamically generated methods like `manage_foo_authorized?` based on statements defined in the SuperuserPermissions DSL. Handles both organization-scoped and resource-scoped authorization checks.

terms.name: Plan of Record
terms.description: Documents what % of pipeline generation specific teams should generate. Based on historicals, market, and capacity.

terms.name: Postgres Vacuum Monitor
terms.description: A Ruby gem that provides queries for monitoring PostgreSQL auto vacuum performance and long running queries. Reports dead tuples counts, tuples over auto vacuum thresholds, and long running transactions. Helps diagnose whether auto vacuum settings are keeping up and whether long running transactions are affecting the vacuuming daemon.

terms.name: Postmark - Email Service Provider
terms.description: Third-party email delivery service used by Salsify for templating and delivery of emails. Templates use Mustachio syntax and should be named in lisp-case. All templates belong in the 'Salsify Production' server regardless of environment. An external email service provider used by Salsify for sending transactional emails. Handles email delivery for notifications, alerts, and customer communications.

terms.name: Performance Per Rep
terms.description: Metric measuring sales representative performance

terms.name: Presto - Distributed SQL Query Engine
terms.description: An open-source distributed SQL query engine used by Salsify's Data Lake API as an alternative to Athena for querying data lake tables. The data-lake-api uses the 'lento' client library to connect to Presto clusters via the hive catalog. Used for fast interactive queries against large datasets.

terms.name: Price History Widget
terms.description: A UI widget for displaying historical price data for products. Part of the Analytics functionality that relies on timeseries-service for data storage and retrieval.

terms.name: SFCC Pricebook
terms.description: An SFCC file type that contains pricing information for products. Generated from Salsify channel publishes with variant products and pricing data. Supports multiple currencies - the connector parses which currencies should be published and generates price-tables for each. Products are serialized as price-table entries in XML format.

terms.name: Privacy Policy
terms.description: Governs how Salsify Inc. and affiliated companies use Personal Data collected, received and stored about individuals in connection with the use of websites and services.

terms.name: Privacy Shield Framework
terms.description: Framework designed by US Dept of Commerce and EU/Swiss to provide companies mechanism to comply with data protection requirements when transferring personal data.

terms.name: PRmate - Pull Request Mate
terms.description: A command-line tool that uses AI (LLMs via OpenAI API) to automatically generate comprehensive pull request descriptions. Combines context from Jira tickets (summary, DoD) with analysis from GitHub branches (code changes and diffs). Helps developers save time and ensure PRs are clean, context-rich, and cross-checked against ticket requirements. Features include fetching ticket context from Jira, analyzing code changes via GitHub, using LLMs to draft well-structured PR descriptions, detecting missing tasks based on Jira DoD, and processing readiness checks asynchronously.

terms.name: Probot - GitHub App Framework
terms.description: A framework for building GitHub Apps that automate and improve workflows. At Salsify, Probot is used with the Settings app to manage repository configurations through YAML files. Repositories inherit settings from github-settings by using the _extends directive in their .github/settings.yml file.

terms.name: Product Compliance Grade
terms.description: A scoring system in Salsify's Compliance Reporting Engine that measures how well syndicated product content matches what appears on retailer sites. Includes individual grades for name, description, bullets, main image, images, list price, MAP price, ingredients, allergens, disclaimer, calories, and serving size. Each grade is a float value representing the compliance score.

terms.name: Product Content Grader API
terms.description: The backend API service powering Salsify Insights. Generates merchandising reports that analyze product content quality on retailer pages. Production data is stored in the S3 bucket salsify-product-content-grader-api-production under the merchandising_reports prefix.

terms.name: Product Graph
terms.description: Data Engineering initiative to equip GTM operations with digital shelf insights. Includes web scraping to identify accounts likely to buy Salsify and understand their online problems.

terms.name: Product Identifiers
terms.description: Unique IDs that allow Salsify to recognize whether new data should be attached to an existing product or, where the product ID isn't in the system yet, a new product should be created.

terms.name: Product Liveness Events
terms.description: Events that track whether syndicated products are live and visible on retailer websites. Published via published_product_liveness_events table, includes product and attribute-level liveness status, compliance scores, crawl timestamps, and error tracking. Used to monitor syndication success and identify content discrepancies.

terms.name: ProductBatchGenerator - Batch Product Generation Module
terms.description: A module within the ProductFaker gem that generates batches of fake products based on a JSON target schema. Configurable options include: raise_on_optional_fields (whether to raise errors for unsupported data types), product_count (number of products to generate), seed (for reproducible results), optional_field_probability (chance of generating optional fields), and max_values_per_field (limit for multi-value fields).

terms.name: ProductFaker - Fake Product Generator
terms.description: A Ruby gem for generating fake products for testing or demo purposes. Uses ProductBatchGenerator module to create products based on a given JSON target schema. Can output products as CSV files for Dandelion import or as Dandelion export format for use in tests. Supports configurable parameters like product count, seed for reproducibility, optional field probability, and max values per field.

terms.name: Production Elasticsearch Kubernetes Cluster
terms.description: A dedicated Kubernetes cluster for Elasticsearch workloads. Contains multiple node types: Master Nodes (3) for cluster coordination, Data Nodes (N) for storage and search, Ops Nodes (2) for exporters, and Prometheus Nodes (2) for monitoring. Includes Kibana for visualization.

terms.name: Production Kubernetes Cluster
terms.description: The main Kubernetes cluster hosting Salsify production workloads. Contains multiple node types: Standard Nodes for general microservices, Crawling Nodes for web crawling services, and Prometheus Nodes for monitoring. Services are organized into namespaces.

terms.name: Production Ops Kubernetes Cluster
terms.description: A separate Kubernetes cluster dedicated to operations tooling, including Grafana dashboards. Isolated from the main production cluster for observability and management purposes.

terms.name: Production Ops Environment
terms.description: A Kubernetes environment at Salsify for internal infrastructure services used by engineering and other internal groups. Separate from the main production environment which hosts customer-facing microservices.

terms.name: ProductJson Script Tag
terms.description: A script tag on Shopify product pages containing JSON-serialized product data. Must have an id of 'ProductJson-product-template' or 'SalsifyProductJson-product-template'. Required for Enhanced Content to identify and display content for the correct product. Configured in theme's product-template.liquid file.

terms.name: Products With Account
terms.description: A data table or dataset in the Salsify Data Lake that associates products with their respective accounts. Used by the Product Graph initiative to track product-account relationships. Changes to this dataset are gated through a staging-to-production promotion process.

terms.name: Products Channel Model
terms.description: A model in the commerce-market-service that represents the relationship between products and inventory-enabled channels. Used to track which products have been published to which channels for inventory syncing purposes.

terms.name: Product Schedule Event
terms.description: A Kafka event sent by CPDS when a product URL needs to be crawled. Sent to the appropriate crawl service (cpds-importio-service or crawler-scheduler-service) based on the determined data vendor for the retailer and usage. An event type consumed by the crawler-scheduler-service. When received, the service saves the requested product to the database along with associated metadata for scheduling crawls.

terms.name: Prometheus - Monitoring System
terms.description: An open-source monitoring and alerting system used by Salsify for metrics collection and monitoring. Integrated with Thanos for long-term data retention.

terms.name: Prometheus Kubernetes Nodes
terms.description: Dedicated Kubernetes nodes (2 instances) for running Prometheus and Thanos monitoring workloads. Deployed in the monitoring namespace with dedicated resources for metric collection and storage.

terms.name: Prometheus Rules - Alerting and Recording Rules
terms.description: Kubernetes custom resources that define alerting and recording rules for Prometheus. At Salsify, global rules are stored in prometheus-rules/base directory, while data-only rules for ops clusters are in prometheus-rules/ops-clusters.

terms.name: Properties
terms.description: Customizable fields that store product information, digital asset information, and metadata. Define what data fields a product can have.

terms.name: Property Groups
terms.description: Organize properties on the product details page and are exportable in JSON format. Help structure and categorize related properties together.

terms.name: Property Value Embeddings
terms.description: Vector representations of customer Property Values used for similarity matching against Enumerated Embeddings. The optimal format found in experiments includes property name, organization context, and value: '{property_name} ({organization_name}): {property_value}'.

terms.name: Propose and Review
terms.description: Salsify workflow task type where a team member submits content and it requires approval by the assigned team member before the updated content is accepted.

terms.name: Pact Provider
terms.description: In Pact terminology, the system that fulfills requests. In the case of ember-cli-pact, this is typically an HTTP API of some sort. The provider verifies its behavior against Pact contracts generated by consumers.

terms.name: Pact Provider State
terms.description: Named scenarios that the provider and consumer have an agreed-upon understanding of. They allow you to specify what kind of state the provider needs to be in before verifying a given interaction, such as creating a particular record or logging in as a user with particular permissions. Activated using the given() function in ember-cli-pact.

terms.name: Publication Manager
terms.description: A component in con-shopify responsible for enqueuing publication jobs to the appropriate worker queues. Determines whether publications should be processed by the main worker or the canary worker based on store domain configuration, enabling A/B testing of new Shopify API versions.

terms.name: Publish / Publishing
terms.description: The act of sending product content from a brand to a retailer through the Salsify network. In the network-growth-viz visualization, publishes are represented as links between brand nodes and retailer nodes, with the publish count determining the strength and visual weight of the connection. Deliver product content in a channel's format. The channel setup determines method of delivery, which could be a download, delivery via FTP/Dropbox/Box, or directly to a retailer.

terms.name: Puddle - GDSN Data Pool
terms.description: Salsify's GDSN Data Pool connector. Syndicates product data from Salsify (Dandelion) into the Global Data Synchronization Network. Handles item registration, publication, synchronization with retail partners, and validation against GS1 rules. Operates as a source data pool.

terms.name: Puddle
terms.description: Salsify service with a GraphQL API used by channels-ui. One of the backend services that channels-ui communicates with alongside Dandelion, ECP Gateway, and Catalog Management.

terms.name: Pulse
terms.description: A service powering various Amazon PXM (Product Experience Management) features.

terms.name: Batched Operation Pump
terms.description: A process in batched_operation (bundle exec rake batched:pump) that identifies new operations and publishes them to Redis. Copies operation metadata to Redis for bookkeeping. Supports up to 3000 operations/second. Uses pump_max_sleep_seconds and pump_min_sleep_seconds for timing.

terms.name: Pure Play
terms.description: An investor's term for a publicly traded company that focuses resources on only one line of business. Many e-tailers are pure plays.

terms.name: AWS Glue Pushdown Predicates
terms.description: An AWS Glue optimization feature used to filter data partitions at read time, improving efficiency by only reading the data partitions needed. Used by page-event-reporting-etl to only read the date partitions being processed.

terms.name: Property Value
terms.description: A value for a property on a given product

terms.name: Product Experience Management
terms.description: A platform of product data management solutions at the intersection of a brand's data and commerce, allowing them to manage and optimize product data. Also called ProductXM. Managing the full product experience across channels, including product information, digital assets, and customer engagement.

terms.name: Quality Assurance
terms.description: Any systematic process of determining whether a product or service meets specified requirements. Establishes and maintains set requirements for developing or manufacturing reliable products.

terms.name: Quarterly Business Review
terms.description: Also known as EBR (Executive Business Review). Regular strategic review meeting with customers.

terms.name: Quality Contacts
terms.description: Marketing generated contacts that XDRs hunt. Come from a variety of sources (webinars, demos, etc).

terms.name: Qualified Leads
terms.description: Leads that have been vetted and meet criteria to be pursued by sales

terms.name: Marginalia Query Annotation
terms.description: A feature in Marginalia that adds SQL comments to database queries for debugging and performance analysis. Annotations can be component-based (application, controller, action) or inline using the Marginalia.with_annotation block API. Comments can be appended (default) or prepended to queries via Marginalia::Comment.prepend_comment setting.

terms.name: Delayed::Extensions::QueueFairness
terms.description: A DelayedJob extension that adds queue fairness for jobs from different organizations or with customizable concurrency keys. Supports :organization_id and :concurrency_key algorithms. Prevents any single organization from monopolizing all workers. Configurable concurrency limits per worker type.

terms.name: Delayed::Extensions::QueueMetricsReporter
terms.description: A service object for reporting DelayedJob queue metrics to NewRelic. Reports custom events including DelayedJob:OrganizationQueueCount, DelayedJob:QueueCount, and DelayedJob:QueueWaitTime for monitoring queue depth, job counts, and wait times.

terms.name: Rack JWT Auth
terms.description: A Rack middleware gem for authenticating HTTP requests using JWT tokens. Used in Salsify Rails applications to protect endpoints by validating JWT signatures against a public key. Supports configurable path exclusions for endpoints that don't require authentication (e.g., health checks, documentation, GraphiQL in development).

terms.name: Rack Middleware Cookie Consent
terms.description: The core middleware class in the cookie_consent_gem. Inserted at the beginning of the Rails middleware stack (before any session cookies can be set) to ensure users consent to cookies before accessing application content. Configurable with file_path for consent form, cookie_name, exempt_routes for API endpoints, route_root, and logging options.

terms.name: Rails Multitenant
terms.description: A Salsify Ruby gem that provides multitenancy support for Rails applications. Tracks organization_id, user_id, and superuser_id context. The data_lake_reporter integrates with it to automatically add these attributes to events. A Salsify gem that the salsify_kafka Actor Framework integrates with to automatically set the current organization ID for handlers during message processing.

terms.name: Rails Salsify OAuth
terms.description: An example Rails application demonstrating how to use the omniauth_salsify gem for OAuth2 authentication with Salsify. Referenced as a usage example in the omniauth_salsify documentation.

terms.name: Rails Template - Microservice Scaffolding
terms.description: Salsify's standardized Ruby on Rails application template for creating new microservices. Includes health checks, CircleCI configuration, Avro schema generation, and other Salsify best practices. Optionally generates a schemas_gem directory for sharing Avro schemas.

terms.name: Rails Multitenant - Global Context Registry
terms.description: A Rails library used at Salsify for managing tenant context in multi-tenant applications. Provides GlobalContextRegistry for storing and retrieving organization_id and user_id across requests. Used by correlation_registry_client to automatically determine the current organization context for storing and fetching records.

terms.name: Rat Pack
terms.description: A Salsify GitHub repository containing various worker implementations and file converters. Referenced in Muffin documentation as containing example usage of the Analytics Reports Client, such as the Pepsi Product Change Report generator.

terms.name: rbenv - Ruby Version Manager
terms.description: A Ruby version management tool adopted by Salsify for managing Ruby versions across development environments and CI/CD pipelines. Replaced previous Ruby version management approaches.

terms.name: Responsible Business Partners
terms.description: Those who report to managers (mentioned in context of PJ and Job)

terms.name: Retail Client Events Service
terms.description: A service that captures events from retail clients for Enhanced Content analytics. RCES events flow through the data lake pipeline and are combined with CDN logs to produce EC analytics data. Used for tracking impressions and engagement metrics on published Enhanced Content.

terms.name: Registry Catalogue Item
terms.description: A GDSN message type containing product catalogue information registered in the Global Registry. In gdsn_gateway, RCI messages are routed to the '/rci' endpoint.

terms.name: Amazon Relational Database Service
terms.description: AWS managed database service used by Salsify. CloudOps includes tools for adding AWS IP blocks to RDS instances (add_aws_ip_blocks_rds_instance.sh), getting RDS credentials, and tracking RDS users for SOC compliance. Salsify has standardized RDS credentials storage as part of their infrastructure management practices.

terms.name: Readiness Report - Internal Target Schema Analysis
terms.description: An internal-use Target Schema request type in TASER. When the TSR purpose is 'Internal Readiness Report', it follows a special workflow. Used for analyzing product readiness against Target Schema requirements. Channel settings that create mappings between Salsify properties and retailer attributes for product syndication.

terms.name: Recipient Data Pool
terms.description: A GDSN data pool that receives product data from source data pools. Subscribes to product data via subscriptions and receives CIN messages. Sends back CIC confirmations with synchronization status. Receives subscriptions from Data Recipients and registers them with the GS1 Registry. Receives new and updated item information from the Source data pool and sends them to the Data Recipient.

terms.name: Redash - Query and Visualization Tool
terms.description: An open-source data visualization and dashboarding tool used at Salsify to query and visualize data from the Data Lake. Used by the GraphQL Schema Compatibility Checker to provide links to pre-built queries showing which clients are impacted by proposed schema changes. Accessible at redash.lake.salsify.com. Redash allows users to write SQL queries against data sources and visualize results. Used in conjunction with tools like lake-redash-to-sheet for data export workflows. An internal query and visualization tool used at Salsify for database queries. Used to query Entitlement Reporting data and create dashboards for organization usage metrics.

terms.name: JsonModels Reference Associations
terms.description: A module providing references_one and references_many DSL methods for non-ActiveRecord models that need to reference ActiveRecord objects. Stores references as IDs (storage_key pattern) and resolves them lazily through a reference resolver, enabling JSON models to maintain relationships with database records.

terms.name: JsonModels Reference Resolver
terms.description: A component in JsonModels that handles lazy resolution of ActiveRecord references stored in JSON models. Enables efficient batch loading of referenced records to avoid N+1 queries when accessing reference associations from nested JSON models.

terms.name: Release Containers Pipeline
terms.description: A Jenkins pipeline function for building and publishing Docker containers to ECR without immediate deployment. Accepts a version argument, tags the primary branch, and publishes containers with the version label. Used when containers need to be published separately from deployment.

terms.name: Release Go Binary Pipeline
terms.description: A Jenkins pipeline function that uses goreleaser to build and publish Go binaries to Artifactory. Intended for internal tools deployed to developer laptops or Jenkins jobs, not for Go-based microservices. Requires a .goreleaser.yml configuration file.

terms.name: Delayed::Extensions::RemoveExpiredDelayedJobsJob
terms.description: A DelayedJob for deleting failed jobs past a configurable expiration threshold (default 90 days). Should be scheduled regularly via salsify_clockwork to clean up old failed job records.

terms.name: Report - Entitlement Reporting Entity
terms.description: A database entity in Entitlement Reporting representing a single metric being collected. Has attributes including Name, Group, and Symbol. Examples include exavault_storage_bytes, api_calls, product_count, etc.

terms.name: Report Engine Workers
terms.description: Salsify application workers responsible for generating analytics reports. Can be scaled up or down using automation scripts. Default worker counts and scaling procedures are documented in the PaaS Primer.

terms.name: Report Run - Entitlement Reporting Entity
terms.description: A database entity in Entitlement Reporting representing a metric collected on a particular date. Links a Report to its Report Run Results. The date field tracks when the metric collection occurred.

terms.name: Report Run Result - Entitlement Reporting Entity
terms.description: A database entity in Entitlement Reporting storing per-organization metric values. Contains the Organization ID and the actual Metric data collected for a specific Report Run.

terms.name: Report Deduplication Tool
terms.description: A utility class in the Compliance Reporting Engine used via Rails console to deduplicate Delayed::Jobs for ComplianceReportJob. Removes excess jobs that match on organization_id and channel, keeping only the newest report request since reports run twice on the same day have minimal changes.

terms.name: Representer - YACHTS JSON Generator
terms.description: A YACHTS component that transforms Target Schema structs and conditions into JSON representation (TSDL format). Supports configuration options for metadata inclusion, JSON formatting (beautified/compressed), picklist name pairing, circular dependency resolution, validation, and optimization.

terms.name: Required Attribute
terms.description: An attribute that must be filled in order for a product to be sent to an endpoint through a readiness report. When all required attributes are filled, a product is 100% ready and included in publish events.

terms.name: Required Status Checks
terms.description: A Jenkins pipeline configuration option that ensures specified CI checks are passing before deployment. Used with continuous deployment workflows to comply with SOC audits. Specifies check suite names (e.g., circleci-checks) and a timeout duration.

terms.name: Resolution Canonical Form
terms.description: An extension of Apache Avro's Parsing Canonical Form that includes attributes relevant to schema resolution: name, type, fields, symbols, items, values, size, default, aliases, logical_type (for decimals), precision, and scale. Orders JSON object fields consistently and converts aliases to their fullname format. Used for generating unique fingerprints to identify schema compatibility.

terms.name: Resource Authorization Model
terms.description: A data model in catalog-auth that stores authorization records containing organization_id, shareable_type, and shareable_id. Created when credentials are validated and referenced via authorization_ids stored in the user session. Used to track which catalogs or lightboxes a user has been authorized to access.

terms.name: Delayed::Extensions::RespekSignalsPlugin
terms.description: A DelayedJob plugin that only raises SignalExceptions when a TERM signal is received while performing a job. Prevents SignalExceptions during other lifecycle callbacks to avoid terminating callbacks at inopportune times.

terms.name: App Center Retailer Destination Application
terms.description: A type of application in the Salsify App Center that represents a specific retailer or marketplace channel where products can be syndicated. Retailer destinations provide pre-configured connections to retail partners like Albertsons or DoorDash.

terms.name: Retailer Edits
terms.description: Readiness report feature that allows users to quickly replace a product value for an attribute with an optimized value that only applies to that readiness report. Values are not stored with the core product record.

terms.name: Retailer Portal
terms.description: A retailer system that suppliers use to maintain and activate product content. The interface through which brands submit and manage their product information for specific retailers.

terms.name: Retailer Status
terms.description: A Salsify system property (salsify:retailer_status) that tracks the acceptance or rejection status of products by retailers through channel connections. Used to filter Smart Lists for products accepted into or rejected from channels like Amazon Vendor Central.

terms.name: Retailer Context Gem
terms.description: A Ruby gem that contains retailer configuration and context information used by Analytics Reviews Target Schema. Must be updated and distributed when adding or modifying retailer definitions in the Reviews report.

terms.name: Revision Rounds
terms.description: Workflow Collaboration tool that allows users to choose from and compare previous versions of content against the most recently updated.

terms.name: Request for Catalogue Item Notification
terms.description: A GDSN message type used to request product information from a data source. In gdsn_gateway, RFCIN messages are routed to the '/rfcin' endpoint when sent to the Global Registry.

terms.name: Request for Information
terms.description: A formal request to vendors for information about their products or services

terms.name: Request for Proposal
terms.description: A formal request to vendors for a detailed proposal on products or services

terms.name: Reach Impact Confidence Effort
terms.description: A prioritization framework: Reach + Impact + Confidence + Effort. Used to score and prioritize features or initiatives. An acronym for the four factors used to evaluate each project idea: reach, impact, confidence and effort.

terms.name: Rich Media
terms.description: Any content that is an enhancement from text and static images (videos, 360 images, comparison tables). Called 'A+ content' on Amazon and 'below the fold content'.

terms.name: Retail Integration Connector Knowledgebase
terms.description: A standardized checklist/framework used to document connector capabilities and configurations. Includes categories like transmission method, payload format, data schema, schema updates, response feedback, async feedback, human review, dry run support, image delivery, business rules, update model, and bulk support. A set of standardized metadata fields used to document connector capabilities in Salsify. Includes attributes like transmission method, payload format, data schema, response feedback, image delivery method, update model, and bulk support.

links.description: Example RICK metadata in connector docs

terms.name: Retailer Integration Complexity Knowledgebase
terms.description: A framework or table describing connector characteristics including: transmission method (HTTPS/FTP), payload format (JSON/XML/SOAP), data schema type, schema update frequency, response feedback, async feedback, human review, dry run support, image delivery method, business rules, update model, and bulk support.

terms.name: Root Route - Micro-app Base Path
terms.description: The base route that triggers activation of a specific micro-app in the Conductor framework. When the host navigates to a path starting with a micro-app's root route, that micro-app is activated. For example, a micro-app with rootRoute '/feature-a' activates for any '/feature-a/*' paths.

terms.name: Row-Level Security (RLS)
terms.description: A database security mechanism that restricts which rows users can access based on policies. In ec-mcp, implemented using Common Table Expressions (CTEs) that automatically filter queries based on user policies, ensuring users only see products they have permission to access.

terms.name: Retailer Product Code
terms.description: In the context of Clavis connector, RPC refers to retailer-specific product codes at the case level. RPC-level fields are unique per retailer and grouped within 'Case RPC-Level Fields' in the target schema. Each retailer has its own prefix concatenated with RPC field names.

terms.name: Regional Solution Integrators
terms.description: Partners like Gournay, Avions - smaller and regionally based consulting firms

terms.name: Retailer SKU / Retailer Stock Unit
terms.description: A unique identifier used by retailers to identify products. In the context of CPDS, RSUs like Amazon ASINs (e.g., 'B00004UBH1') are used to fetch crawled product data. Products can be looked up by retailer + RSU combination or by product URL. The SKU identifier assigned by a retailer for a product. Used in product liveness events and compliance tracking to uniquely identify products on retailer platforms. Different from the Salsify product_external_id or product_system_id. A retailer's internal stock keeping unit identifier.

terms.name: Salsify UUID
terms.description: Salsify's 38-byte fixed field UUID format used as external identifiers for entities. Used in logging fields like organization_id, publication_id, user_id, and superuser_id.

terms.name: Simple Storage Service
terms.description: AWS object storage service. CloudOps includes tag_helper_s3.rb for cost tagging S3 buckets.

terms.name: Sales Account Executive
terms.description: Provides customers with expertise, education, and consultation on Salsify and industry. Works with CSM to understand customer's vision and desired outcomes.

terms.name: Safe Settings - GitHub Repository Settings App
terms.description: An open-source GitHub App developed by GitHub that enables repository settings to be managed via code. Used by Salsify's github-settings-bot to enforce consistent GitHub repository configurations across the organization. Allows declarative configuration of repository settings, branch protection rules, team permissions, and more. A GitHub App (originally from github/safe-settings) used by Salsify to manage repository settings as code. Picks up configurations from the admin repository and applies them to GitHub repositories. Enables self-service repository management through YAML configuration files.

terms.name: sal - Salsify CLI Tool
terms.description: A Salsify command-line interface tool with various subcommands for infrastructure operations. Includes 'sal k8s authenticate' for Kubernetes cluster authentication and context configuration, and 'sal environment update-cluster' for updating clusters via Temporal in infra-mgmt. Also used for approving cluster updates with 'sal environment approve-update-cluster'. A command-line tool for Salsify engineers that wraps docker compose and provides development environment management. Primary command is 'sal devenv' which manages local development dependencies. Installed via Homebrew with 'brew install sal'. Can start, stop, and update containerized services needed for local development. The Salsify command-line interface tool used for development operations. Provides commands like 'sal devenv start' for managing development containers, 'sal k8s elevate' for Kubernetes access, 'sal k8s run-cmd' for running commands in pods, and 'sal configure' for setup. Essential for con-shopify local development. The current Salsify command-line tool that replaces kubectl_plugins. Contains the commands previously available through kubectl plugins for interacting with Salsify's Kubernetes infrastructure. A unified command-line interface (CLI) tool to aid in development at Salsify. Distributed via Salsify's Homebrew Tap and can be installed using 'brew install sal' after adding the Salsify tap.

terms.name: sal claude - Salsify CLI Claude Commands
terms.description: Salsify CLI commands for managing Claude Code installation and configuration. Includes 'sal claude install' for initial setup and 'sal claude sync' for synchronizing configuration. Part of the Salsify internal tooling for developer workflows.

terms.name: sal devenv - Development Environment Manager
terms.description: A subcommand of the sal CLI that manages local development environment services using Docker. Supports starting services with 'sal devenv start', stopping with 'sal devenv stop', updating containers with 'sal devenv update', and setting default service groups with 'sal devenv set-default-group'. Services are organized into groups (e.g., 'core') and can be customized with -s (include) and -x (exclude) flags. A Salsify CLI command for managing local development environments via Docker containers. The command 'sal devenv start -g core' sets up repos for Core Modules, including database configurations. SAL is the Salsify engineering CLI tool.

terms.name: sal k8s - Salsify Kubernetes CLI
terms.description: Salsify's Kubernetes command-line tool. The app rollback feature has been deprecated as documented in the infrastructure ADRs.

terms.name: Salsify Crawler - Internal Web Crawling System
terms.description: Salsify's internal web crawling system that is replacing Import.io for some retailers. Managed via SalsifyCrawlerRetailer and SalsifyCrawlerOrganization models in cpds-importio-service. Receives crawl requests via CrawlerBatchInputFileEvent and can handle callbacks for adhoc requests. An internal Salsify web crawler used to extract product data from retailer websites. Works alongside Import. io as a data vendor option for CPDS. Currently crawls Amazon US with plans to expand to additional retailers.

terms.name: Salsify Labs
terms.description: Driven by Customer Solutions team, rolling out innovative capabilities that provide additional value to customers at no additional cost. Not part of core roadmap.

terms.name: Salsify Product API
terms.description: The REST API endpoint used to retrieve product data from Salsify. In the alexa-app context, it uses endpoints like /api/v1/products/{productID} to fetch product properties and /api/products for filtered product searches. Requires an access token for authentication.

terms.name: Salsify Webhook Signing
terms.description: A security mechanism where Salsify signs outgoing webhooks to verify authenticity. Dandy-1000 only processes webhooks that are Salsify-signed, ensuring that webhook invocations originate from trusted Salsify services like the webhook-service.

terms.name: Salsify App Root Environment Variable
terms.description: An environment variable used to configure the omniauth_salsify gem to use a local Dandelion installation or non-production environment as the authentication provider. When not set, defaults to the production Dandelion URL.

terms.name: Salsify Avro - Common Types
terms.description: A Salsify gem for handling Avro schema serialization and deserialization. Used in conjunction with Kafka for message encoding. Requires an Avro Schema Registry URL configuration.
