The correlation_registry_client gem includes generators for salsify_avro setup. Ruby gem containing avro-builder DSL files for common schemas used across Salsify projects. Includes salsify_uuid, timestamp, multitenant_value, uniquely_identifiable_value, and request_value types. All types defined under com. salsify namespace. A Salsify library that provides the uniquely_identifiable_value Avro record type used for ensuring messages have a system_message_id for idempotent processing in salsify_kafka. Helper gem for working with Avro schemas in Salsify services. Works alongside avromatic and salsify_kafka for event schema management.

terms.name: Salsify Base URL Environment Variable
terms.description: Cluster-wide environment variable containing the URL users visit for the deployment (e.g., https://app.salsify.com/ for production). Used for building callback URLs safe for all environments.

terms.name: Salsify Grape - REST API Framework
terms.description: Ruby gem providing Salsify-specific extensions for Grape REST APIs. Includes JWT authentication, request logging, metrics reporting, and exception handling integrations.

terms.name: Salsify GraphQL Client (Ruby)
terms.description: A Salsify library used by services to consume GraphQL APIs from other services. When a GraphQL schema changes in the source service (like comment-service), consuming services using this client need to regenerate their schema dumps. Ruby gem providing a thin layer on top of graphql-client for invoking GraphQL APIs following Salsify conventions and best practices.

terms.name: Salsify GraphQL Server
terms.description: Ruby gem providing a thin layer on top of graphql-ruby for developing GraphQL servers following Salsify conventions and best practices. Includes JWT authentication and data lake metrics reporting.

terms.name: Salsify Kafka Framework
terms.description: A Ruby library for producing and consuming messages from Kafka. Consists of two major components: an actor framework for easily consuming messages with simplified concurrency control, and an event publisher for publishing events to Kafka. Both components require messages to be modeled as avromatic models. A Salsify internal framework for publishing and consuming Kafka events. Used by correlation_registry_client and other gems to send messages to Kafka topics. Requires initialization via Rails generators for event_publisher and actors. Runs via the event_publisher:publish_events rake task. Internal Kafka eventing framework gem used by Salsify services. Provides event handling infrastructure including actor configuration, event-to-handler mappings, and message processing. Content-flow-service and other services build on this for event-driven architecture. Ruby library for working with Apache Kafka at Salsify. Provides the Actor Framework for processing Kafka events with ordered execution, batching, and deduplication. Used for asynchronous communication between services with Avro-encoded messages. A shared Salsify Ruby library that provides Kafka integration capabilities including an Actor Framework for processing Kafka messages. Used by the Alerts Service and other microservices for event-driven communication.

terms.name: Salsify Organizations - Feature Flag Replication
terms.description: Ruby gem providing framework for replicating feature flags and organization data from Dandelion to other Ruby services. Provides ActiveRecord model access for checking if features are enabled for organizations.

terms.name: Salsify Request Logger
terms.description: Rack middleware for request logging in Ruby services. Propagates X-REQUEST-ID header for cross-application tracing.

terms.name: Salsify Rubocop Configuration
terms.description: A shared Rubocop configuration used across Salsify Ruby gems and projects. Provides standardized Ruby code style and linting rules. Integrated into gems created via the cookiecutter-salsify-gem template.

terms.name: Salsify Superuser OAuth Provider
terms.description: An OmniAuth provider strategy for Salsify superuser OAuth applications. Creates an '/auth/salsify_superuser' route to initiate the superuser authentication flow, with callbacks at '/auth/salsify_superuser/callback'. Requires SALSIFY_SUPERUSER_ID and SALSIFY_SUPERUSER_SECRET environment variables.

terms.name: Salsify Tailor - Target Schema Generation
terms.description: A Ruby gem for Target Schema generation and utilities. Provides tools for building, validating, and testing Target Schemas programmatically. Includes RSpec matchers for asserting Target Schema properties (field values, required conditions, applicable scopes, max length), a Target Schema Validator, and support for working with workbooks and worksheets. The gem handles field constraints including allowed/disallowed character regexes, GTIN formats, min/max values, decimal places, combined lengths, and number of values.

terms.name: Salsify UUID - Entity Identifiers
terms.description: Library for Salsify's 38-byte UUID format used as identifiers for entities exposed from services. Also an Avro fixed field type in salsify_avro.

terms.name: Salsify Amazon Feeds Endpoint S3 Bucket
terms.description: An S3 bucket that stores processed Amazon feed data. Contains prod/processed and beta/processed paths with ASIN and product report data from Amazon integrations.

terms.name: Salsify CE S3 Bucket
terms.description: An S3 bucket used to store connector services data, including Amazon Vendor Central publish data and feedback. Contains product records organized by organization ID under the connector_services/amazon_vendor_central path.

terms.name: salsify-data-eng - Data Engineering AWS Account
terms.description: The AWS account containing Salsify's Data Lake infrastructure. Developers access it with data-analyst or data-eng IAM roles via Okta SSO. Contains Athena workgroups, S3 data storage, and development schemas prefixed with dev_{username}. The AWS account used by the Data Engineering team for data lake infrastructure, including Athena, S3 buckets, and lake-jobs deployments. Accessed via Okta SSO with roles like data-analyst.

terms.name: Enhanced Content Container
terms.description: An empty div element required on Shopify product pages for Enhanced Content display. Must have the id 'Salsify-EnhancedContent__container'. This is where the EC script renders the rich product content loaded from Salsify.

terms.name: Salsify Logger - Structured Logging
terms.description: Ruby gem for structured JSON logging at Salsify. Supports thread-local and block-scope metadata with add_fields and with_fields interfaces. Recommended for all application logging.

terms.name: Salsify Target Schema Organization
terms.description: GitHub organization containing target schema repositories. Schema Tester 3000 requires read/write access to repos in this org for Packaged Template target schema testing.

terms.name: Salsify UI
terms.description: The main Salsify client application source code, serving the application found at app.salsify.com/app. This Ember.js application handles the primary user interface for Salsify's product experience management platform.

terms.name: Salsify Avro
terms.description: Internal Salsify gem for working with Apache Avro serialization. Provides schema loading, registration, and integration with Kafka messaging. Commerce-schemas uses SalsifyAvro's Railtie to automatically register schemas with the application.

terms.name: Salsify Kubernetes CLI
terms.description: A command-line tool for interacting with Salsify's Kubernetes infrastructure. Used to run commands like Rails console in production or staging environments. Example usage: 'salsifyk8s run cmd -a crawled-product-data-service -e production rails c'.

terms.name: Salsify Kafka - Event Publishing Library
terms.description: A Salsify internal library for publishing events to Kafka topics. Used by services like comment-service to communicate asynchronously. Provides SalsifyKafka::EventPublisher.enqueue() method for publishing messages to Kafka topics.

terms.name: Delayed::Extensions::SalsifyLogger
terms.description: A DelayedJob extension that appends job_id, job_class, job_attempts, and job_queue fields to the Salsify::Logger instance. Auto-registered when salsify-logger is configured. Additional logger context fields are reset after job completion.

terms.name: Salsify Skill
terms.description: The core Alexa skill class in the alexa-app repository that extends AlexaSkill to provide Salsify-specific voice command handling. Implements intent handlers for querying products by ID, filtering products by properties, and navigating product information through conversational voice interactions.

terms.name: Salsify UUID Generator
terms.description: ActiveRecord integration for Salsify's custom UUID format. Provides ModelWithClientGeneratedId concern that generates a Salsify UUID id when a model is initialized. Works with the salsify_uuid gem for UUID generation and parsing. A Salsify utility for generating unique identifiers (UUIDs) across the platform. Used by services to create IDs for entities like comments before publishing to Kafka.

terms.name: Security Assertion Markup Language
terms.description: An XML-based open standard for exchanging authentication and authorization data between parties, particularly between an identity provider (IdP) and a service provider (SP). Used in enterprise single sign-on (SSO) scenarios. OmniAuth Multi Provider supports SAML as one of its identity provider types. Open standard for exchanging authentication and authorization data between parties (identity provider and service provider). Most important use case is web browser SSO. Authentication standard used for AWS single sign-on. CloudOps includes aws_saml_provider_update. rb for updating SAML provider configurations.

terms.name: Store Assortment Online
terms.description: Walmart's initiative to enhance customer experiences in stores and online. Makes in-store product information accessible online without making products transactable online.

terms.name: Simple API for XML
terms.description: An event-driven parsing model for processing XML documents. Unlike DOM parsers that load the entire document into memory, SAX parsers process documents sequentially, triggering events as they encounter elements. JsonStreamingParser applies this same approach to JSON parsing in PHP.

terms.name: Schedulable Concern
terms.description: A Rails concern in the crawler-scheduler-service that ensures products are assigned a crawl cadence (e.g., daily) and a time bucket (e.g., 3pm) when written to the database.

terms.name: Batched Operation Scheduler
terms.description: A process in batched_operation (bundle exec rake batched:scheduler) that identifies ready batches in Redis and schedules Delayed::Job processors. Supports ~100-150 batches/second depending on batch size. Uses scheduler_max_sleep_seconds and scheduler_min_sleep_seconds for timing.

terms.name: Schema Registry
terms.description: A centralized service for storing and retrieving Avro schemas. At Salsify, used in conjunction with the avrolution gem for schema compatibility checking (via COMPATIBILITY_SCHEMA_REGISTRY_URL) and schema registration (via DEPLOYMENT_SCHEMA_REGISTRY_URL). Ensures schema evolution is controlled and compatible.

terms.name: Avro Schema Resolution
terms.description: The process of determining compatibility between Avro schemas, particularly when a reader uses a different schema than the writer. Resolution Canonical Form provides a way to uniquely identify schemas that are resolution-compatible by including relevant attributes like defaults and aliases in the fingerprint calculation.

terms.name: Avro Schema Store
terms.description: A component in avro-builder that loads DSL files and returns cached Avro::Schema objects. Provides integration with other tools that use Avro schemas by maintaining a registry of parsed and validated schema definitions.

terms.name: Schema Tester 3000
terms.description: The service that imports Target Schemas into production. Handles validation, mappings backup, and other pre-import checks.

terms.name: Schema Tester 3000
terms.description: Internal tool for safely testing and deploying target schemas. Simplifies TS validation, comparison, customer mapping export, hypothetical channel exports, and deployment. Used by PAO and Connections teams to process 400+ TSR requests monthly. Supports GUI, API, and Jira-triggered testing workflows.

terms.name: GDSN Scope File
terms.description: CSV files in Puddle that define which GDSN attributes are required/available for specific markets (countries) or retailers. Examples include 'German Market - FMCG.csv' or 'Sephora.csv'. Used to generate the Target Schema.

terms.name: Shopify ScriptTag
terms.description: A Shopify API resource that allows apps to inject JavaScript onto store pages. The Enhanced Content Shopify app uses ScriptTags to load the EC script (from ChatID CDN) on product pages. The app requires read/write ScriptTags permission.

terms.name: Schema Definition Language
terms.description: The GraphQL Schema Definition Language - a human-readable syntax for defining GraphQL schemas including types, queries, mutations, and subscriptions. SDL files are the input format used by graphql-schema-hash to generate consistent hashes.

terms.name: Sales Development Representative
terms.description: Entry-level sales role focused on outbound prospecting and qualifying leads

terms.name: Salsify Development Services
terms.description: A command-line tool used by Salsify engineers to manage local development dependencies. Used with 'sds start -g foundations' to start the foundation services needed for running services like the commerce-order-service locally. A local development tool for managing Salsify services like RabbitMQ. Used to start and manage development dependencies (e. , 'sds start -s rabbitmq').

terms.name: Salsify Development Services
terms.description: A command-line tool for managing local development services at Salsify. Used to start shared infrastructure services like postgres, kafka, avro-schema-registry, and redis required by microservices such as the Alerts Service. Used with commands like 'sds start -g foundations' to start the required dependencies for running applications locally.

terms.name: Solutions Engineer
terms.description: Technical pre-sales role that designs and demonstrates solutions for prospects

terms.name: Security Package
terms.description: A collection of customer facing security documents, including policies, procedures and letters of attestation. A SIG is normally added.

terms.name: Security Policy
terms.description: A Salsify access control mechanism that defines data-level restrictions for users. Policies contain security statements that control which products, digital assets, or locales users can access. Policies can be associated with users to restrict their data access scope. Also known as ACL (Access Control List) Policies. Managed via the Settings UI policies section.

terms.name: Security Role
terms.description: A configurable permissions entity in Salsify's organization settings that defines what actions users can perform. Roles contain permission configurations for various entities like catalogs, channels, activity reports, and more. Users can be associated with one or more roles to grant them the corresponding permissions. Managed via the Settings UI roles section.

terms.name: Sellable Product
terms.description: Includes variant and solo products. These are the products that can actually be purchased by consumers, as opposed to parent products which represent a group.

terms.name: Semantics3
terms.description: A third-party product data provider used by CPDS (Crawled Product Data Service) to query external product information. Cache management for Sem3 responses is important to avoid excessive API queries.

terms.name: Semantics3 Crawling Provider
terms.description: Third-party product data provider previously used by Salsify for crawling retailer product information. Data stored in salsify-cpds-archive-* S3 buckets and queryable via semantics3_output_products Athena table. Captures product name, brand, SKU, offers, descriptions, features, and images.

terms.name: Search Engine Optimization
terms.description: Methods used to increase a website's search engine ranking based on relevance, quality, and reliability, thereby increasing traffic.

terms.name: Service Mesh
terms.description: A dedicated infrastructure layer for handling service-to-service communication in Salsify's Kubernetes environments. Documented in the Kubernetes ADRs.

terms.name: Service Registry
terms.description: A versioned registry that contains definitions for running various datastores and required services in the local development environment. Used by 'sal devenv' to determine which containers and services to run. Includes service definitions for things like indexing-service and other infrastructure components.

terms.name: Service Security - JWT Authentication
terms.description: Ruby gem for securing inter-service communication. Handles JWT token generation via Dandelion's /api/internal/token endpoint and request header propagation.

terms.name: Service DSL - SLO Definition Language
terms.description: A Ruby DSL in pa-buddy for defining Service Level Objectives. Services include ServiceDSL module and declare app_name, guid (New Relic entity), and component configurations. Supports bucketed SLOs for segmented metrics (e.g., by endpoint, user type, or region). Components include rest_api, graphql_api, delayed_jobs, and actor_framework.

terms.name: Service Instance
terms.description: A core domain entity in infra-mgmt representing a deployed instance of a service. Has associated config for feature flagging and a cache (si_cache) for storing data from underlying systems like AWS and Kubernetes. Supports soft deletion via deleted_at column. A Salsify infrastructure concept representing a deployed instance of a service. Service instances have external identifiers and are tagged with salsify:service_instance AWS tags for resource management and tracking.

terms.name: Settings UI (Org Settings)
terms.description: Ember Micro-FrontEnd (MFE) for organization-level settings in Salsify. Provides interfaces for user management, roles, policies, user groups, activity reports, and security settings. Can be run in isolation with dummy data via shell-host or alongside Dandelion for full API integration. Uses GraphQL for backend communication with both Dandelion and Audits services. Features user tracking via MixPanel and error reporting through BugSnag.

terms.name: Salesforce Commerce Cloud
terms.description: A cloud-based e-commerce platform by Salesforce (formerly Demandware) that provides a suite of unified solutions for managing the shopping experience across web, mobile, social, and store channels. SFCC uses cartridges for customization and integrates with Salsify for product content management. E-commerce platform formerly known as Demandware. Salsify integrates with SFCC through the demandware_connector_service, which converts Salsify channel publishes into SFCC-compatible XML files including Master Catalogs, Site Catalogs, and Pricebooks. A cloud-based e-commerce platform by Salesforce that enables brands to create unified buying experiences across all channels. Salsify integrates with SFCC through the con-sfcc connector to publish product data via XML imports.

terms.name: Salesforce.com
terms.description: Salesforce.com - a cloud-based customer relationship management (CRM) platform. In Salsify context, SFDC integrations allow syncing product data and workflows between Salsify and Salesforce.

terms.name: Salesforce DX
terms.description: Salesforce Developer Experience - a set of tools and features for Salesforce development including source-driven development, scratch orgs, and CLI tools. Used for modern Salesforce development workflows.

terms.name: Secure File Transfer Protocol
terms.description: A secure protocol for transferring files over a network. The Alkemics connector uses SFTP to upload generated XML feeds to the Alkemics platform (alk-sftp.alkemics.com) for processing and distribution to retail partners. A secure file transfer protocol that provides file access, transfer, and management over SSH. Used at Salsify for secure file transfers in development and CI/CD environments via the docker-sftp container. Facilitates data access and transfer over a data stream. Requires client user authentication and secure channel for data transfer.

terms.name: SFTPGo
terms.description: An open-source, fully featured SFTP server with optional FTP/S and WebDAV support. The upstream project (drakkan/sftpgo) that Salsify's docker-sftp container is based on.

terms.name: Shared Evaluators
terms.description: Reusable evaluation components defined in the evaluation-suite repository that can be used across multiple Salsify services. Provides common evaluation logic and metrics for AI-based projects.

terms.name: Sheets+ Integration
terms.description: A type of integration where product data is exported as an Excel spreadsheet and sent to a target retailer's system. Used when retailers don't provide an API. The con-packaged-template connector handles these integrations.

terms.name: Shell Host - Local Development Host
terms.description: A lightweight development application that acts as a local Conductor host for micro-app development. Similar to how a 'dummy' app works in Ember addons, the shell host provides a compatible local development environment that simulates how the micro-app will operate in production within Salsify UI. Generated via 'ember generate conductor-shell-host' blueprint. Serves the micro-app at a subpath matching production routing.

terms.name: Sheriff (deprecated)
terms.description: Old term for Medic - the engineer on duty for handling support escalations and urgent issues.

terms.name: Shopify Location ID
terms.description: A channel setting that identifies which Shopify Location object Salsify should associate product inventory with. Required because Shopify supports multi-location inventory, but Salsify does not yet support this feature, so a single location must be specified.

terms.name: Shopify Service
terms.description: A service class (Services::ShopifyService) in con-shopify-commerce that creates and manages Shopify API clients. Can be instantiated from a ChannelConfiguration record or with direct credentials (shopify_domain, shopify_shop_id, shopify_token). Used to make GraphQL API calls to Shopify.

terms.name: Shorthand Property - Exclaim Syntax Sugar
terms.description: An optional property in ember-exclaim's implementationMap that enables concise syntax. When declared, components/helpers can be invoked using their name prefixed with $ as a key. Example: { "$text": "Hello" } instead of { "$component": "text", "content": "Hello" } when 'content' is the shorthand property.

terms.name: ServiceInstance Cache
terms.description: A key-value table in infra-mgmt that is periodically refreshed with data from underlying environments (AWS, Kubernetes). Used by the Web UI to provide reporting-lite behavior without slow real-time queries to backing systems.

terms.name: Salsify Impact Assessment
terms.description: Assessment tool to measure the impact of Salsify implementation on a customer's business

terms.name: Standard Information Gathering
terms.description: Developed by Shared Assessments. Aggregation of sheets used to answer information security questions. Used to conduct assessments of organization's security posture and risk profile.

terms.name: Silver Layer - Curated Data Tier
terms.description: The second tier in the medallion architecture containing cleaned, conformed, and transformed data. Silver models apply business logic, handle data quality, and are typically materialized as views. Naming convention: silver_{domain}__{entity}.

terms.name: Simple List
terms.description: A list of products or digital assets whose only commonality is they are on the same list. Can be added individually or in bulk, changes only when updated manually.

terms.name: Single Source of Truth
terms.description: Having one source for all information needed to publish a modern product page: marketing copy, logistics data, rich media assets, and pricing data.

terms.name: SFCC Site Catalog
terms.description: An SFCC catalog type that defines categories and category assignments for products. Generated from Salsify channel publishes containing category products. Categories are serialized along with their assignments - products are assigned to categories based on Salsify lists matching the category ID. Supports multiple sites with site-specific configurations.

terms.name: Sites & Catalogs - Core Modules Domain
terms.description: A Core Modules product domain focused on catalog management and DXP (Digital Experience Platform) functionality. Includes services: catalog-management-service. Libraries: ui-dxp-components. UI: dxp-catalog-composer-ui.

terms.name: Stock-Keeping Unit
terms.description: A unique identification number that defines a product and keeps track of it for inventory. Can designate attributes such as style, color, and size.

terms.name: Service Level Agreement
terms.description: The service contract between a service provider and a customer defining uptime/downtime ratios and expectations.

terms.name: Service Level Objective
terms.description: A target level of service reliability, typically expressed as a percentage. At Salsify, SLOs are defined using a DSL in pa-buddy and synced to New Relic. SLOs measure latency (response time thresholds) and availability (uptime percentage) for services. Threshold buckets include critical (99.9%), high (99%), medium (95%), and low (90%). Duration buckets range from fastest (0.01s) to slowest (5400s).

terms.name: Slots Mixin
terms.description: An Ember mixin provided by ember-block-slots that enables components to provide multiple yield slots. Applied to a component to allow instances to register block slots and provide named yield targets for content.

terms.name: Smart List
terms.description: A list of products or digital assets built with filters, based on commonalities of properties, states, or list membership. Membership changes based on filters applied.

terms.name: Sneakers - RabbitMQ Background Processing
terms.description: A Ruby gem used for RabbitMQ background job processing. Used by organization-activity-slack-consumer to implement workers that consume messages from queues. The SlackWorker implements the 'work' method from this gem.

terms.name: Server Name Indication
terms.description: An extension to the TLS protocol (RFC 3546) that allows a client to indicate which hostname it is attempting to connect to at the start of the handshaking process. This allows a server to present multiple certificates on the same IP address and port, enabling multiple secure websites to be served from one IP address.

terms.name: Security Operations Center / SOC Compliance
terms.description: Security compliance and audit tools in CloudOps for SOC reporting. Includes scripts for tracking GitHub members, Jenkins deploys, production deploy parsing, RDS users, and staging environment parsing to support security audit requirements. A suite of service offerings CPAs may provide in connection with system-level controls of a service organization or entity-level controls.

terms.name: System and Organization Controls 2
terms.description: An auditing procedure by AICPA that defines criteria for managing customer data based on five principles: security, availability, processing integrity, confidentiality, and privacy.

terms.name: SOC 2 Type 1
terms.description: Audit that reports on the description of a data center's system and suitability of its design of controls. Salsify has obtained this certification.

terms.name: SOC 2 Type 2
terms.description: Audit that includes everything in SOC 2 Type 1 plus the operating effectiveness of controls (auditor verifies controls actually work). Typically harder to obtain.

terms.name: Delayed::Extensions::SoftDestroyableModelCleanupJob
terms.description: A DelayedJob for hard-deleting old data that was soft-deleted past an expiration threshold. Works with SoftDestroyable models from activerecord-extensions. Supports options for max_run_time, max_deletions, and batch_size.

terms.name: Software Catalog Repository
terms.description: GitHub repository tracking all Salsify software assets as Component definitions. Components have lifecycle states: experimental, active, deprecated, and decommissioned.

terms.name: Solution Engineering
terms.description: A team at Salsify responsible for building custom solutions, integrations, and tooling for customers. SolEng develops internal gems and utilities like Muffin and Amadeus to support customer implementations, analytics reporting, and data workflows. They work closely with customer organizations to implement Salsify features and customizations. Developers that close gaps between Salsify's product and customer needs by creating integrations and custom solutions.

terms.name: Solo Product
terms.description: Products that don't have any parent/variant associations. These are standalone products that don't belong to a product family.

terms.name: Source Data Pool
terms.description: A GDSN data pool that publishes/sends product data. Salsify's Puddle operates as a source data pool, sending catalogue item notifications to recipient data pools. Responsible for registering products with the Global Registry. Validates and receives item information against the GDSN standard. Uses standard XML to register trade item information in the GS1 registry and exchange data with the recipient data pool.

terms.name: Sarbanes-Oxley
terms.description: Act requiring all financial reports to include an Internal Controls Report showing financial data accuracy (within 5% variance) and adequate safeguards.

terms.name: Service Provider
terms.description: In authentication protocols like SAML, the service provider is the application that relies on an identity provider (IdP) to authenticate users. The SP receives authentication assertions from the IdP and grants access based on those assertions.

terms.name: Selling Partner API
terms.description: Amazon's current REST-based API that replaced Marketplace Web Service (MWS). Used for accessing seller and vendor data including orders, inventory, catalog, fulfillment, and finances. The con-mws-commerce connector uses SP-API endpoints for orders (getOrders, getOrderItems), finances (listFinancialEventsByOrderId), FBA inventory, and FBM inventory feeds. SP-API allows sellers and developers to programmatically access selling partner data including listings, orders, payments, reports, and more. It adheres to modern development standards and offers improved privacy and API integration capabilities. Amazon's new API for marketplace integrations, replacing the legacy MWS (Marketplace Web Service) API. Features first-party developer support decoupled from selling accounts, OAuth authentication instead of copy/paste tokens, and standardized APIs for both 1P and 3P sellers.

terms.name: Selling Partner Developer Services
terms.description: Amazon's developer services infrastructure for the Selling Partner API (SP-API) ecosystem. SPDS provides the application framework and API credentials for developers to integrate with Amazon's selling partner services, including product data syndication, order management, and inventory updates.

terms.name: sqlboiler - Go ORM Generator
terms.description: A tool used by infra-mgmt to build a lightweight ORM around PostgreSQL table structures. The db package defines all types for interacting with the database. Generated code lives in dbgen and should not be extended directly.

terms.name: Amazon Simple Queue Service
terms.description: A fully managed message queuing service by AWS that enables decoupling and scaling of microservices, distributed systems, and serverless applications. Used by Amazon to publish alert messages when product pages change. AWS messaging queue service. CloudOps contains CloudFormation templates for SQS configuration in the cloudformation/sqs directory.

terms.name: Secure Sockets Layer
terms.description: A cryptographic protocol designed to provide communications security over a computer network. SSL certificates verify the identity of servers and enable encrypted connections. In the context of this gem, SSL certificate verification ensures you're communicating with the intended server and not an impersonator. Standard security technology for establishing an encrypted link between a web server and web user. Allows sensitive information like credit card numbers to be sent securely.

terms.name: AWS Systems Manager Parameter Store
terms.description: AWS Systems Manager's Parameter Store service used by Salsify for secure storage of configuration data and secrets. Salsify has ADRs covering the creation of direct and store secret repositories in SSM.

terms.name: Single Sign-On
terms.description: An authentication scheme that allows users to log in with a single ID to multiple related but independent software systems. SAML and OAuth2 are common protocols used to implement SSO. OmniAuth Multi Provider enables SSO scenarios with multiple identity provider instances. An authentication process that allows a user to access multiple applications through one set of login credentials.

terms.name: Schema Tester 3000
terms.description: Abbreviation for Schema Tester 3000, the internal tool used for safely testing and deploying target schemas.

terms.name: Staging Ops Environment
terms.description: A Kubernetes staging environment at Salsify for internal infrastructure services. The staging counterpart to production-ops, used for testing internal tools before production deployment.

terms.name: Starvation/Cooldown Batching Strategy
terms.description: The default batching strategy in batched_operation. cooldown_minutes: batch runs after N minutes with no new operations. starvation_minutes: batch runs regardless once oldest operation reaches this age. max_batch_size: batch runs when size threshold is reached. Prevents indefinite waiting when operations keep arriving.

terms.name: Statement Timeout
terms.description: A PostgreSQL session-level setting that specifies the maximum execution time for any single statement. If a statement runs longer than this timeout, it is aborted. Used by activerecord-safer_migrations to prevent long-running DDL operations from blocking other queries. Default is 1500ms.

terms.name: StatusCake - Uptime Monitoring Service
terms.description: An external monitoring service used by Salsify to monitor AlertManager uptime. Push alerts are configured to forward to PagerDuty when adding new environments to the kube-prometheus stack.

terms.name: Step Template
terms.description: Configurable templates for individual steps within a workflow. Defined in app/models/content_flow/step_templates in content-flow-service. Updated via rake db:migrate which re-imports all step templates.

terms.name: Single Table Inheritance
terms.description: A database design pattern in ActiveRecord/Rails where multiple model classes share a single database table, distinguished by a 'type' column. STI allows object-oriented inheritance to be mapped to a relational database. This can cause issues with eager loading when different subclasses have different associations.

terms.name: Same Time Last Quarter
terms.description: Used on Clari. Comparison metric against the same point in the previous quarter.

terms.name: Same Time Last Year
terms.description: Used on Clari. Comparison metric against the same point in the previous year.

terms.name: Strong Migrations - Safe Database Changes
terms.description: Ruby gem referenced for understanding database migration safety. Helps identify potentially dangerous schema changes on large tables.

terms.name: Struct Splitting
terms.description: A feature in Salsify's Target Schema system that handles the splitting of structured data (structs) for export. Includes settings for toggle fields, applicable scopes, scope translation, boolean toggles, and skip toggles. Used when complex product data needs to be split across multiple records during channel export.

terms.name: Stuck Event Group
terms.description: A root event group that has not been finalized within a configured time threshold (default: 1 hour). The Event Group Service monitors for stuck event groups and reports them as custom metrics events. This typically indicates an issue with event ordering or incomplete event processing by client applications.

terms.name: Sub-agents - Claude Context Isolation Pattern
terms.description: A context engineering technique where separate Claude agents are used to isolate context windows. Sub-agents can perform tasks like searching and grepping large numbers of files, returning only curated results to the parent agent without polluting its context window with intermediate search results.

terms.name: GDSN Subscription
terms.description: A GDSN record received via Catalogue Item Subscription message from a recipient data pool. Specifies which products the recipient wants to receive, filtered by content owner GLN, target market, GPC, and/or GTIN. Triggers synchronization when publications match.

terms.name: Superuser
terms.description: An elevated administrative role in Salsify with access to the admin console at app.salsify.com/admin. Superusers can manage organizations, users, tokens, and other administrative functions. Authentication can be done via Google SSO, and superuser access tokens are managed at app.salsify.com/admin/tokens. A privileged Salsify user role with elevated access permissions, typically used by Salsify employees for internal support and administration tasks. Superusers have API tokens that grant access to organization data across the platform.

terms.name: Superuser Token - Interservice Authentication
terms.description: A ksonnify configuration option that, when enabled per environment, attaches an 'etc-secrets' secret to /etc/secrets of each running pod. Used by Dandelion's auth service to expose and automatically rotate credentials for interservice communication between Salsify services.

terms.name: Superuser Token
terms.description: An administrative API token created at /admin/tokens in Salsify environments. Used by manifest-scripts and other internal tools to access manifest APIs with elevated privileges. Will eventually be replaced by partner/customer-facing API tokens when manifest APIs are publicly exposed.

terms.name: Superuser Permissions DSL
terms.description: A domain-specific language (DSL) in Dandelion for defining and managing superuser (admin) permissions. Follows attribute-based access control (ABAC) patterns with policies, statements, and conditions. Supports organization-scoped and resource-scoped authorization, with automatic GraphQL API generation for authorization checks.

terms.name: Supplier Sync - Audit Endpoint
terms.description: A Salsify service with an audit endpoint used to extract updated digital asset IDs and corresponding product IDs. Used in the Essendant image export workflow to identify which assets have changed.

terms.name: Supplier Experience Management
terms.description: A platform of product data management solutions at the intersection of a supplier's data and retailers, allowing them to collect, centralize, list, enrich and publish product data.

terms.name: SupportIQ - Support Intelligence Dashboard
terms.description: An internal Salsify dashboard system providing support team intelligence by aggregating data from Zendesk support tickets, Salesforce account information, and Salsify organization/user data. Tracks metrics including power users (frequent ticket submitters), ticket severity by organization, user-account associations, customer health scores, login patterns, and Skilljar training course activity. Part of the lake-supportiq data pipeline.

terms.name: Svalbard Backup Gem
terms.description: A Salsify Ruby gem used for taking backups of services. Sideloaded into the avro-schema-registry Docker container to enable backup functionality for the schema registry service.

terms.name: Svalbard - Test Environment Service
terms.description: A Salsify service for managing test environments. Includes support for Elasticsearch 7 and handles types deprecation in the test environment infrastructure.

terms.name: Supply Experience Management (Terraform)
terms.description: In the terraform context, SXM refers to Azure-based infrastructure modules for SupplierXM environments. Includes modules like sxm-asg (auto-scaling groups), sxm-lb (load balancers), sxm-vm (virtual machines), sxm-vnet (virtual networks), sxm-redis, sxm-environment, and sxm-storage. SXM environments include sxm-dev, sxm-int, sxm-ltg, sxm-meta, sxm-ppr, and sxm-prd. A Salsify service that has been migrated to managed MySQL. Referenced in infrastructure ADRs for database migration decisions. Platform for managing supplier experiences and data.

terms.name: GDSN Synchronization
terms.description: The process and record of exchanging product data between a source and recipient data pool in GDSN. Created when a subscription matches a publication. Tracked via CIN/CIC message exchange. Status includes feedback from the recipient.

terms.name: Syndicated Product Liveness Events
terms.description: An insights product supported by the Compliance Reporting Engine that tracks product liveness status across syndication channels. Uses a multi-stage processing architecture with dedicated database and events schemas (LMV system).

terms.name: Syndication
terms.description: Pushing product data to all end channels. Example: sending all product attributes (descriptions and digital assets) downstream to Lowes.com or a Print Catalog.

terms.name: Syndication Gateway
terms.description: A service responsible for routing publications destined for connector services coming out of Dandelion. It determines which connector service a given publish should be sent to based on configuration and ensures the connector gets all information needed for successful publishing.

terms.name: Syndication Metrics
terms.description: A data lake database containing metrics about product syndication at Salsify. Includes tables like 'publication_status' that track publication events with fields such as organization ID, publication ID, event time, status, and status details. Data is sourced from 's3://salsify-syndication-metrics-production/archiver/syndication_metrics' in JSONL format.

terms.name: Syndication Gateway
terms.description: A connector service router that directs publications leaving Dandelion to the appropriate connector services and routes feedback back from connectors. It handles payload routing through configurable policies (Direct, HTTP, FTP, S3, External Storage), manages publication status updates, and processes product/attribute feedback. The service uses RabbitMQ for message passing and supports policy-based routing based on connector type and target schema.

terms.name: Syndication Stream Slack Channel
terms.description: A Slack channel that receives notifications about syndication activity events, specifically publishes with Target Schemas. Messages are sent by the organization-activity-slack-consumer service.

terms.name: System ID
terms.description: An internal unique identifier assigned to a Salsify organization by the system. Used alongside external IDs to reference organizations in different contexts. Can be copied in email format (system_id@salsify.com) for admin login purposes.

terms.name: System Message ID
terms.description: A unique identifier required on all messages published to Kafka in salsify_kafka. Enables idempotent message processing by ensuring duplicate messages with the same ID are ignored within the retention window.

terms.name: Tailor - Amadeus Fork
terms.description: A fork of Amadeus with custom behavior, mostly developed by the Connections team. Used for Target Schema generation before YACHTS. Like Amadeus, limited by direct TSDL manipulation without separation between structure and representation.

terms.name: Total Addressable Market
terms.description: The total market demand for a product or service, representing the maximum revenue opportunity available.

terms.name: Target Market (GDSN)
terms.description: In GDSN, identifies the geographic market where a product is sold. Combined with content owner GLN, GPC, and GTIN to determine subscription matching. Used to select appropriate scope files for schema validation.

terms.name: Target Plus Marketplace
terms.description: Target's third-party marketplace platform where sellers can list and sell products on Target.com. Salsify integrates with Target Plus to enable content publishing, inventory management, and order processing for marketplace sellers.

terms.name: Target Schema - Channel Data Structure Definition
terms.description: A data structure in Salsify that defines the required format and fields for product data being sent to a specific destination or channel. Target schemas ensure product data conforms to retailer or marketplace requirements. Examples include 'salsify_open_catalog', 'albertsons_direct_connection_psxm', and 'doordash_direct_connection'. A structured definition of the data format required by a specific retail channel. Contains TargetSchemaFields (individual data points), TargetSchemaFieldGroups (logical groupings of fields), and supports nested structures. Used in channel mapping to transform Salsify product data into retailer-specific formats. Con-shopify can generate target schemas using 'rake target_schema:generate' and import them into Dandelion using 'rake target_schema:import'. The schema defines how Salsify product attributes map to Shopify product fields. Salsify's internal representation of GDSN attribute schemas. Generated from GS1-provided XSD files and scope files. Defines which attributes are available for different markets, retailers, and product categories. Generated via rake tasks in Puddle. A way for Salsify engineers to encode retailer requirements. Can be updated automatically (through API) or manually. Determines what attributes are allowed/required for publishing.

terms.name: Target Seller API
terms.description: Target's API used by Salsify for publishing products and syncing inventory/orders on the Target Plus marketplace.

terms.name: Target Seller ID
terms.description: Unique identifier for a seller's account on the Target Plus marketplace. Found in the Target marketplace seller portal and always required for channel configuration.

terms.name: Target Seller Token
terms.description: API access token used by Salsify when interacting with the Target Plus API on behalf of a seller. Generated by the seller via the Target Plus portal and treated as sensitive/secured data.

terms.name: Target Taxonomy API
terms.description: Target's API for fetching data about product categories, fields, and their requirements. Used by Salsify to generate target schemas containing all fields, product categories (taxonomies), field visibility/requirements per taxonomy, and enum values.

terms.name: Target Schema Importer
terms.description: A Ruby gem that simplifies the process of importing new or existing Target Schemas into Salsify. It connects to the TS Validation Proxy service to perform imports, supporting both synchronous and asynchronous operations. Required parameters include target schema external ID, URL to the schema JSON, organization ID, and for new schemas: name and destination domain. Optional features include associating connector services, importing templates, and callback notifications.

terms.name: Target Schema Generator
terms.description: A base class in Amadeus that initializes an amadeus_schema object for building Target Schemas. Classes inherit from Amadeus::TargetSchemaGenerator to create custom Target Schema generators with access to schema composition methods.

terms.name: Target Schema Importer
terms.description: A library used by YACHTS to import Target Schemas to Dandelion. Supports both synchronous and asynchronous imports. Handles S3 uploads for TS JSON and metadata files, versioning via TS tags, and integration with TS Validation Proxy.

terms.name: Target Schema Mapping - Channel Field Mapping Configuration
terms.description: The configuration that maps Salsify product attributes to target schema fields for a specific channel. Contains mapping entries that can be formulas, direct property mappings, or complex nested structures (ArrayMappingEntry, StructMappingEntry). Supports analysis-based filtering and grouping.

terms.name: Target Schemas
terms.description: A component in the SFCC connector that handles schema imports. The connector exposes a REST API for enqueueing TargetSchemaImportJob operations, using JWT authentication that is organization-scoped.

terms.name: Target Schemas Writer Registry
terms.description: A Ruby module in con-packaged-template that provides the define_excel_row_writer method for registering Excel DSL definitions. Used to configure how target schema data is written to Excel worksheets, including template location, worksheet selection, start row, and column mappings.

terms.name: TASER - Target Schema Requests Backend
terms.description: A Ruby on Rails service that creates Target Schema request tickets in Zendesk and Jira. Handles the workflow when customers need to create or update Target Schemas via an in-app request form. Collects structured data (channel name, destination, purpose, Excel templates) and drives internal automation including ticket creation, repo matching, auto-build, and auto-deploy workflows. Proxied through Dandelion for JWT authentication.

terms.name: Task Configuration
terms.description: Configuration entity in content-flow-service that defines how tasks are set up within workflows. Has property dependencies that are tracked via the dependency-service for managing reports and destroyed dependencies.

terms.name: Task Sidebar Component
terms.description: A UI component from the @salsify/workflow-task-runtime package that displays task details in a sidebar. Host applications conditionally render this component based on the workflowTaskRuntime.shouldDisplayTaskSidebar property.

terms.name: Target Distribution Center ID
terms.description: Identifier for a Target Plus Distribution Center object that Salsify uses when publishing product inventory. Required for inventory/orders integration but not for content publish only.

terms.name: Target Corporation Identification Number
terms.description: Typically an 8 digit unique stock keeping identifier that Target uses to identify products. Visible on target.com product pages in the Specifications section.

terms.name: TechDocs - Technical Documentation
terms.description: MkDocs-based documentation hosting on the Engineering Portal. Used for publishing internal documentation from repository docs folders. Served via techdocs-cli for local preview.

terms.name: EC Template
terms.description: A generic blueprint that customers use to create an Enhanced Content Layout. Templates provide the initial UI structure and are composed of ModuleTemplates (modules). Salsify offers several pre-defined Templates, plus a 'Build your own' Template that allows users to add and remove modules freely. Templates are defined in the app/models/t directory.

terms.name: Template Library
terms.description: A Salsify feature that provides access to pre-built workflow templates and configurations. Users can browse, install, and customize templates from the Template Library to set up common workflows without starting from scratch.

terms.name: Templated Exports
terms.description: A feature in Salsify that allows exporting product data to templated formats. Unlike packaged template writers, Templated Exports can include parent products. Used as an alternative to packaged template writers for certain retailers like Amazon Seller Sheets, Overstock Offertool, and Overstock Oasis.

terms.name: Temporal - Workflow Engine
terms.description: A workflow orchestration engine adopted by Salsify for managing long-running workflows and activities. Used for scheduled workflows and provides time-bound access to the Temporal API. Integrated with the Infrastructure Management Service.

terms.name: Terraform Definitions
terms.description: Repository containing Terraform code for managing cloud resources for all managed Amazon and Azure accounts at Salsify. Includes modules for AWS/Azure infrastructure, microservices, data pipelines, and SXM (SupplierXM) environments. Organized into accounts/ (cloud account-level config), environments/ (Infrastructure Management Platform environments), services/ (service instance resources), and modules/ (reusable golden path configurations).

terms.name: Terraform Prosody - Chat Infrastructure
terms.description: Terraform configuration repository for Salsify Chat infrastructure, including the Log Service 1.7 workspace configuration. Managed by the chatid organization and used for deploying chat-related services.

terms.name: Test and Learn
terms.description: A set of practices followed by retailers, banks and other consumer-focused companies to test ideas in a small number of locations or customers to predict impact.

terms.name: Ephemeral Test Environment
terms.description: Temporary isolated environment for testing at Salsify with unique URLs like https://harmless-rotunda-4242.test.salsify.com/. Separate from staging and production.

terms.name: Delayed::Extensions::TestUtils
terms.description: A module providing test utilities for DelayedJob testing. Includes process_delayed_jobs (runs queued jobs with configurable max_attempts, max_num_jobs, raise_job_exceptions) and process_delayed_jobs! (raises exception if no jobs runnable or any fail).

terms.name: Thanos - Prometheus Long-term Storage
terms.description: A highly available Prometheus setup with long-term storage capabilities. At Salsify, the Thanos stack includes thanos-sidecar (configured through Prometheus build.jsonnet), thanos-query, thanos-query-frontend, thanos-store-gateway (in Ops clusters), and thanos-compactor (in all clusters). Uses Bitnami Helm charts for deployment. Deployed alongside Prometheus in the monitoring namespace of the production Kubernetes cluster. Enables cross-cluster metric aggregation and historical data retention. A highly available Prometheus setup with long-term storage capabilities, used by Salsify for Prometheus data retention and metrics aggregation across clusters.

terms.name: Timeseries Service
terms.description: Salsify service for storing time-series data as archived events. Uses Avro serialization format with system_message_id (UUID), system_message_timestamp, and JSON payload. Data stored in S3 (salsify-timeseries-service-*) and queryable via timeseries_crawled_products Athena table.

terms.name: Timeseries Service
terms.description: A Rails service for ingesting and querying timeseries data. Reads data from Kafka topics, asynchronously indexes it into Elasticsearch, and archives data into S3. Exposes GraphQL endpoints to query data in Elasticsearch. Used by the Analytics Team for ingesting and querying crawled-product data.

terms.name: Transport Layer Security
terms.description: The successor protocol to SSL. An improved version that uses encryption to protect the transfer of data and information.

terms.name: Toll Road
terms.description: When brands are required to pay a third party to activate product content

terms.name: Touchpoint
terms.description: A retailer, direct to consumer website, or other endpoint where brand manufacturers deliver product content

terms.name: terraform-production CLI
terms.description: Command-line tool for running Terraform commands with the appropriate environment configuration and provider tokens. Located in tools/terraform-production within the terraform repository. Commonly symlinked to ~/.local/bin/tprod for easier access.

terms.name: Trace One
terms.description: A company that connects retailers, manufacturers, and suppliers to accelerate product innovation and create supply chain transparency for private label and national brands.

terms.name: Track Changes
terms.description: A workflow tool that highlights differences between versions of content. Green background shows content added since the compared version, red strikethrough shows content removed.

terms.name: Trading Partner
terms.description: A common term for any entity sending/receiving item data via GDSN data pool. Can be manufacturers, retailers, distributors, or other supply chain participants.

terms.name: Traffic Report
terms.description: A reporting feature within the Page Event Reporting Engine that provides analytics on retailer page traffic. Requires data to be loaded through the page-event-reporting-etl pipeline in staging and production environments.

terms.name: Transactional Kafka Delivery Mode
terms.description: A delivery mode in email_service_client that uses the Event Publisher to write email requests to an event_publisher_events database table before asynchronously publishing to Kafka. Enables atomic email requests with database state changes but requires running an event_publisher process.

terms.name: Trap Delivery Mode
terms.description: A delivery mode in email_service_client used for testing that does not send emails to Kafka at all. Default deliverer in test mode to prevent actual email sending during tests.

terms.name: Target Schema
terms.description: In connector contexts, TS is the abbreviation for Target Schema - the structured definition of data fields required by a retail channel. For Clavis, the TS is dynamically generated from retailer information stored in S3, containing fields for applicable retailers, UPC-level fields per market, and RPC-level fields per retailer. A JSON schema definition that describes the data structure and fields expected by a connector destination. Target schemas are generated from data model files and lookup files, defining the mapping between Salsify product attributes and the destination system's requirements. In the context of Schema Tester 3000 and Salsify Connections, TS refers to Target Schema - a way to encode retailer requirements that determines what attributes are allowed/required for publishing to a channel. The schema definition that specifies the data format and requirements for a retail channel. Used to validate and transform product data before publishing.

terms.name: Target Schema Constraint
terms.description: A validation rule in Salsify Target Schemas that defines requirements for field values. Supported constraint types include: allowed/disallowed character regexes, GTIN format validation (UPC, GTIN8, GTIN12, GTIN13, GTIN14), max/min length, max/min value, max/min number of values, max decimal places, max/min combined length, and relative min/max values. Constraints can be data-type specific and support value paths for compound fields.

terms.name: Target Schema Field
terms.description: A field definition in a Salsify Target Schema. Fields have properties including: external_id, name, description (plain or HTML), data_type (string, enumerated, boolean, digital_asset, number, date, link, compound, html, rich_text, struct), required status, classifier status, parent_id, hidden/read_only flags, applicable_scopes, field_values, requirements (constraints), and position. For packaged templates, fields also support columns, data_formatting, custom_formula, and splitting_setting.

terms.name: Target Schema Validation Proxy
terms.description: An internal Salsify service that handles Target Schema validation and import operations. It provides authenticated endpoints for exporting and importing Target Schemas, exporting mappings, and associating Target Schemas with connector services. Access is controlled via auth tokens that specify allowed scripts (export_target_schema, import_target_schema, export_mappings_for_target_schema, associate_target_schema_connector_service) and allowed organizations. An internal Salsify service used by YACHTS to import Target Schemas to Dandelion. Handles validation, dry runs, and the actual import process. YACHTS leverages TargetSchemaImporter which internally uses this proxy service.

terms.name: Target Schema Workbook
terms.description: A component of Salsify Target Schemas that organizes fields into workbook structures, similar to Excel workbooks. Part of the Salsify Tailor gem's Target Schema generation capabilities, workbooks contain worksheets for organizing and presenting Target Schema fields.

terms.name: Target Schema Generator Core
terms.description: A Salsify library used to generate target schema files from templates and configuration. Used by the Best Buy HPI Target Schema Updater to create target schemas from downloaded Best Buy templates.

terms.name: TSA - Target Schema Automation Team
terms.description: The team responsible for building and maintaining Target Schemas based on customer requests. TASER passes template information and structured data to the TSA team through Jira tickets. The system aims to eventually automate TS generation without human intervention. A role focused on analyzing, creating, and maintaining Target Schemas for retail channels.

terms.name: Technical Solution Design
terms.description: Engineering-focused document capturing technical decisions including feature flags for incremental release and operational controls. Shared in #eng-docs Slack channel.

terms.name: Target Schema Definition Language
terms.description: The JSON-based specification language that defines the structure and format of Target Schemas at Salsify. Specifies how fields, conditions, validations, and picklists are represented in JSON format. YACHTS uses Representers to transform internal structures into TSDL-compliant JSON.

terms.name: Target Schema Generation
terms.description: The process of creating Target Schema JSON files for retail channels. Can be done using YACHTS, Amadeus, Tailor, or other tools. YACHTS provides separation between TSGen creation and representation, allowing optimizations and versioning to be applied transparently.

terms.name: TSR - Target Schema Request (Engineering)
terms.description: A customer request to create or update a Target Schema. Submitted through an in-app form that collects channel name, destination, purpose, and Excel templates. Creates tickets in Zendesk, Jira, and Salesforce. The TSR system tracks request status through various stages: new, creating_case, found_jira, monorail_ingesting, repo_matching, auto_building, and auto_deploy statuses. Note: In Sales context, TSR means Technical Sales Representative. A Jira ticket type used by the PAO team to track target schema update requests. TSR tickets can trigger automated testing in Schema Tester 3000 when transitioned to Testing status. A request to create or modify a Target Schema, typically submitted through a formal process.

terms.name: Technical Sales Representative
terms.description: Field sales role focused on technical product demonstrations and customer solutions

terms.name: Target Schema Request Automation
terms.description: Automation for handling Target Schema Requests, streamlining the creation and modification of Target Schemas.

terms.name: Tab-Separated Values
terms.description: A file format used by the Google Shopping connector to serialize product data for publishing. The TSV serializer supports publishing variant information to Google.

terms.name: Tuples Over Limit
terms.description: A metric from postgres-vacuum-monitor indicating how many dead tuples exceed the auto vacuum threshold. When this value is high, it suggests the auto vacuum daemon is not keeping up with the rate of dead tuple generation, potentially indicating a need to tune vacuum settings.

terms.name: Unified Admin Graph
terms.description: A unified GraphQL schema for admin operations powered by the GraphQL Gateway. Unlike other admin GraphQL endpoints, it does not support local development and schema updates are pulled from production. Accessed via app.salsify.com/unified/admin/graphql with a superuser access token.

terms.name: Micro-Frontend
terms.description: A frontend architecture pattern used at Salsify where the UI is composed of independently deployable frontend modules. Each micro-frontend can be developed, tested, and deployed separately. At Salsify, micro-frontends are deployed using the deployMicroFrontend Jenkins pipeline.

terms.name: UI Alchemy
terms.description: Salsify library that enables extension points for micro-frontends, allowing other teams to extend core UI functionality without modifying the host codebase. Used by channels-ui to support features from teams like activation accelerators, GDSN, and Sites/DXP.

terms.name: UI Commerce Dashboard Components
terms.description: Shared component library for commerce dashboard UI elements. Used by commerce-ui for Dashboard page functionality.

terms.name: UI Error Reporting
terms.description: An Ember addon library for capturing and reporting unhandled errors in Salsify UI applications. Integrates with BugSnag for error tracking and monitoring across front-end micro apps.

terms.name: @salsify/graphql-client - JavaScript GraphQL Client
terms.description: Salsify-idiomatic GraphQL client for JavaScript UI clients. Provides consistent API interaction patterns for frontend applications.

terms.name: @salsify/graphql-type-generator - TypeScript Generator
terms.description: Tool for generating TypeScript declarations from GraphQL operation documents. Provides end-to-end type safety for frontend GraphQL usage.

terms.name: UI Habanero
terms.description: Salsify's shared UI component library used across front-end applications including commerce-ui. Provides reusable React/Ember components for consistent user interface design.

terms.name: UI User Tracking
terms.description: An Ember addon library for tracking user interaction events across Salsify UI applications. Used by analytics-reporting-ui and other front-end micro apps to capture user activity data.

terms.name: Universal Properties
terms.description: A Salsify feature that provides standardized property definitions that can be used across products and categories. Part of the Grocery Accelerator feature set, Universal Properties help ensure consistent data structures across product catalogs.

terms.name: Unstructured - Document Loading Library
terms.description: A Python library highly recommended at Salsify for loading and cleaning documents of various types into structured, parseable Python objects. Supports many document formats for AI and NLP processing pipelines.

terms.name: Universal Product Code
terms.description: A barcode symbology widely used in US, Canada, UK, Australia, NZ for tracking trade items. Most common form (UPC-A) consists of 12 numerical digits uniquely assigned to each item.

terms.name: Uptime
terms.description: The percentage of time that hardware or software is operating successfully. SLAs may define uptime/downtime ratios.

terms.name: Usage Tag
terms.description: A required parameter when fetching product data from CPDS that identifies the calling service. Used for tracking and reporting which services are consuming crawled product data (e.g., 'some-reporting-engine').

terms.name: User
terms.description: An entity (usually a person) that has authority to operate something, such as an application. In SaaS context, refers to individuals with access to the platform.

terms.name: User Group
terms.description: A grouping mechanism in Salsify for organizing users together. User groups simplify user management by allowing bulk operations and easier organization of users with similar characteristics or responsibilities. Users can belong to multiple user groups. Managed via the Settings UI user-groups section.

terms.name: User Reference Report
terms.description: A report in Salsify that shows references and associations for users within an organization. Can be initiated from the user index actions menu in the Settings UI. Useful for auditing user configurations and permissions.

terms.name: User Repository (Dandelion)
terms.description: A service within Dandelion that manages user data. The Alerts Service queries it to retrieve user information (email, enabled status) and receives events when users are destroyed.

terms.name: Delayed::Extensions::UserContextPlugin (Deprecated)
terms.description: A deprecated DelayedJob plugin that runs jobs in the context of a user_id and superuser_id using rails-multitenant. Extracts user_id and superuser_id from jobs and sets them in GlobalContextRegistry for all lifecycle hooks. Use JobSecurityContextPlugin instead.

terms.name: User Scoped Operation Type
terms.description: A batched_operation extension (Batched::Extensions::UserScopedOperationType) for user-scoped work. Automatically pulls user_id from RailsMultitenant and uses it as a key_attribute. Scheduled jobs respect organization fairness.

terms.name: Vision Values Methods Obstacles Measures
terms.description: Salsify's governing goals framework covering Vision, Values, Methods, Obstacles, and Measures

terms.name: Validations
terms.description: Rules available with governance capabilities to ensure data quality and completeness. Validates product data against defined requirements before syndication.

terms.name: Value Mapping
terms.description: A spreadsheet-based mechanism in Salsify that allows customers to map their Property Values to a retailer's Enumerated Field Values. Stored in S3 and tracked in the data lake. Each Value Mapping stores the valid Enumerated Values from the time it was created, serving as a snapshot of valid options.

links.description: Customer Value Mapping Entry Counts by Field (Redash)

terms.name: Variant
terms.description: Sellable products associated with parents. Contains properties unique to the variant (e.g., size, color). Parent/variant functionality not enabled in all orgs.

terms.name: View DSL - FlowBuilder UI Definition Language
terms.description: A domain-specific language in FlowBuilder that simplifies the process of writing Ember Exclaim UI components. Provides Ruby methods for building views with components like vbox, header, text, and input. Used within controllers via the build_view helper to define task user interfaces.

terms.name: Vendor Item Portal (Kroger)
terms.description: Kroger's vendor item portal system where suppliers upload product information via Excel templates. The con-kroger-vip connector generates these Excel files for Salsify customers to upload to Kroger VIP.

terms.name: Virtual Private Cloud
terms.description: AWS networking construct used to isolate Salsify's cloud resources. CloudOps contains CloudFormation templates for VPC infrastructure including ops_vpc_infrastructure.json, vpc_infrastructure_v1.json, and vpc_infrastructure_v2.json, as well as VPC peering configurations.

terms.name: Vendor Self-Service Catalog
terms.description: Amazon Vendor Self-Service Catalog

terms.name: Vulnerability Testing
terms.description: Testing to identify weaknesses in information systems, security procedures, or internal controls that could be exploited. Can be manual or automated with vulnerability scanners.

terms.name: Walmart Marketplace v4 Target Schema
terms.description: The current Target Schema for Walmart Marketplace integration in Dandelion, introduced when Salsify upgraded from Walmart Item Spec 3.X to 4.X. All customers were migrated from the legacy 'Walmart Marketplace' target schema to this v4 version. Generated from Walmart Item Spec JSON files using a rake task in con-walmart-commerce.

terms.name: Walmart OmniSpec Direct Connection
terms.description: The unified Walmart connection platform in con-u that includes the Walmart Marketplace Item Spec 5 Direct Connection. Supersedes the legacy Walmart Marketplace Direct Connection functionality that was previously in con-walmart-commerce.

terms.name: Walmart Online Grocery
terms.description: Formerly Walmart To Go. Service allowing customers to shop online for grocery and in-store products and pick them up at available store locations.

terms.name: Waterfall
terms.description: Sales term representing the levers to get to target booking. 4 stages: Qualified Contact, Salsa, Dollarized Opp, Won.

terms.name: Webhook Alert Notification
terms.description: A type of alert in Salsify that sends HTTP webhook callbacks when products or digital assets matching specified criteria are added, updated, or deleted. Configured through the Alerts Service and delivered via the Webhook Service. Part of the broader Salsify Alerts functionality. An alert notification delivery mechanism in the Alerts Service that sends HTTP webhook requests when subscribed events occur. Webhook requests are published to Kafka and dispatched by the Webhook Service with appropriate failure handling and retries.

terms.name: Webhook Service
terms.description: A service responsible for sending webhook callbacks on behalf of Salsify platform components. Handles retry logic with exponential back-off for up to 48 hours, logs request/response attempts, and processes WebhookRequest messages from Kafka. Used by Import Notifications, Channel Notifications, and Webhook Alerts to deliver HTTP callbacks to customer endpoints. A Salsify service that handles webhook invocations for alerts, imports, and publish events. It is the primary source of Salsify-signed webhooks that dandy-1000 processes. Webhooks are signed according to Salsify's webhook signing specification. A Salsify microservice that listens to Kafka for webhook requests and dispatches them to configured endpoints with appropriate failure handling and retries. Used by the Alerts Service to send webhook alert notifications.

terms.name: Webhook Request
terms.description: An Avro message published to the webhook_requests Kafka topic to request sending a webhook callback. Contains details about the target URL, payload, and requesting_entity (such as an import or webhook alert). Processed by the Webhook Service which handles delivery and retries.

terms.name: Webhook Request Cancellation
terms.description: An Avro message published to the webhook_request_cancellations Kafka topic to cancel pending webhook requests. Can cancel requests for a particular version or all versions of a requesting_entity.

terms.name: Webmerge - Document Generation Service
terms.description: A third-party document generation service that integrates with Salsify through enhance-plus. Used to generate PDF, Word, and Excel documents from Salsify product data. The enhance-plus integration extends the standard Webmerge capabilities with bulk document generation via channel mapping.

terms.name: Welcome ETL Pipeline
terms.description: A data pipeline that produces ORC formatted files containing page events. The page-event-reporting-etl job reads from this pipeline's output stored in S3 at s3://welcome-prod-etl/orc/clientevents/. Data is partitioned by date and hour.

terms.name: Worldwide Environmental Regulatory Compliance Solutions
terms.description: Assessments required for products that may contain hazardous materials

terms.name: WildCats Team
terms.description: A Salsify engineering team focused on experimental and exploratory projects. Known for developing proof-of-concept features and innovations such as embedding-based property recommendations.

terms.name: Worker Heartbeat - Delayed Job Health Check
terms.description: A mechanism in the delayed_job_heartbeat_plugin where workers periodically send signals (heartbeats) to indicate they are alive and processing. Configurable options include heartbeat_interval_seconds (how often to heartbeat, default 60s), heartbeat_timeout_seconds (threshold for considering workers dead, default 180s), and worker_termination_enabled (whether workers should self-terminate if they detect their own heartbeat failure).

terms.name: Worker Pool - Forked Process Pool
terms.description: A pattern for running multiple forked worker processes from a single master process. In delayed_job_worker_pool, this allows efficient resource sharing through preloading code before forking, with lifecycle callbacks for initialization and cleanup. Each worker group can be configured with different queue assignments and Delayed Job parameters.

terms.name: Workflow
terms.description: A sequence of steps/tasks necessary to complete a specific process or project. Technology coordinates and automates how tasks move from phase to phase.

terms.name: Workflow Template
terms.description: A pre-built workflow configuration in Salsify that can be installed and customized for specific use cases. Workflow templates are available through the Template Library and can be associated with App Center applications through the WorkflowTypeLinkInstallationMethod. QA workflows are an example of workflow templates used in the Grocery Accelerator.

terms.name: Workflow UI
terms.description: A monorepo containing packages for the Salsify workflow feature set. Uses yarn workspaces to manage multiple packages including @salsify/workflow, @salsify/workflow-ui, @salsify/workflow-task-runtime, and @salsify/workflow-exclaim-components. The @salsify/workflow-ui package is a microfrontend that is deployed independently.

terms.name: Workflow Bulk Operations Service
terms.description: An Ember service in the @salsify/workflow package that provides methods for bulk task operations including reassignTasks, closeTasks, completeTasks, and addToWorkflow. Uses Ember Evented to trigger events when tasks are reassigned, closed, completed, or workflows are created.

terms.name: Workflow Task Runtime Service
terms.description: An Ember service in the @salsify/workflow-task-runtime package that manages runtime task state. Provides getters/setters for activeTaskId and activeTaskParams, methods for showing/hiding the task sidebar, and utilities for serializing/deserializing task parameters. Triggers events like task:closed, task:completed, and task:reassigned.

terms.name: World Interface - Dependency Injection
terms.description: A special interface in infra-mgmt's internal/edge/inframgmt package for creating all external dependencies during application startup. Allows creating a mirror image of dependencies for end-to-end testing that stubs out and asserts external behaviors.

terms.name: XDR
terms.description: Umbrella term for ADR and BDR roles at Salsify. Used because there are two official names: ADR (Enterprise/Strategic Upsell) and BDR (New Business).

terms.name: XML Feed
terms.description: A structured data format used for exchanging product information with external systems. In the Alkemics connector, XML feeds are generated from Salsify product data following the Alkemics SupplierProducts schema, including product attributes like GTIN, packaging details, nutritional information, and localized content in multiple languages.

terms.name: YACHTS - Yet Another Compassionate Hammer for Target Schemas
terms.description: A Ruby gem for manipulating, optimizing, and importing Target Schemas. Provides a clear separation between Target Schema structure and representation, enabling logical optimizations for conditions, automatic versioning, and metadata support. Can build Target Schemas from scratch, import existing JSON TS, or convert from JSON Schema 2020-12 format. Replaces older tools like Amadeus and Tailor.

terms.name: Yachts Condition - Logical Expression System
terms.description: A system in YACHTS for representing and optimizing logical conditions in Target Schemas. Supports AND, OR, Present, Blank, Simple conditions, and If-Then-Else logic. Conditions can be resolved (optimized), evaluated, inverted, and represented as YCL strings or JSON. Used for visible_if, required_if, and validation conditions.

terms.name: YAML ETL
terms.description: A module in lake-jobs that processes disparate data sources into partitioned Athena tables. Reads YAML datasource configs from the datasource-configs repository, dynamically generates Dagster assets, and creates schedules for each datasource. Uses Dask for parallel processing of CSV and JSONL files.

terms.name: Yachts Condition Language
terms.description: A human-readable string representation of YACHTS conditions. Used for debugging and displaying condition logic. Examples: 'AND(field_a = "this", field_b = "that")' or 'PRESENT(field_c) = TRUE'. Generated via the #to_ycl method on condition objects.

terms.name: Yield Slot Component
terms.description: A component provided by ember-block-slots used in the parent component template to define named yield targets. Wraps content with surrounding layout and provides a named slot where block-slot content will be rendered. Supports defaults, conditional slots, block params, positional params, hash params, contextual components, and closure actions.

terms.name: Year-Month-Day Partitioning
terms.description: A partitioning scheme (YYYY/MM/DD) used for organizing larger data sources in the Salsify data lake S3 buckets. Used by datasources like NewRelic and syndication metrics.

terms.name: Apache Zookeeper - Kafka Coordination Service
terms.description: A distributed coordination service used by Kafka for cluster management at Salsify. Deployed as 3 nodes in an Auto Scaling Group via OpsWorks. Manages Kafka broker metadata, leader election, and cluster coordination.
